loans.name: Kert's Group

texts.en:
Kert, aged 38, lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. She has three dependent children, two of whom are in school. She is a rice farmer, and her husband is a fisherman in the area to make a living. She has been in this business for ten years. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  

This is a microloan for Kert with Kiva partner, VisionFund. She is a sixth-cycle client with VisionFund. The past loans that she completely repaid have helped her relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. 

Now requesting a loan, Kert, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees in plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mak's Group

texts.en:
Mak is 43 years old and lives with her husband in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. She has four children, two of whom are in school. Rice farming is the main source of income for her family. She has been farming rice on a one-hectare area of farmland for ten years. To supplement this income, her husband fishes. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 20,000 KHR, and she is able to save 10,000 KHR each day. 

This is Mak's sixth loan with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which helped her to better support her current business and her children’s education. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her rice crop so she can improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio desde que recibió su credikiva compró celulares, accesorios  y repuestos que vendió y le produjeron más utilidades y una mayor liquidez. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un nuevo credikiva mediante el cual comprará repuestos y accesorios para celulares, al por mayor y de contado, con ello ganará muchos descuentos y competirá mas cómodamente en el mercado. El envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadadores de Kiva : ”Muchas Gracias y que Dios los bendiga por apoyarme”
texts.en: After Julio received his Kiva loan, he bought cell phones, accessories, and replacement parts that he sold. This gave him more profits and greater liquidity. Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan which he will use to buy replacement parts and accessories for cell phones, wholesale and for cash. This way he will get a lot of discounts and he will compete more comfortably in the market. He sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: "Thank you very much and may God bless you for supporting me."

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and accessories for cell phones, wholesale and for cash.

loans.name: Savoert's Group

texts.en:
Savoert is 44 years old and married with two children; they live in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. Savoert and her husband have earned a living farming rice for 20 years. Sometimes, she and her husband work for others for a fee to earn additional income. The current business earns them about 40,000 KHR per day, and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Savoert’s group consists of two women who have been members of VisionFund for three cycles. Savoert successfully used the past loans to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy gasoline for water pumping. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Thet's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Thet is a 44-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Cassava planting and rice farming have been the main sources of her family’s income for 24 years. To supplement her income, Thet also sells grocery items in the village. She earns about 32,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is Thet's first microloan with VisionFund. She is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy more grocery items for selling. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Kun's Group

texts.en:
After successful repayment of previous loans, Kun proceeded to take another loan from VisionFund Cambodia to buy seeds and fertilizers for her corn plantation. She will use the remaining amount of money to pay for land plowing. Kun, because of her good performance on previous loans, was appointed head of the current loan group of three members. 

Kun is married with three children, all of whom are still in school. Kun and her husband support the family by growing red corn for selling.

loans.use: to pay for land plowing and to buy corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jiweze Women Development Programme

texts.en:
Jiweze Women Development Programme is a non-profit organization making affordable financing available to the poor. Jiweze is a Swahili word meaning “empowering” or “uplifting”. 

Jiweze targets people who are unemployed or underemployed and seeking to improve their lives. They have little or no collateral and are therefore unable to access loans through traditional banking services. Women make up over 80% of Jiweze’s membership, the majority of whom members live in rural areas and cook over inefficient open fires. These traditional cooking methods produce health-damaging smoke and contribute to the deforestation that is destroying Kenya’s environment. Paradigm’s cookstoves will reduce the toxic smoke a woman inhales by 70% and will reduce the fuel needed to cook by up to 50%, saving families both time and money.

Jiweze was started in 2009 and currently stands at a membership of 10,000. Its head office is located in the town of Nakuru, and it has three branch offices spread across Rift Valley Province, Central Province and is currently in the process of spreading towards the Western part of the Kenya. Jiweze employs 30 full-time staff, most of whom are female. In five years’ time, Jiweze hopes to have become a limited company, to become more sustainable and rely less on grant funding,reach 100,000 members, and to cover a larger geographic area. 

Jiweze has a wide variety of long and short term loan products to fit their clients’ diverse needs. It offers large group loans, small group loans, and individual loans. The majority of loans disbursed are business loans, but Jiweze also offers educational, personal and emergency loans. It charges interest rates of 1.5% to 2.5% on reducing balance per month, depending on the loan size and product. It even offers some loans, specifically those targeting female entrepreneurs, at a very low interest rate of 0.67%. Jiweze has a repayment rate of approximately 95%.

Its members are eager to purchase cookstoves, but Jiweze struggles to raise enough low-interest capital to finance the cookstoves for its members. Up to now, Jiweze has been offering cookstoves to its members on a repayment schedule of 3 monthly payments. With a loan from Kiva, Jiweze will be able to offer cookstoves to its members for smaller payments spread over 5 months instead of 3 months.

With a KIVA loan of $3,100, Jiweze will buy 200 fuel-efficient cookstoves from Paradigm and will offer its members improved financing terms to purchase a stove. This will make the stoves accessible to even the lowest income members. These stoves will help improve the health and financial stability of a rural families in Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase cookstove products for sale to end users

loans.name: Small Scale Growers Sacco Ltd

texts.en:
Small Scale Growers SACCO (Savings and Credit Co-operative) is an organization dedicated to improving the lives of the poorest members of society.

The SACCO targets people living on less than $1 a day, who have no collateral and are therefore unable to access loans through traditional banking services. Its members are mainly farmers and those working in the informal sector, such as shopkeepers, market vendors and tailors. The majority of the SACCO’s members live in rural areas and cook over inefficient open fires that produce health-damaging smoke and contribute to the deforestation that is destroying Kenya’s environment. Paradigm’s cookstoves will reduce the toxic smoke by 70% and will reduce the fuel needed to cook by up to 50%. 

Small Scale Growers SACCO was started by a group of men and women who, after successful careers in business and IT, became determined to help the less fortunate start and grow businesses of their own. They started the organization with their personal savings. Since its inception in January 2012, the SACCO’s membership has grown to 7,000 members; approximately 70% are women and youth. It has seven branch offices and three mobile centers, which help reach remote members, spread mainly across Kenya’s Central Province and parts of Rift Valley Province. The SACCO mainly disburses business loans and charges an interest rate of only 10%. It has a repayment rate close to 100%.

SACCO employs 28 staff, most of whom are field-based loan collection agents. They hope to grow to 20,000 members by the end of 2013. SACCO members are all eager to purchase cook stoves, but SACCO has struggled to raise enough low-interest capital to finance the cookstoves for its members. With a loan from Kiva, Small Scale Growers will be able to offer cookstoves to its customers for a down payment of just $1 and financing over 4 months.  

With a KIVA loan of $3,100 Small Scale Growers Sacco will receive 200 fuel-efficient cookstoves from Paradigm and will offer its members improved financing terms to purchase a stove. The SACCO intends to reduce the down payment to approximately $1 and allow its members to repay the cost of the stove in small weekly installments for up to four months. This will make the stoves accessible to even the lowest income members. These stoves will help to improve the health and financial stability of rural families in Kenya today.

loans.use: To purchase cookstove products for sale to end users

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz Elena compró con su anterior credikiva, refrescos cervezas e insumos para preparar sus comidas rápidas. Con esa inversión logró mayor liquidez y aumentó su producción. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará cervezas en un mayor volumen producto que le ofrece una mayor rentabilidad y además es el de mayor rotación semanal. Luz Elena envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva y a la Fundación : “ Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por ese gran apoyo. “
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Luz Elena bought soft drinks, beer, and supplies to prepare her fast food. With this investment, she got greater liquidity and increased her production. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, with which she will buy beer in greater volume. This product is more profitable for her and it has the greatest weekly rotation. Luz Elena sends the following message to Kiva lenders and to Fundación: "Thank you so much to Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for this great support."

loans.use: to buy beers in greater volume.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, de 29 años de edad, esta casada con Marcos , quien es empleado y padre de  sus 04  hijos , juntos viven en su casa propia construida con material noble. Flor se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas las cuales congela hasta llegar al gusto del cliente, por está razón cuenta con un espacio en su hogar, en donde atiende a los clientes de manera amable y cordial, sabiendo que con ese trato se ganará la preferencia de sus clientes. Se inició hace más de 06 años en este negocio y viendo las ganancias que le dejaba opto por comprar más mercaderia logrando incrementar sus ventas, esta actividad la realiza con la ayuda de su pareja.
Antes de empezar con su negocio, nos comenta que no tenía problemas económicos , pero si el deseo de contar con una ocupación que la distrajera, además de contar con sus propios ingresos .Por tanto, ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y aumentar su mercadería .Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva y está agradecida con el apoyo financiero que se le brinda para continuar con sus planes a futuro. En está oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, para la compra de  sillas, mesas y otros muebles que le darán comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Flor, who is 29, is married to Marcos, who is a worker and the father of her four children. They live together in a house they own, which is built with quality materials. Flor works selling assorted soft drinks, which she keeps frozen until she reaches her customers. That is why she has a space set up at home, where she cordially sees to her customers. She knows that a friendly service will earn her their patronage. She started her business over six years ago and, considering the earnings it provided, she decided to buy more merchandise and was able to increase her sales. She runs her business with her husband's help. 

Before starting her business, she says she didn't have financial problems, but did have a desire to have a job to keep her busy, as well as her own income. Therefore she now has plans to keeps her business going and increase her merchandise. 

This is her third loan through Kiva and she appreciates the financial support she is being offered in order to advance her plans for the future. This time she is requesting 1,000 soles, which she will use to buy tables, chairs, and other furniture for her customers to be more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Cheap's Group

texts.en:
Cheap, 56, is a widow with five children. Cheap has been farming for over thirty years. Her business often struggles because of floods. The income she makes is just enough to provide daily food for her family. Cheap is now on her sixth loan with VisionFund Cambodia and leading a two member group.

Cheap, a resident of Ek Phnom district, requested the loan to spend on land plowing, fertilizers, and seedlings for her rice farm. She is hoping that this loan will enable her to grow good quality rice and make more income from selling it.

loans.use: to spend on farmland plowing and to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lita's Group

texts.en:
Lita is a married woman and has one daughter; the family lives in a wooden house located in the Sangke district of Battambang province. Lita and her other loan group member are on their fifth loan with VisionFund Cambodia. 

Lita, as the head of the group, asked for the loan to spend on her corn and green pepper plantation. With this loan, she is hoping to maximize her income so that she can save up some money to buy a water pump for her agriculture business.

loans.use: to plant corn and green pepper.

loans.name: Sot's Group

texts.en:
Sot, 42, lives with her husband in a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She has ten children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and catching fish for ten years. She is able to earn about 23,000 KHR per day.

Sot has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles. She has completely repaid the previous loans. With her past loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. She is now leading her group of four members, to request another loan. Sot will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her rice paddy, and to plow the paddy field. She hopes to get a high yield from her rice business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her rice paddy, and to plow the paddy field

loans.name: Kamsot's Group

texts.en:
Kamsot, 41, is widowed and lives with one child in a village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. To make a living, she sells medicine and grows oranges. Having been in this business for 20 years, she earns about 66,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
Kamsot’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She is requesting her third loan while the other members have been with VisionFund for five loans. Kamsot has successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her family relieve their financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now, she is leading her group to request another loan. Kamsot will use her portion on soil for her orange farm. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her oranges timely so as to sell them for a good price to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soil for her orange farm

loans.name: Lucia Marina

texts.es: Lucia, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro junto a sus dos hijos menores.  Hace cuatro años que Lucia es socia de una microempresa distribuidora de pollos. Ella cuenta con su propio galpón donde cría, engorda y destaza el pollo y lo vende a la microempresa. Cada 40 días saca la producción y luego vuelve a comprar otro lote de pollitos para engorde. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo y es por 25,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar pollitos y el alimento (concentrado) para continuar con la producción y venta de pollos. Su sueño es incrementar la producción para obtener mas utilidades y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucia is 45 years old and a single mother. She has five children and lives in the town of Negrito,Yoro, with her two youngest. Lucia has been a member of a poultry distribution microbusiness for four years. She has her own shed where she raises, fattens, and butchers the chickens before selling them to the microbusiness. Her product is sold every forty days and then she purchases another batch of chicks to fatten.

This is her second loan. She is requesting 25,000 lempiras, which she will use to purchase chicks and concentrated feed to continue raising and selling chickens. Her dream is to increase production so that she can obtain a higher profit to support her children and make home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and concentrated feed to raise and fatten them.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sok, 34, has four children in total. Two of them are still in school. To earn a living, Sok farms rice while her husband works as a motor taxi driver to better support the family. Sok is able to earn about 10,000 KHR per day, and she can save about 3,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Sok has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two to seek another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more crop yield from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Sophat is aged 32 and married. He has one daughter, and she is still small. He lives in a wooden house, located in the Ek Phnom district, Battambang province. To make a living, Sophat has been working as a carpenter in the village for several years. The current business earns him approximately 33,000 KHR per day, and he can manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day, after daily living expenses.

This is the third microloan for Sophat’s group, which is comprised of two members. Sophat completely repaid his past two loans with VisionFund, which have helped him to make a better living. Now, he is leading his group to request a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he wants to use his portion of the loan to buy a bevel motor, which he will use in his carpentry business. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from his current business, so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a bevel motor, which he will use in his carpentry business

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat, 30, has three little daughters to care for. She is a rice farmer in Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. Her 10 years experience in the business earns her about 22,000 KHR per day. From this income, she saves about 12,000 KHR per day. She was a borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and fully repaid her previous loan with success. The loan helped improve her livelihood. Now, she is in a group of three that is requesting 2,100,000 KHR, of which 700,000 KHR is her loan portion. As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to triple her yield and gain more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Thouch's Group

texts.en:
Thouch, 60, is a married mother of four who lives in a rural area in the Sangke district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. One of her children is dependent on her and still in school. The sources of her family’s income are rice farming on a five-hectare area of farmland and working for others for a fee. She and her husband have been in these businesses for 30 years. 
This is the fifth loan for Thouch with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she successfully used the past loans to relieve her family’s financial burden and increase her family’s income. With the need to support her business, she is now leading her group to apply for another loan. Thouch will use this loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to expand her paddy business to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en: Residing in Sangke district of Battambang Province, Ra is 38 years old and married.  She has two children under her care as they are still in school. To support the daily cost of living, she and her husband do rice cropping on two hectares of farmland. Ra, a third-time borrower, formed a group of two—her co-borrower is seeking a sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Ra has managed her past loan successfully in stabilizing her family’s living status better than before. She will use her loan portion as a group leader to buy fertilizer and pigs for raising as additional income. She hopes her businesses will run smoothly and return her a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pigs for raising as additional income

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang is 55 years old and married with four daughters, some of whom are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 15 years in her village. The current business earns her family about 80,000 KHR per day to feed their children and she can manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 
Heang’s group consisting of three borrowers who have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loans. The past loans have helped Heang ease her family’s financial burden. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy a decent motorbike for her family to use. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper vehicle for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for her family to use

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
Milka , de 25 años de edad, esta divorciada del padre de sus 02 hijos con quienes reside en su casa propia construida a base de material noble .Milka se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, la cual adquiere en la ciudad de Lima realizando viajes periódicos para comprar su mercadería, para luego venderlo desde su casa y en forma ambulatoria a sus vecinos y amistades, a quienes atiende muy bien, logrando ser recomendada a otras personas que luego se vuelven en sus clientes habituales.Realiza éste negocio desde hace 7 años  , el cual lo viene realizando sola.
Le gusta su negocio pues le ha generado buenos ingresos económicos, ya que logra vender grandes cantidades en un mes a su vez se ha hecho conocida dentro de su localidad por eso tiene planeado abrir una tienda de venta de ropa, para así no tener que caminar mucho buscando clientes.Este es préstamo número 03 con Kiva por ello agradece su apoyo financiero y así poder concretar sus planes.En está oportunidad solicitará S/.1000 soles para la compra de ropa a precios más bajos,buscando así mayores ganancias en su actividad laboral.
texts.en:
Milka, 25, is divorced from the father of her two children, with whom she lives in her own house made of high-quality materials.

Milka makes a living selling clothing for women, men, and children.  She travels periodically to the city of Lima to buy her merchandise, which sells later at home and on foot to her neighbors and friends.  She gives them very good service and manages to be recommended to other people who become her regular customers.  She has had this business for seven years and she does it alone.

She likes her business because she has managed to sell large quantities monthly and it has generated good income.  Also, she has become well known in her town and she plans to open a clothing store so she doesn't have to walk around a lot looking for customers.

This is her third loan with Kiva.  She's grateful for the financial help so she can firm up her plans.

Currently she's requesting 1000 soles [PEN] to buy clothing at lower prices so she can have more profit in her job.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Chraet's Group

texts.en:
Chraet, whose business is rice farming and raising piglets to be sold, lives in a wooden house located in Sa Ang district, Kandal province. She is married and has four children. All of them are still in school. The income made from their business enables them to send all their children to school. 

Chraet has taken previous loans from VisionFund, which she has successfully repaid. Now that Chraet needs more capital for her business, she decided to ask for another loan from VisionFund. Chraet was appointed to be the head of this group, which is comprised of four female members. After getting the loan, Chraet will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice paddy, hoping to produce a higher yield and so earn a greater profit from this crop. Her goal is that her children can be in school until grade 12, which is the last class of high school.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Potmakara's Group

texts.en:
Aged 36 years old, Potmakara is a married mother of three children, living in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. All of her three children are still in school. To support her family, Potmakara has been farming rice. Her husband is a fisherman. The current business earns her about KHR 28,000 per day. 

Potmakara’s Group consists of two members and she is the leader of this group. Potmakara is in her fifth loan cycle and her member is in the fourth cycle with VisionFund Cambodia. She has successfully used the past loans from VisionFund Cambodia to better support her family and business. 

Now requesting a loan, Potmakara will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for water pumping. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for water pumping for her farmland.

loans.name: Sona's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district, Sona is a 36-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are in school. Sona earns a living through rice farming and pig raising. To add more income, she is a paid worker in the village to make a living.

Sona’s group consists of two female members and she has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Together, they can earn about 49,000 KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 11,000 KHR each day.She completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her better support her family.

Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for buying pig feeds. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to sell them for a good price so as to increase income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: El Sr. Wilson  tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 10 y 5 años, el se dedica administrador de vivero de flores que se encuentran en la zona de Pedregal,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Wilson va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de un ambiente más grande para ampliar su vivero,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es poder realizar unas refacciones que son necesarias y le hace falta de capital de trabajo, El Sr. Wilson  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son poder expandirse en gran la variedad de flores decorativas para interiores y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la expansión de su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es comprar un terreno más grande para tener unos 3 viveros y seguir cultivando gran variedad de flores.
texts.en: Wilson is 35 years old and has two children, ages ten and five. He works managing a flower nursery located in the Pedregal area. This loan is his first cycle within our institution. Wilson is going to use this loan to purchase construction materials to build a larger space which he will add on to his nursery. The reasons he is requesting this loan is so that he can make some needed repairs and because he needs working capital. Wilson faces challenges in his business, mainly being able to expand and grow a great variety of indoor decorative flowers. He will use his profits to expand his business. He wants to eventually purchase a larger lot so that he can have about three different nurseries and continue growing a large variety of flowers.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for repairs.

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
Norn is 60 years old and married with ten children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She grows rice and plants sugarcane to make a living. To add more income, she and her husband have been working as paid workers in the local area. With the current business, Norn can earn about KHR 30,000 per day to meet her family’s needs and is able to save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future needs. 

This is Norn’s Group loan with VisionFund Cambodia. She has been with VisionFund Cambodia for six cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund Cambodia from three to seven cycles. The past loans, which Norn completely repaid, have helped her to better support her family and to have sufficient working capital for her business. 

With a good business, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her sugarcane and to use a portion of the loan to purchase more sugarcane trees for planting. She hopes to grow her rice as well as sugarcane in a timely manner, so as to sell them for a high price, to earn a larger income. She also hopes to extend her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her sugarcane and more sugarcane trees for planting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, de 63 años es un hombre responsable ,vive en compañía de su esposa Benita y sus 4 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en la casa que compró hace 19 años. Su trabajo es árduo ya que posee extensas áreas de terreno agrícola en donde siembra diversos productos, cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio pues sabe dividir las ganancias y el capital de trabajo. “Para mi siembra tengo un capital muy bueno, ahí tengo más ganancias, pero junto a mi esposa estoy comenzando en la crianza de cerdos, por lo que no tengo un capital ganado”, menciona. Es así que en la actualidad cuenta con 3 cerdos medianos, de los que espera obtener buenos ingresos cuando maduren.Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, a su vez agradece la oportunidad financiera que le ayudará a mejorar su económia familiar.Alberto, invertirá el dinero en la compra de 4 cerdos para su crianza.
texts.en:
Alberto, 63, is a responsible man.  He lives with his wife Benita and their four children, only one of whom lives with them in the house they bought 19 years ago.

"I have very good capital for my fields, where I have more profits.  But my wife and I are starting to raise pigs, for which I haven't earned any capital," he says.  Currently he has three medium-sized pigs, from which he hopes to earn a good income when they mature.

His job is hard because he has extensive cropland where he grows a variety of products.  He says it's going very well for him in his business because he knows how to share between his profits and his working capital.  

This is his first loan with Kiva and he pledges to make his payments punctually.  He's grateful for this financial opportunity, which will help him improve the family economy.

Alberto will invest the money in buying four pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en: At 28 years old and a rural married woman in Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Vuthy is a local farmer who overcame the family’s hardship via rice cultivation. The five years of experiences in the current business have enabled her to earn about 30,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, she is a second-time borrower. She, after the successful loan with VisionFund, feels confident to better support her living in a good status. Now, she is in need of working capital to keep supporting her business. Therefore, she formed a group of three to seek for a new loan. She is seeking for 1,200,000 KHR whereas both of her co-borrowers are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees. She highly hopes that she can grow her rice timely and seasonably so that she is able to multiply her income

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María Esperanza es una joven trabajadora, responsable, emprendedora, honesta, con deseos de superación y anhelo de mejorar su nivel de vida económico. 

Actualmente esta iniciando su tercer año Universitario en Administración de Empresas por lo que se presento a las Oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un préstamo para el pago de matricula y aranceles del primer semestre y poder seguir con su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza is a hard working young woman. She is responsible, enterprising, honest, and with hopes to get ahead in life and improve her economic status.
She is currently starting her third year at university, studying business administration. She went to the offices of the lending partner, Ceprodel, to ask for a loan to pay for the registration fee and tuition for the first semester, in order to continue with her university studies.

loans.use: To pay for the registration fee and tuition for the first semester at university

loans.name: Yem's Group

texts.en:
Yem is 48 years old and a widow with three children.  As a single mother, she overcomes the daily cost of living in her family via cassava cultivation on one hectare of farmland. Engaging in the current business, she is able to earn up to 19,000 KHR per day and saves about 9,000 KHR per day.  

Yem’s prior loan was her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan wisely to relieve her family’s burden in providing daily food for the entire household as the breadwinner in the family. 

Now, Yem leads a group of four. The total requested loan amount is 4,800,000 KHR. For Yem, she will use her loan portion in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR in order to lease an additional plot of farmland to grow her cassava. She hopes to gain more yield from her cassava and sustain her lifestyle progressively.

loans.use: to lease an additional plot of farmland and to renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Oun is married and blessed with three children who currently are helping with the family business. The primary source of her family's income is from a rice and cassava plantation. Oun is able to earn up to KHR 12,000 per day from the current business that she has been with for 22 years. 

In a group of three, Oun and one of her joint members are third-time borrowers, whereas a remaining member is a second-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. Oun has wisely used her past loans to upgrade her business and provide the daily food for the entire household. 

In this new loan, Oun is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to lease another plot of farmland to grow more cassava. She greatly believes that this expansion will return her a triple-yield and make more income.

loans.use: to lease another plot of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district, Bopha is a 52-year-old widowed mother of four children. She has earned a living through buying and selling kapok in a local area and supplements the family’s income by working for others for a fee to better support the family. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Bopha has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She successfully repaid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her family and increase the business. Now leading her group of four members to apply for a loan, Bopha, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more kapok for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her current business and also hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy more kapok for resale

loans.name: Nai's Group

texts.en:
Nai, 49, is a mother of two schoolchildren out of eight children and a resident from Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To overcome the family’s daily cost of living, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland and supplements the family income via cassava cropping. She has engaged in the current business for 20 years and is able to earn up to 17,000 KHR. She manages to sustain her living, especially in affording daily food for her children, as well as keep her children in school. 

Nai is a third cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. She will use her loan portion to lease cassava farmland to enlarge the plantation scale. She hopes to grow her crops seasonably and get more income to stabilize her living.

loans.use: To lease cassava farmland to enlarge the plantation scale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
Sao is 59 years old and a widow. She is a resident of Kampong Cham province, where rice farming is one of the common businesses in her neighborhood. Not different from her villagers, she also grows rice on two hectares of rice farmland. 

Sao has managed this business for 15 years and is able to earn up to 42,000 KHR per day. This is the second loan for Sao with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has completely repaid her past loan, which sustains her living progressively. 

Now, in a group of two, Sao is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy an additional plot of farmland and to pay for the plowing fee. She highly hopes that she can increase her income and sustain her living status.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of farmland and to pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Trancito Antonieta

texts.es:
La Sra. Trancito vive Guayaquil, tiene 57 años de edad. Ella vivía hace años en el Oriente del Ecuador con su esposo. Cuando su esposo la abandonó y ella se vino a vivir a Guayaquil decidio comenzar a coser y asi fue que puso su taller y desde ahí  a mantenido a sus hijos y ahora a su pequeña nieta.

Trabaja sola, todo el día, en su casa tiene el negocio en donde cose blusas, pantalones, interiores, de todo un poco. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, máquinas de coser e hilos para así poder coser con mayor facilidad y hacer más cosas que los clientes le piden. 

Tambien consiguiendo mas maquinas puede darles trabajo a demás personas para que le faciliten el trabajo y así poder obtener más ganancias para un mejor vivir para su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Trancito, age 57, lives in Guayaquil. She lived with her husband in eastern Ecuador for many years, but when he abandoned her, she moved to Guayaquil. Trancito decided to begin sewing and open her workshop. This enabled her to support her children and now her young granddaughter.

Trancito works alone every day from her home business. She produces blouses, trousers, undergarments, and a little bit of everything else. With this loan, she will buy fabrics, thread, and a sewing machine so that she can work with greater ease and produce more items that her customers request.

Trancito will continue to acquire more machines so that she can provide jobs to other people. This will enable her to complete more work and generate more income so that her family can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es:
Orbelina es una mujer 30 años de edad luchadora y emprendedora ella es casada y de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos los cuales 3 estudian en la primaria y 1 esta en secundaria al salir de sus estudios ayudan a sus padres con las diferentes actividades en sus cultivos como ser la limpia, poda y riego de abono. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al apoyo de sus padres quienes se esforzaron por darle un conocimiento básico para que ella aprendiera lo básico ya que ellos son de bajos recursos económicos y no pudieron seguirla ayudando. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron el cultivo y siembra de café desde muy pequeña el cual aun sigue realizando ya que es un medio mas para que su familia obtenga ingresos para cubrir las necesidades como lo que es la canasta básica, vestimenta, medicina, entre otros. Ella también se dedica al comercio emprendiendo un pequeño negocio como ser una pulperia la cual vio como necesidad de abrirla ya que la demanda de este rubro es poco en el sector donde ella habita. Gracias al esfuerzo impuesto por su esposo y ella pudieron adquirir un terreno el cual es propio esta a 1 Kilómetro y medio de distancia de su casa de habitación  al cual se trasladan a pie. Su producto de café es comprado por los vecinos, intermediarios los cuales llegan a la zona donde ella habita para adquirirlo. 

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y bombas de riego para sus cultivos de café ya que por medio de esto ella podrá darle una mejor asistencia a su producto y podrá mantenerlo alejado de las plagas y enfermedades como la roya la cual daña este cultivo.

Su sueño es que sus cultivos sean los mas productivos y vendidos ya que de esa manera podrá generar ingresos para su familia y podrá darles una mejor educación a sus hijos para que ellos puedan estudiar carreras de provecho a nivel universitario y puedan hacerse cargo de la propiedad y puedan implementar los conocimientos y hacerla crecer.
texts.en:
Orbelina is a hardworking and enterprising 30-year-old woman. She is married and has four children from her marriage, three of whom study in primary school and one is in secondary school. When the children finish school, they help their parents with the different activities for their crops such as weeding, sowing and spraying fertilizers. 

Orbelina has a complete primary education which she was able to finish thanks to her parents' help who worked hard to give her a primary education so that she could learn the basics as they had little financial resources and couldn't continue helping her. It was her parents who showed her at a young age how to sow and cultivate coffee, which she continues to this day as it is another means of earning an income for her family to cover needs such as the basic grocery basket, clothing, medicine and so on. Orbelina also makes her living in sales, setting up a small grocery store which she saw as necessary given that the demand in the field is low in the area in which she lives. Thanks to the effort put in by her husband and herself, they were able to purchase a plot of land at 1.5 km for their home which they get to on foot. Her coffee product is bought by neighbors, middlemen who come to the area where she lives to purchase it.

Orbelina is currently seeking help to buy fertilizers, manure and irrigation pumps for her coffee plantations as it is through this mean that she will be able to better care for her product and keep it free from infestations and illnesses such as rust which damages this crop.
Orbelina's dream is that her crops are the most productive and best sold as it is in this way that she will generate an income for her family and give her children a better education so that they can study honorable degrees at university level and so that they take over the property and use their knowledge to make it grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and irrigation pumps for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Jose tiene 45 años, tiene dos hijos,  el se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Mario Mercado,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Jose utilizara este préstamo para compra de tela para la confección de prendas de vestir, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, El Sr. Jose enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar en mayor cantidad sus prendas de vestir,  El Sr. Jose se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Jose is 45 years old and has two children.  He works manufacturing clothing and has done so for some time.  His workshop is located in the Mario Mercado area.  This loan is his first with Kiva partner Emprender.  Jose will use this loan to buy fabric for making clothes.  His reason for applying for the loan is a lack of working capital.

Jose faces challenges in his business in further improving the quality of the manufacture of clothing.  He will use profits to continue increasing his working capital.  His hope for his business is to continue growing and to make clothes in larger quantities.

Jose is happy and grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Vich's Group

texts.en: A mother of a son who is currently helping in the business, Vich is 47 years old and married. She earns a living from the only source of family income via one hectare of cassava cropping; it is the business that she has been with for 25 years and returns her about 20,000 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is in the fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is able to repay back all of loans and has succeeded in providing daily decent food for her family. Now, she wants to enlarge her cassava farmland. Therefore, she is leading a group of three to apply for a new loan. She hopes to receive high yield from her current business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland to grow cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lis' Group

texts.en: Lis, a young mother of a little kid, is 28 years old and a local farmer residing in Kampong Cham province. She plants cassava and rice as the main income generating activity to deal with her family’s financial burden. For eight years engagement in the business, she is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR. This is Lis' third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has used her previous loans wisely to support her living in a gradual manner. Now she is a group leader of three other joint members. For Lis, her loan portion will be used on paying for leasing cassava farmland. She highly hopes that she can get more income to better her living.

loans.use: To pay for leasing farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nuch

texts.en:
Age 48 and married, Nuch is a local cassava farmer who works on one hectare of farmland. She has nine children, five of whom are still is school. The current business, which she has been with for 26 years, returns her about KHR 34,700 per day. 

This is the sixth loan for Nuch with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). The prior loan has enabled her to relieve her family's burden and improve her family’s livelihood. 

Now, Nuch is seeking a loan for KHR 2,000,000. She will use her loan to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more income from her current business, so that she can build a big house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Mony's Group

texts.en: A young 28-year-old mother of two little kids, Mony is also a citizen from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. To earn a living for her children’s sake, she grows rice on a two hectare area and makes Khmer noodles for resale. Having been with this business for 10 years, she is able to earn up to 22,700 KHR per day. Mony has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three times, including this cycle. She has repaid back her loan with success. The past loans provided sufficient working capital to support her business and she can afford three decent meals for her family per day. Now, she is in a group of two. As  a group leader she will use her loan portion to expand her business and to renovate her house. She hopes to earn a living from her business and own a decent house for her kids.

loans.use: To expand her business and to renovate her house

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa, a single woman living in a district of Pusat province named Sampov Meas, plants red corn and soya beans to support herself. Each day she earns around KHR 15,000 and saves around KHR 10,000.

Having repaid her two previous loan, Channa is leading a group of five women to request this loan from VisionFund. As planned, Channa will use her portion to buy red corn and soya bean seeds, hoping that she can maximize her profits so as to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy red corn and soya bean seeds.

loans.name: Paca Karina

texts.es:
PACA KARINA tiene 24 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

PACA KARINA es empleada doméstica. Solicita el crédito para comprar una lavadora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la casa. Las compras lo hará en Chimbo.

Los deafíos a los que se enfrenta es tener salud para seguir trabajando. El sueño es tener lo necesario a base del esfuerzo para vivir mejor.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia, En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar y pasar con la familia.

"Está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado".
texts.en:
Paca Karina is 24 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her parents in Chimbo, which is in Bolívar Province.

Paca Karina is a domestic employee. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a washing machine. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she is lacking in her home. Her purchases are made in Chimbo.

The challenges she faces include staying healthy so that she can continue working. Her dream is to have everything she needs, so she strives to live better. Another challenge is having to deal with the competition.

In her free time, she enjoys playing and spending time with her family. Paca Karina says, “I am very grateful for the loan that has been provided.”

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Lenis

texts.es: Lenis compró colonias blusas, cremas entre otros artículos. Con ello sus inventarios se crecieron porque los vendió y volvió a invertir en los productos de mayor rotación. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa femenina y casual, perfumería y artículos que la ayuden una vez más, a incrementar sus ingresos. Ella envía un mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva muchas gracias, espero que me sigan apoyando ya que es una importante labor que realizan apoyando a los microempresarios. “
texts.en:
Lenis bought colognes, blouses and creams, among other items. With these products, her inventories grew because she sold them items and went on to invest in high turnover goods. Lenis is currently applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will buy women's clothing and casual clothing, perfume and articles which help her to sell more and increase her sales. 

Lenis' message to her Kiva loan lenders is the following: "Thank you so much, I hope that you continue to support me as this is a great work that you are performing by support micro-entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and casual clothing, perfume and other articles.

loans.name: Arnoldo Antonio

texts.es: Don Arnoldo, es un cliente que tiene su propio negocio que administra su esposa, una pequeña pulpería su principal medio de ingresos, que le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, ahora uno de ellos está en la universidad y los gastos son mayores por eso don Arnoldo ha optado en trabajar como conductor particular para lograr cubrir los gastos del hogar, con este nuevo crédito solicitado desea invertir nuevamente en su venta con productos como granos básicos, enlatados, pollo, carne, lácteos, gaseosas entre otros para mantener su negocio y clientela, el está muy contento ya que gracias a estos financiamientos con bajos intereses ha podido progresar con su familia.
texts.en:
Arnoldo is a customer who has his own business which he runs with his wife, a small grocery store and their main source of income which has helped him to support his three children. One of his children is now in university and as spending has risen, Arnoldo has chosen to work as a private chauffeur to cover the household costs.

With this new loan, Arnoldo wants to invest once again in the grocery store with products such as basic grains, tinned products, chicken, meat, dairy products, fizzy drinks and so on to maintain his business and customer base. He is very happy as it is thanks to these low interest loans that he has been able to get ahead in life with his family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, tinned goods, chicken, meat, daily products, fizzy drinks and so on.

loans.name: Pich's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five children from the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Pich is a grocery vendor in the area. Her husband also helps to earn more income through rice farming. She has been in this business for 17 years.

Pich has repaid all eight previous loans from VisionFund (Kiva's partner), loans that have offered progressive support for her business. Now leading a group of four to request a new loan, she will use her portion to buy grocery items for resale. Pich hopes to earn more income from her enterprise and sustain her living.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for resale.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar de 50 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de uniformes escolares e industriales. Ella tiene 20 años de experiencia desde que inició su primer curso en el colegio donde estudió y también vio a su madre dedicarse a la costura y de ella aprendió el amor  al arte y la dedicación. Su familia está conformada por su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 27 años, con quienes sueña sean muy exitosos y ellos son su inspiración. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y sus compras también y   directamente distribuye a sus clientes finales, los que ha captado a lo largo del tiempo y a ella son fieles. Su meta es tener un taller mucho mas estructurado y por eso trabaja permanentemente en ello. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina plana, telas, para mejorar los tiempos productivos y darle un acabado perfecto a sus productos. Su inversión planea ser exitosa porque con ella logrará impactar positivamente al mercado y lograr un mayor posicionamiento.
texts.en:
Pilar is 50 years old. She works making school and industry uniforms. She has 20 years of experience, ever since she started her first year at the school where she studied. She also saw her mum work as a seamstress and from her she learned the love and dedication to the trade. Her family is formed by her husband and 3 children, aged 16 to 27 years old, who she dreams will be very successful. They are her inspiration.
She conducts her sales and purchases in cash and she distributes directly to the end clients, whom she has gained over the time and who remain loyal customers.
Her goal is to have a better structured sewing workshop, and she works permanently towards that. She is applying for her first Kiva loan through the lending partner, Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase an industrial sewing machine and fabric, in order to improve the time of production and provide a perfect finishing touch to her products. Her investment looks to be successful because with it she will have a positive impact on the market and will improve her positioning in it.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand and wood chips.

loans.name: Ana Graciela

texts.es:
La Sra.  Ana vive en Guayaquil. Empezó su negocio hace mucho tiempo cuando se decidio en poner su negocio de venta de carnes. Le ha ido muy bien ya que ha tenido muchas ventas. 

Lo realiza con la ayuda de  su hijo en las mañanas hasta las 1:00 de la tarde (tiene un puesto en la principal de carnes), no tiene ninguna dificultad hasta el momento y espera no tenerlo. No está casada, es madre soltera. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar carnes, costilla y chorisos. EL sueño que quiere realizar es mejorar la casa donde habita para poder vivir mejor con su hijo y darle mejor vida, con el tiempo comprarse un carro y aumentar el negocio y en un futuro abrir una sucursal.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana lives in Guayaquil. She decided to start a business some time ago, so she began selling meat. Ana is doing very well and has generated many sales.

She works in the mornings with the help of her son and continues until 1:00 in the afternoon. Ana has a stand where she sells mostly meat. She is not experiencing any difficulties at the moment, so she hopes that trend will continue. Ana is not married, but she is a single mother.

With this loan, Ana will buy meat, ribs, and chorizo sausages. Her dream is to make improvements to her home so that she and her son can live better. She also wants to provide her son a better life, purchase a car, expand her business, and open another location in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat, ribs, and chorizo sausages.

loans.name: Rosa Natividad

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 46 años, nació en un pueblito de Loja en donde terminó la secundaria y luego se casó con Jesús quien tiene 59 años y es agricultor, tienen 2 hijos que aún están educándose. Rosa actualmente vive con su esposo e hijos en la parroquia Abrahan Calazacón en Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Además la visita de turistas nacionales y extranjeros aporta al fortalecimiento de las actividades de los emprendedores que desde hace algunos años han establecido sus negocios alrededor de toda la ciudad. Esta ciudad que es la tercera más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura. 
Rosa desde hace 4 años se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió esta valiosa actividad de sus padres quienes también eran agricultores. Invierte mucho de su tiempo en las mañanas y en las tardes alternando con los quehaceres del hogar. Ella siempre está pendiente de los cultivos, en el riego, en el aseo, cosecha y siembra de los mismos para así ofertarlos a buenos precios a sus clientes. El mayor obstáculo que ha tenido es la dificultad para legalizar el terreno donde realiza esta actividad, sin embargo, ella ha seguido trabajando duro para apoyar en su hogar y apoyar la educación de sus hijos. Desde hace 4 años es cliente de Fundación Alternativa y ha tenido mucha apertura en los 3 créditos que ha realizado. Está muy satisfecha con la agilidad y apoyo que brindan a los microempresarios del sector rural, pues solo así ha logrado mantener en buen estado la finca y sus cultivos. Ahora requiere un préstamo el cual lo utilizará para arreglar la infraestructura interna y externa de su casa y además comprará abonos para dar mantenimiento a los cultivos. Rosa agradece a todos quienes a través de Kiva están financiando su crecimiento personal y laboral. Ella siempre trabajará para cumplir su sueño y el de su esposo de ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales de excelencia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 46-year-old woman, she was born in the small town of Loja where she finished secondary school and then got married to Jesús who is 59 years old and is a farmer. They have two children who are still studying. Rosa currently lives with her husband and children in the Abrahan Calazacón parish in Santo Domingo, the main city of the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province, an area which has very strong commerce as it has become a terrestrial port for trade between the mountains and the coast in Ecuador. In addition, domestic and foreign tourists have strengthened the activities of the entrepreneurs who set up their business around the city several years ago. This city is the third most populated in the region and it also contributes to activities such as agriculture, cattle rearing, fishery and manufacturing.

For the last four years, Rosa has been making her living in agriculture. She learnt this honorable trade from her parents who were also farmers. She spends a lot of her time in the mornings and the afternoons alternating between the household chores. She is always caring for her crops, watering, cleaning, harvesting and sowing in order to offer the goods to her customers at good prices.

The biggest obstacle that Rosa has faced is the difficulty in authenticating the land in which she works. However, she has continued to work hard to support the household and support her children's education. Rosa has been a customer of the Fundación Alternativa for four years and she has had a lot of openings with the 3 loans she has taken out. Rosa is very satisfied with the agility and support given to micro-entrepreneurs in the rural sector, as it is only in this manner that she has been able to keep the farm and her crops in such good condition.

Rosa now needs a loan which she will use to repair the internal and external infrastructure of her home and also buy fertilizers for the upkeep of her crops. Rosa thanks everyone who has been financing her growth on a personal and work front via Kiva. She will always work to achieve her dream and that of her husband – to see their children become upstanding professionals.

loans.use: to do up her home and repair the farm.

loans.name: Elena Petrona

texts.es: La Sra. Elena tiene 37 años, casada con 5 hijos que tienen las edades de 1, 3, 10, 13 y 18 años, ella se dedica a la venta de enaguas y polleras  para mujeres de polleras, ella vende en distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro la institución, La Sra. Elena va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una computadora para sus hijos ya que el mayor salió ya de colegio y necesita para sus estudios universitarios y el dinero le será de gran utilidad, ya que lo utilizara en gastos personales y si tiene un saldo lo utilizara en la compra de ropa para surtir su puesto de venta,   La Sra. Elena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería,  La Sra. Elena es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old and has five children, ages 1, 3, 10, 13 and 18.  She sells petticoats and skirts for women in various markets in the city of La Paz, Bolivia.  This is her first loan with Kiva partner Emprender.  

Elena will use this loan to purchase a computer for her children.  Her oldest has already graduated from high school and needs the computer for his university studies.  The loan will be very useful in paying for personal expenses as well.  If there are any remaining funds, they will be used to buy clothing to stock her stall.

Elena faces challenges in her business that include maintaining sufficient inventory.  Elena is a very hardworking person who is happy for this opportunity; her business is the only activity that allows her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her son.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Residing in Pursat Province, Sophal is 33 years old and married. She has two children who are students in a local state school.  She manages one and half hectares of rice farmland while her husband works as a police officer. She has worked in her current business for 22 years, and it has returned her about 17,400 KHE per day. Sophal is a four-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is pleased with her past loan, which has afforded her the opportunity to cover her daily cost of living and especially decent food for her kids. She also managed to repay her past loan. Now she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. The total of her group loan is 5,400,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to renovate her house. She hopes to own a proper house for her family.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, tiene 51 años de edad. Comenzó hace más de 10 años vendiendo caramelos, en el centro de la ciudad, y en los buses, después por su discapacidad visual tiene que cambiar la línea de productos ahora vende: papas, chifles, maduros, y le gusta mucho lo que hace con eso se puede mantener.

El trabaja solo en su local, desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 17:00 de la tarde,  vendiendo chifles, papas, rufles, etc. El tiene dos dificultades en su trabajo, primero su discapacidad visual el cual no le permite desenvolverse con normalidad en su negocio. La otra es las personas de mal corazón que le compran con monedas falsas, billetes falsos.

El no tiene  esposa. Y tampoco tiene hijos. Con el préstamo el va a comprar productos para su venta de su trabajo como papas, chifles, maduros. Sus sueños para un futuro es tener un local en el cual trabajar y que no  discriminen  a las personas con discapacidad, y poder dar empleo y así tener las mismas oportunidades que tienen todas las personas.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil. He is 51 years old and began selling candy more than 10 years ago in the central part of the city and on the buses. After he became visually disabled, he switched over to different products and now sells potatoes, banana chips, and fried plantains. He enjoys what he does, so he is able to support himself.

The borrower works alone in his shop from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. He sells banana chips, potatoes, potato chips, and other items. He experiences two difficulties with his work. First of all, his visual disability does not allow him to engage in his business in a normal manner. The other difficulty is that cruel-hearted people have purchased merchandise with counterfeit money.

The borrower is not married nor does he have any children. With this loan, he will buy products to sell in his shop such as potatoes, banana chips, and fried plantains. His dreams for the future include having a place where he can work and others do not discriminate against people with disabilities by providing them with jobs. He would also like to have the same opportunities that are offered to everyone else.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, banana chips, and fried plantains.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota es una mujer de 43 años de edad ama de casa, luchadora, emprendedora y también agricultora, casada, con 4 hijos adultos los cuales viven apartado del techo de sus padres. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación no pudo estudiar por falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ya que ellos son de bajos recursos. La actividad del cultivo y siembra de café la aprendió desde muy pequeña fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron dicha actividad dedicados desde toda una vida a la agricultura la cual es medio de ingresos para ellos como adultos y en compañía de su esposo ejerce esta actividad hace mas de 20 años. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a una distancia de 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente pero el terreno no es propio por lo cual dividen las ganancias con el propietario. El mantenimiento y asistencia técnica se lo dan en familia en compañía de sus hijos que ayudan al corte, poda, abono y fertilización del mismo. Su producto es vendido en el mercado local el cual los consumidores de la zona compran y lo venden como también es adquirido por los intermediarios para su venta.

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de plantas y semillas certificadas para la plantación del mismo ya que de esa forma ella mejorara sus cultivos y ara crecer la plantación para esta nueva cosecha obtendrá mas ingresos y podrá seguir cultivando.

Su meta es adquirir nuevas plantas y semillas para poder cultivarlas y de esa forma mejorar su plantación ya que su sueño es poder comprar un terreno y tener sus propias plantaciones que estas sean las mejores de la zona y puedan generar ingresos para que con el tiempo ella pueda tener un capital propio y las ganancias sean netas.
texts.en:
43-year-old Carlota is a determined housewife, entrepreneur and farmer.  She is married and has four adult children who no longer live under her roof.  Carlota was unable to attend school owing to a lack of financial support from her parents who had little money.  Carlota learned how to grow coffee at a very young age from her parents, who have spent their whole lives farming.  Together with her husband, Carlota has been in this business for more than 20 years.  Her coffee crops are located 3 kilometers from her home and she travels there every day on foot.  However, the land on which she grows the crops does not belong to her so she must share the profits she makes with the land owner.  The maintenance and technical support required by the crops is the responsibility of her family and Carlota works together with her children who help her to cut, prune, spread manure and fertilize.  The produce is then sold in the local market.  It is bought by local consumers.  However, some is also sold to third parties who re-sell it.  

Carlota currently needs help so that she can buy certified plants and seeds to grow.  In this way, she will be able to improve her crops and increase the number of plants that she grows.  She will make more income from this new harvest and will be able to continue growing.  Her goal is to acquire new plants and seeds so that she can improve her crops.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can own her own fields.  She hopes they will be the best in the area and will make her enough income so that, over time, she will have her own capital and be able to keep all her profits.

loans.use: to buy certified coffee plants and seeds

loans.name: Glenda Lismenia

texts.es: Glenda, es Casada tiene un hijo de 5 años, ella tiene una libreria y tambien tiene una venta de de calzado, inicio su negocio hace 2 años, y gracias a Dios poco a poco ella a ido creciendo en su negocio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para su libreria espera que por medio de ustedes ella pueda seguir luchando en su negocio y asi salir adelante.
texts.en: Glenda is married with a five-year-old son.  She owns a bookstore and also sells shoes.  Two years ago she started her business, which has slowly been growing.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her bookstore.  She hopes that with your support she can keep fighting to succeed in her business and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for a bookstore.

loans.name: Nork's Group

texts.en:
Nork is 33 years old and married with two children, all of whom are still in school. She and her family live in a village of the Sangke district of Battambang province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on three hectare of farmland for almost 10 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day.

Nork is the second cycled client while her group member is the fourth cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully used past loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order for her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Noris

texts.es: Noris de 51 años de edad vive en el suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus hijos en las edades de 17 a 15 años. Allí se dedica a la venta al detalle de ranchos, víveres, refrescos, cárnicos y artículos de la canasta familiar que compran las familias vecinas diariamente para elaborar los alimentos. Dese hace 20 años dio inició a su negocio teniendo en cuenta que en el sector no existía una tienda con estas características, poco a poco fue construyendo sus  propia clientela y hoy la identifican varios de los sectores aledaños. En la actualidad ha recibido 4 financiamientos de  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales ha logrado mantener inventarios y vender de todo un poco de lo que su clientela solicita. Su sueño es ampliar la estructura de su negocio y tener un crecimiento sostenido, para apoyar aun más el bienestar de su familia. Esta es justamente la razón por a cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará ranchos, víveres, embutidos, enlatados etc, pues necesita tener muchos de estos productos en esta época, en la cual la semana santa aumenta su consumo, por la especialidad de las comidas que comparten las familias en esta temporada. Y esto es justamente la razón de éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Noris is 51 years old and lives in the southwestern part of the city with her husband and her two children, who are 15 and 17 years of age. She has a grocery store where she sells meats, canned goods and other food and household items. The neighboring families visit her store daily to get ingredients for their meals. She started her business 20 years ago, taking into account that there was not a store in her area to meet these needs. Little by little she built her own customer base, and today she is also known in some nearby districts. To date she has received four loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With these funds she has been able to maintain her inventory and to provide what her customers ask for. Her dream is to expand her business and have sustained growth, so that she can do an even better job of supporting the well-being of her family. This is just the reason she is seeking a loan through Kiva. She will use the loan to buy meats, canned goods and other food items. It is necessary to have a lot of these products at this time, since people consume more during Semana Santa (Holy Week) when they share meals with their families. And this is exactly the reason this will be a successful loan.

loans.use: to buy meats, canned goods and other food items.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha is 32 years old and a married mother with four children; all are in school. To support the family and also the children's education fees, Pha sells vegetables and her husband does rice farming. In addition, they raise piglets for sale. 

Pha and her other group member are on their fourth loan with VisionFund Cambodia. Each of them asked for KHR 1,400,000. 

Pha, as the head of the group, will use her loan portion to buy more piglets and more vegetables for further sale. Through this loan, Pha dreams to expand her piglets business in order to make more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, a married mother of three kids, is a local farmer from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. She makes a living through rice cultivation and pineapple growing, from which she is able to earn up to 22,500 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the second loan for Chan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  The past loan, which she has repaid, has successfully supported her life as well as her business at a good pace. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her farmland. Therefore, she applied for a new loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy potash, and to pay other necessary fees, including the plowing fee and labor fee. She hopes that she can gain a high yield from her crops so that she can sustain her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy potash, and to pay necessary fees, including the plowing fee and labor fee.

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en:
Da, 38, is a married mother of three children in school. She is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava as the primary source of income and supplements the family’s income via working for others for a fee. For 13 years, she has been engaged in the current business and she is able to earn up to 27,800 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Da with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is a leader in the group consisting of four female members. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay a potash purchasing fee, and to lease additional farmland for growing more cassava.
