As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase more crop yield so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Malay's Group

texts.en:
Malay is a 47-year-old villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district.  She is married and has seven children, two of whom are dependents and still in school.  She earns a living through farming rice on 10 hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 10 years, Malay can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the sixth loan for Malay with VisionFund. Now leading her group of three to apply for another loan, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase more crop so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn, 53, is a widow with one child residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support her family, she has been farming rice for ten years.  She can earn about KHR 16,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future needs. 

Vorn just joined with VisionFund this cycle.  She is leading her group of two to ask for a loan.  She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on gasoline for water pumping. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Socheat's Group

texts.en:
Socheat, 38, is married and has five children, three of whom are dependents and still in school.  They reside in a rural village located in the Battambang For the last ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice, selling rice soup and working for others for a fee as primary sources of the family’s income. She can earn about 20,000 KHR per day.

Socheat’s group consists of four members who live in the same village.  She has been a member of VisionFund for six cycles already and had completely paid back her previous loans. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family and also her current business. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan, Socheat, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, pesticides, seeds

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en:
Ben, 32, is married and has seven children.  They live in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support the family, Ben and her husband have been farming rice for 10 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 27,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for their future needs.

Ben has been with VisionFund for one cycle and had completely paid back the past loan. The previous loan has helped her better support her family’s living condition. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to plow the rice field. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully so as to better off her family's living life style.

loans.use: plow her rice field

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is 29 years old and married. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, earning a living through farming rice. Her husband helps to earn additional income through working as a motor taxi driver. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 60,000 per day from their businesses.

Phalla is in her third microloan with VisionFund. She has completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her current business. Now she is applying for a new loan. Phalla will use this loan to renovate her old kitchen. She hopes to have a decent kitchen for her family to cook in.

loans.use: renovate her old kitchen

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
Mean is a 42-year-old villager from a rural area located in the Mongkol Borey province’s Batanteay Meanchey district. She is married and has five children. She earns a living through raising pigs and her husband is a paid worker to earn extra income. Having been in this business for 15 years, Mean can earn about 35,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

This is the first loan for Mean’s group of four members. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Mean wants to use her portion to buy piglets for raising and pig feed for nourishing them. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price to better her family's living condition.

loans.use: buy piglets and pig feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Sanak's Group

texts.en:
Sanak is 43 years old.  She is married and has two children.  They are living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district.  Sanak and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassavas on six hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 23 years, Sanak manages to earn about 48,000 KHR per day and can save about 15,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Sanak just joined with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan.  She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy a tractor for supporting her cultivated land to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and a tractor for rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nayhoern's Group

texts.en:
Nayhoern is aged 51, married, and has one daughter. She lives in a village of the Prey Chhor district, in Kampong Cham province. Her daughter is still in school. To make a living, Nayhoern and her husband have been working as rice farmers for 30 years. Nayhoern is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day, to meet the family’s needs.

Nayhoern is new with VisionFund, this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group of five members, to ask for a loan. Nayhoern, who is the leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to timely grow her rice, so as to make a better living and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nin's Group

texts.en:
Nin is 61 years old and widowed, and she has 11 children. She is a villager from a rural area, located in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district. She earns a living by farming rice on a one-hectare parcel of farmland. Having been in this business for 40 years, Nin can earn about 38,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the first loan for Nin’s group with VisionFund. Now the five-member group is applying for a loan. As the leader, Nin is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her rice yield, so as to earn more profit and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen is a mother of six children, who resides in Dambae district, Kampong Cham province. Currently, she can afford to send five children to school. For her, one hectare of rice cultivation and two hectares of cassava planting is the primary source of income. Having been in business for five years, she is able to earn up to 25,000 KHR each day from the current business.

Hen's first loan from VisionFund (Kiva's partner) was six loan cycles ago. She has used her loans wisely to support her farm, and this has helped her to relieve her family’s burdens better than before. Now, she is seeking to borrow 1,500,000 KHR, in order to pay the plowing fee and labor cost, and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for both of her cash crops. She highly hopes that she can upgrade her lifestyle, and live better than before.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and labor cost, and to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her rice and cassava crops

loans.name: Jacques Christian

texts.fr: Jacques est un jeune camerounais de 34 ans. père de deux enfants dont le plus âgé a 03 ans et le moins âgé 01 ans, Jaques possède un atelier de photographie d'infographie et sérigraphie. disposant de quelques machines dans son atelier, Jacques souhaite ouvrir un Cyber café avec un centre d'appels international et souhaite avec le crédit acheter des consommables informatives afin d'accompagner l'activité. les bénéfices obtenus permettront de rembourser le crédit d'une part et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en: Jacques is a young man from Cameroon.  He is 34 years old and the father of two children. His oldest child is 3, the youngest is 1.  Jacques owns a studio, equipped with a few machines, where he works in photography, computer graphics and screen printing.  He would like to open a cyber café with an international call center.  With his loan, he would like to buy some computer accessories, necessary to conduct his activity.  His profits will be used in part to repay his loan and also to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish a room in his home.

loans.name: Firmine

texts.fr: Firmine est femme camerounaise de 42 ans. Mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgé 05 ans, elle fait du poisson à la braise qu'elle vend dans un quartier de la ville depuis près de 03 ans. Firmine va tous les jours dans un marché de la place s'approvisionner car elle ne dispose pas d'un congélateur pouvant lui permettre de conserver le poisson. Firmine souhaite avec le montant du crédit s’acheter un congélateur neuf et également des boissons hygiéniques afin d'accompagner le poisson. les bénéfices obtenus permettront à firmine d’assurer l'avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en: Firmine is a 42-year-old woman from Cameroon.  She is married and the mother of five children between the ages of 23 and 5.  She has been preparing and selling braised fish in one of her city's neighborhoods for almost three years.  Since she does not have a freezer to keep fish in a cool place, she has to stock up every day at a local market.  She would like to use her loan to buy a new freezer, as well as health drinks, to go with the fish that she cooks.  With her profits, she will be able to give a better future to her children.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and some fish.

loans.name: Sinet

texts.en:
Sinet is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district. Two of her children are dependent on her and are still in school. She and her husband work as teachers and supplement their income by farming. They have been in this business for 10 years.

Sinet has been with VisionFund for two cycles and successfully paid back the past loans. She is applying for a loan to buy a television, tables, etc., for her family’s use. She hopes to have enough household supplies for her family.

loans.use: to buy a television and tables for her family's use.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat, 53, is widowed with six children and resides in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has struggled as a rice farmer for 35 years. Nat earns about 17,000 KHR per day and saves about 7,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Nat’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. She used the previous loan to help support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group and will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor to plow the field. Nat hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her rice paddy and improve her family’s life style.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor to plow the field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 28 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Luis pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como asistente de un pequeño juzgado de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del trámite para la inscripción de su colegiatura como abogado, de esta manera Luis espera poder cursar sus estudios adecuadamente, a fin de poder lograr mejores oportunidades de trabajo y mejoras como profesional, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis is a 28 year-old single man who lives in the city of Nazca with his parents.  He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to get ahead.  Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Luis was able to pursue the professional field of Law.  In his free time he likes to read and at times cook a delicious "Chupe de Camarones" (Shrimp Soup) to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Luis works as an assistant to a small court in his city.  He works every day for around ten hours and he believes things are going well because of his dedication and for the kind treatment he offers to others.

Luis is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to meet the tuition expenses for his Law program.  In this way Luis hopes to be able to pursue his studies adequately, with the goal of achieving better work opportunities and improvements as a professional. For that reason he will continue working and pushing himself to achieve his great dream of having his own home.

loans.use: To cover educational expenses.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Aty se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de San Pedro. Todas la Integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero se ayudan con actividades en conjunto para salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Marta es una de las miembros de este grupo, ella es una persona muy entusiasta que siempre pone de ella y ayuda a sus compañeras del grupo. Se dedica a la venta de pescado en lo que le está yendo muy bien pues siempre tiene muy buenos peces y eso gusta a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de pescados, ya que quiere poder tener un buen stock para poder seguir dando a su clientela productos frescos y de buena calidad.
texts.en:
The committee Kuña Aty was formed from the union of various neighbors in the city of San Pedro.  All the members of the committee work in independent areas, but they help each other with common activities in order to get ahead and help their families.  

Marta is one of the group members.  She is a very enthusiastic person who always helps her companions in the group.  She works selling fish and it is going well since she always has very good fish and her clients like that.  She is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of fish, since she wants to be able to have good stock in order to continue giving her customers fresh products and good quality.

loans.use: To purchase fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Lidia Lizeth

texts.es: La Sra. Lidia, tiene 23 años, se dedica  a la actividad de elaboración y  venta de pan y repostería, tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, en la zona de Bustillos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Lidia va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de azúcar  y harina al por mayor para la elaboración de sus panes ya que incremento su clientela y quiere abastecerse de este producto ya que esta época suben los precio, La Sra. Lidia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que se levanta muy temprano para poder empezar la jornada para lo cual enfrenta el frio y también con le calor del horno es también posible de contraer una pulmonía y dolor de huesos va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas implementos para su panadería y seguir creciendo, la Sra. Lidia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad ya que le ayuda a crecer en su negocio como también en mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Lidia, 23, works making and selling bread and pastries. She has her bakery, which is located in her place of residence, in the Bustillos area. This is her first loan from the institution. Lidia will use this loan to buy sugar and flour wholesale for making her bread since she has more customers and she wants to stock up on this product. Around this time, prices go up. Lidia faces challenges in her business, like getting up very early to be able to start her workday, and therefore facing the cold and also the heat from the oven. It is also possible to contract pneumonia and bone pain. She will use the profits to buy more implements for her bakery and continue to grow. Lidia is a very hard-working person. She is happy for the opportunity since it will help her to grow in her business as well as improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar to stock up due to the possible rise in price.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé âgée de 45ans est mère de 02enfants qui vont à l’école. Ils sont âgés de 20 et 18ans. Depuis 2007, elle revend dans une boutique de la boisson locale « SODABI » à toutes personnes. Pour renforcer son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un troisième prêt pour acheter de la marchandise. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et comme perspectives d’avenir voudrait acheter en quantité considérables pour revendre, tirer un maximum de profit et bien entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Ayélé, aged 45, is the mother of two children who both attend school.  They are 20 and 18 years old.  Since 2007, Ayélé has been reselling a local drink called "sodabi" in a shop.  She sells to a wide range of customers.  In order to strengthen her stock and to buy more merchandise, she is requesting a third loan from WAGES.  She wants to reinvest in her activity.  In the future, she would like to buy in very large quantities in order to maximize her profits when reselling.  Her goal is to take good care of her family.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Kin is 53 years old and a mother of three children. She makes a living from her 1½ hectare rice farm with support from her husband. She makes about 21,000 KHR and has been rice farming for 20 years.

After two successful past loans, Kin feels empowered to improve her lifestyle even more than before. She can now afford to buy a television and radio. She is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy potash, rice seed, and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that her fields produce a high yield and make triple the profit for her family’s sake.

loans.use: to buy potash, rice seed, and pesticide for her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es una persona muy trabajadora, este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva, y gracias al anterior pudo surtirse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que le fue muy útil para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
El solicita de este nuevo crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de hamacas, sabanas, frazadas y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas y con lo cual podrá seguir aportando con los ingresos de la casa.
texts.en:
Miguel is a very hard-working person.  This is his second Kiva loan, and thanks to the first one he was able to stock his business and meet the requests of his customers.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he received, since it was very helpful for him to continue investing in his business.  

He is asking for this new loan in order to invest it in the purchase of hammocks, sheets, and blankets in addition to food products in order to continue with his sales and thus be able to continue providing income for his household.

loans.use: To purchase hammocks, sheets, and blankets in addition to other items.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh,41, is a local citizen from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has five children. Nowadays, she needs to look after four children only as they are still in school. She manages one hectare of land where rice is growing and three hectares of cassava planting.  She has been involved in agriculture for 20 years. 

Nhanh’s prior loan was the original loan with VisoinFund (Kiva’s partner). She has used her past loan smartly to provide daily decent food for her kids and to keep them in school. Now, she is seeking for a new loan in amount of 4,000,000 KHR to buy potash, insecticide, seeds, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to gain more yield to sell during high price so that she can earn more income to sustain her living needs.

loans.use: to buy potash, insecticide, seeds, and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Luz Mila Del Pilar

texts.es: Luz Mila de 57 años de edad vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, a orillas del mar Caribe con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 30 y 32 años. Allí en este lugar tiene su pequeño taller de confecciones , experiencia que obtuvo desde hace 40 años, cuando a su madre, siendo modista, la veia entre tela, hilos y maquinas diariamente trabajando. Su interés en el arte de confeccionar la llevó a trabajar como empleada de talleres en la ciudad de Barranquilla y  el municipio de Puerto Colombia; allí perfeccionó el oficio , para emprender su propia aventura de negocios hace 10 años,  cuando inició en su propia casa, con maquinarias y herramientas básicas que compró, enfocandose  a su vez en las líneas masculina, especialmente pantalones masculinos, aunque conoce la confeccion a nivel general. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito. Luz Mila pemanece dia a dia trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, para responder a su clientela entre la que se encuentran vecinos del sector y referidos por estos, que hoy constituyen su base de compradores. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar sus ventas y contratar mas operarias , pero requiere responder a un gran desafio de aumento de la producción, porque su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a las expectativas de crecimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financimeinto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual compará una máquina de coser industrial, una fileteadora y materias primas e insumos como telas, hilos y accesorios. Con ello inicará el mejoramiento de sus tiempos productivos e iniciará el incremento de su producción.
texts.en:
Luz Mila is 57 years-old and lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, on the shore of the Caribbean ocean.  She lives with her husband and she has children ages 30 and 32.  She has a small sewing shop, and she has gained experience in the field for the past 40 years.  Her mother, who was a dress-maker, had her work with fabric, thread and machines daily from a young age.  He interest in the art of sewing brought her to work as an employee in a seamstress shop in the city of Barranquilla in the area of Puerto Colombia.  There she perfected the work.  She began her own business 10 years ago, and she started in her own home.  She started with basic machines and tools that she bought, focusing first on masculine lines, especially men's pants, although she knows sewing for all styles. She makes sales for cash or credit.  Luz Mila works everyday from 8am to 6pm in order to meet her customer's needs.  Her customers include neighbors from her sector and other people her neighbors refer, and those people today constitute her customer base.

Her goal for the future is to increase her sales and contract more operators, but it requires that she respond to a great challenge through a production increase, because the capital from her work is not sufficient to respond to the expectations for growth.  Currently she is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first credit that she will receive from Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan she will buy an industrial sewing machine, a surger (overlock sewing machine), and raw materials and products like fabric, thread, and other accessories. With the loan she will improve her productivity and begin to increase her production.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine, a surger (overlock sewing machine), and raw materials and products like fabric, thread, and other accessories.

loans.name: Savuth

texts.en: Savut is a paid worker residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province.  She is 43 years old and married. She has two children to take care of as they are still in school in the local area. She makes a living by working at the rubber plantation. Savut has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is seeking her first loan to pay for the house builder. She hopes to own a good house to live in with her kids.

loans.use: to pay for the house builder

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Then's Group

texts.en:
Then is 49 years old and married. She has five children, four of whom are students in the local public school while the remaining one is helping with the family business. One hectare area of cassava planting and another hectare and half of rice farming are the main source of the family's income. The current business returns her about 20,800 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Then with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has repaid back her past loan with success and it has helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood at a good pace. Now, she formed a group composed of four members to apply for a new loan.  The total amount of her group loan is 4,400,000 KHR. As a group leader whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, Then will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seeds. She hopes to gain high yields from both cash-crops and sell at a high price to make more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seeds

loans.name: Natalka

texts.ru:
Наталка – из Королёво. Она торгует женской одеждой, брюками, блузками и т.п. в своем арендованном магазине. В торговле работает уже 10 лет. Наталка – замужем, у нее ест сын и дочь.  
Наталке не хватало средств, чтобы поехать на закупку товара для сезонной торговли. Вот она и обратилась к КИВА за дополнительной финансовой помощью в размере 5 000 гривен. Со временем Наталка планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку. В планах по развитию своего дела Наталке очень помогают ее честность и трудолюбие.
texts.en:
Natalka is from Korolyovo.  She sells women's clothes, pants, blouses etc. in a store that she rents.  She has been working in retail for 10 years already.  She is married, with one son and one daughter.

Lacking the funds to purchase merchandise for seasonal commerce, Natalka has turned to Kiva to obtain additional financial assistance.  She has requested a loan of 5,000 hryvnia.  Over time, she would like to open another retail outlet.  Natalka's goal is to develop her business; her honesty and industriousness will get her there.

loans.use: to buy clothes for seasonal commerce.

loans.name: Choub's Group

texts.en:
Chuob, originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, is 37 years old and has three school aged children. He overcomes the family’s hardship by growing rice and cassava. Through 15 years of engagement in the current business, he is able to earn up to 19,400 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Chuob’s group consisting of two male members. The past loan which he has fully repaid has relieved his issue regarding providing three meals a day for his children. Now, he is seeking for 1,000,000 KHR while the second member of his group is applying for 500,000 KHR. As a group leader, he will use his loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for plowing fees. He hopes that he can increase the income from his business and provide for his living needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
A single woman, aged 28 and residing in the Bakan district of Pursat province, Samun is a rice farmer on four hectares of farmland. This is the only business that she has owned for many years; it brings in about 43,800 KHR per day. This is her third loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid back completely, have helped Samun earn a decent income to improve her standard of living. 

Now she needs working capital to support her business. She is applying for a new loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR to buy gasoline for her mini tractor and to buy two sacks of fertilizer to boost her crop productivity. Samun hopes that she can earn more profit and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for her mini tractor.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: A 47-year-old mother of six kids residing in Pursat province, Chanthorn struggles to support her big rice farm. Besides helping in the rice field, her husband hires himself out to others to help support the family. Chanthorn has had her business for 10 years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day. This is her fifth loan from VisionFund (Cambodia); she has completely repaid back her past loans. The past loans helped her to grow her business especially in purchasing fertilizer to boost her farm's productivity. For this loan cycle, Chanthorn will use her loan to pay for her child’s wedding. She hopes that she can fulfill her responsibility as the mother and arrange a proper wedding for her child.

loans.use: To pay for her child’s wedding.

loans.name: Sroeung's Group

texts.en: Residing under a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Sroeung is 53 years old and has two children who are currently studying at the local state school. The primary source of her income is from rice cropping while the supplementary income is from rice milling service. She has been with this business for 15 years and is able to generate about 43,000 KHR per day. The main challenge for her business is the shortage of working capital to support her farmland. To overcome this challenge, she formed a group of five people to apply for a new loan. This is the first microloan for Sroeung with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The total requesting loan amount of her group is 3,200,000 KHR, of which 800,000 KHR is her loan portion. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to buy gasoline for her mini tractor to support her farmland. She hopes to get a triple yield from her crops and multiple her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and gasoline

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Khoeurn's Group

texts.en: Khoeut is 41 years old and a widow who needs to support one of her children. She lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. For her child's sake, she earns a living by farming rice and corn on two hectares each. Her previous loan was her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She used her past loan to maintain her business as well as her lifestyle. Now she wants to better support her farmland. Hence, she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She and her co-borrower are seeking 1,200,00 KHR and 1,400,000 KHR respectively. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for her two cash crops. She hopes that she can make more income to buy an additional plot of farmland for growing rice.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: I's Group

texts.en: I is 32 years old and has four children. She is originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Her main source of income is rice farming, from which she earns up to 30,000 KHR per day. This is her second loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). I has managed to repay her past loan successfully. Now she is group leader of her group of two. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to make more profit to buy more farmland to expand her rice business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Saroub's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Saroub is 38 years old and married. She has three children, some of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she has been working as a tailor while her husband works in construction in the local area. 
Saroub has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles. She successfully used the past loans to better feed her family. Now she leads her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy materials for her husband’s construction business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Ann is age 56, married and has two children. To make a living and support her family, Ann and her husband have been farming rice, planting cassava and rubber as a primary business for 36 years and she supplements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 38,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first microloan for Ann’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to request a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, Ann, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. With this loan, she hopes to get a high yield from her current business to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Vakunthea's Group

texts.en:
Vakunthea is age 44, married, has six children and lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She and her husband earn a living through growing cassava and rubber which they have been doing for ten years. The current business earns them about 29,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 7,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Vakunthea’s group consists of two members who have been members of VisionFund for three cycles. Vakunthea successfully used the past loans to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy rice fertilizer and pesticide for her cultivated land and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow her cassava and rubber successfully and increase her current business to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizer and pesticide for her cultivated land

loans.name: Ett's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Damabe district, Ett is a 32-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice and cassava planting for three years. To better support the family, her husband works for others for a fee to increase their income. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Ett has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Ett completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to fulfill her dream to build a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Thok's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district, Thok is 60-years-old, married and has ten children. She earns a living through farming rice. She supplements the income by running a battery charging business. Having been in these businesses for 10 years, Thok can earn about 34,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

This is the fourth loan for Thok with VisionFund. She successfully used the loans to better her living conditions. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Thok wants to use her portion to buy a machine for supporting her battery charging business. She hopes to increase more income for her current business in order to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy a machine for supporting her battery charging business

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Chanthy is a 37-year-old widowed mother of one son who is still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for nine years. She can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs and manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Chanthy’s group consists of five members who are just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group of five to apply for a loan. Chanthy, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her son in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nimol's Group

texts.en:
Nimol is 31-years-old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school while the remaining one is too young for school. She and her husband have worked very hard for several years to support the family by farming rice. The current business earns them about 35,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is the fifth loan for Nimol with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to sell it for a good price to better off her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Mao is a 32-year-old mother of two dependent children, who are still in school. She is a farmer who grows rice and cassava in the local area. Sometimes her husband works for others for a fee to earn additional income for her family. Having been in the business for 11 years, Mao can earn a daily income of approximately 36,000 KHR and is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

This is the second loan for Mao with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used the first loan from VisionFund to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burdens. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to achieve a timely harvest of rice and cassava so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn is 28-years-old and widowed. To make a living, he has been growing rice, watermelon and cucumbers for two years. The current business earns him about 16,000 KHR per day and he is able to save about 10,000 KHR daily for the future needs. 

This is the second loan for Horn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He completely paid back the past loan which has enabled him to expand his farmland. Now he is requesting another loan to buy more plots of farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yield to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more plots of farmland

loans.name: Hoern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Hoern is a 38-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She and her husband have earned a living by growing cassava on one-hectare of farmland for eighteen years. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

This is a group loan for Hoern’s group and she is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Hoern, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, Hoern hopes to increase her current business and also hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 34-years-old, married, has three children and lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She and her husband earn a living by planting cassava and farming rice which they have been doing for 14 years. The current business earns them about 17,000 KHR per day. 

Srey’s group consists of two female members. Srey is a first cycle-client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to grow her cassava successfully and increase her current business to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Theng's Group

texts.en:
Theng is aged 31 years and married with two children living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and growing cassava, which they have been doing for 11 years. The current business earns them about 14,000 KHR (Cambodaian riels) per day and allows them to save about 8,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Theng’s group consists of three female members who live in the same village, and she has been a member of VisionFund for one loan cycle. Theng successfully used the first loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice as well as cassava successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Chea is aged 40 years and widowed with three children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living and support her family, Chea has been planting cassava as a primary business for 20 years. She is able to earn about 10,000 KHR (Cambodaian riels) to need the family’s needs. 

This is the second microloan for Chea with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, while the other members are just starting with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now leading her group to request a loan, Chea will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava field. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her cassava to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava field.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is 39 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has three dependent children to take care of, and now they are in school in the local area. Rice farming on 5 hectares of farmland is the primary source of her family’s income, and she has been in this business for 10 years. To add more income, she also sells desserts. With the current business, Sokhom can earn approximately 20,000 KHR (Cambodaian riels) per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the eighth microloan for Sokhom with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now leading her group of five to apply for a loan, Sokhom will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Loem's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Loem is a 35-year-old married mother of four children who are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years, and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 24,000 KHR (Cambodaian riels) per day to meet family’s needs, and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Loem’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely repaid the loan. The first loan has helped Loem better support her family members. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Loem wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily, and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
Aged 51 years, Rin is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and growing corn, which she has been doing for 18 years. Rin can earn about 40,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the eighth loan for Rin’s group of three with VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Rin will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice and corn farming production to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en:
Seak is 34 years old and living with her children in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district. Two of her children are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming is the main source for her family’s income, and she has been in this business for several years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 50,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) to meet the family’s needs. 

Seak has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles while the other group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the previous loans with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high crop yield from her rice paddy.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang, aged 35, is living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district. She has seven children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers in the area to make a living. She has been in this business for 10 years. Together, they can earn about 35,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business. 

This is a microloan for Heang’s group of two members who have been with VisionFund for five loan cycles. The past two loans that Heang completely repaid have helped her relieve financial burdens and improved her livelihood. Now requesting a loan, Heang, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her paddy rice business to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Thmor Khoul district, Ren, 38, has four children in total. All of whom are still in school.  Ren is a teacher in a local area to support the family. To complement the income, she and her husband have been involving farming rice for ten years. She and her husband can earn about 50,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Ren has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve livelihood. Now leading her group of three to ask for another loan, Ren, who is the leader will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and also hope to make more rice to better off her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Pabitra

texts.en:
Pabitra, a differently-abled person, age 27, is unmarried and lives with his parents and two siblings. He resides in Odisha, India. For the past five years, Pabitra has been operating a variety store at the village market to earn a living and support his family. He sells detergents, chocolates, noodles, soaps, talcum powder, and other daily-used necessities for the household in his shop. He earns 6,000 INR. The part that he likes most about his job is the interaction with different kinds of customers through which he comes to know about the different tastes and preferences of the customers.

He requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase more stock of what he sells plus a few additional products like stationery, wafers, hair oil, shampoo etc. to meet the needs of his customers. In the future, Pabitra wants to enhance his business and see that his parents live a better life than they are living now.

loans.use: to purchase stationery, wafers, hair oil, shampoo etc

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a divorced lady, age 27, who lives with her parents. She is the only source of income for her family. She sells bangles, nail polish, gold-plated jewelry items, clips, hair accessories, beads etc. in her ladies novelty store. She has been in the business of selling cosmetics and jewelry for the past three years.

She is applying for a loan to buy more jewelry and beauty products such as make-up, lipsticks and creams in order to improve and enrich the business through the availability of more variety of products to meet customer demand.

This loan will help to improve her sales and enable her to offer a new product line to her customers. Her objective is to expand the business and include new products such as clothing in her existing business and save enough for her family's future with the increased revenues from the increased sales supported by the variety in products.

loans.use: to purchase gold-plated jewelry and beauty products for her ladies novelty store.

loans.name: Manoj Kumar

texts.en:
Manoj Kumar is a 32-year-old differently able person living with his wife and two children who are in school. For the past 10 years, he has been engaged in the activity of weaving saris (traditional Indian dress). His wife helps him in the weaving.

The financial condition of his family is not good because he is the only one to earn in the family and he is not able to do hard labor because of his physical condition. He brings raw materials like cotton, needles, thread and colors from a dealer and gives back the finished goods to him. In return, he gets only the labor cost, which is very little.

He has a plan to bring raw material directly from the market in bulk and sell the finished product in the market. Doing so will increase his income and reduce the transportation costs by reducing his frequent visits to the market.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase raw materials for weaving saris. He has a dream that his children will get the best education and that he will save some money for his family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase cotton, needles, thread and colors for weaving saris (traditional Indian dress)

loans.name: Denis Maria

texts.es: Denis de 47 años, tiene un taller de modistería en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde habita con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 13 a 18 años. Ella en sus diez años de experiencia en el oficio,  ha ejercido su emprendimiento en un pequeño taller, donde confecciona todo tipo de costuras, en las líneas femenina y casual; para llegar a este punto debió realizar cursos técnicos en academias que le enseñaron las diversas técnicas y la calidad en sus procesos, lo cual lo perfeccionó con su día a día laboral autónomo. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito entre la clientela que ha estructurado durante muchos años y que hoy son compradores fijos de sus productos, desde el diseño hasta el acabado, pues aplica uno a uno como su estrategia de mercado personal. Sus compras las realiza en almacenes especializados de telas en al ciudad y en corseterías. Su línea de mayor mercado es la femenina-casual y su meta es ampliar la infraestructura de su taller, agregando nuevas maquinarias y contratando operadoras, así como incursionando en nuevos mercados. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina industrial además de materias primas e insumos, con lo cual aumentará su producción y mejorará la calidad de las prendas y los tiempos productivos. Esta es justamente la razón de éxito de la  inversión de su credikiva, con el cual planea el incremento de sus ventas y poco a poco alcanzar su sueño de tener la oportunidad de educara a sus hijos en instituciones de calidad que potencialicen su éxito futuro.
texts.en:
Denis, 47, is a seamstress and has a workshop in the city of Barranquilla, where she lives with her husband and three children, ages 13 to 18.  She has  ten years' experience in her profession and works out of a small shop where she makes all kinds feminine-casual wear.  To get where she is today, she had to take classes at the academy where she learned about different techniques and how to lend quality to her work.  She perfects this on a daily basis through her job.  She sells on credit and in cash to the clientele she has built over seveal years.  She has a fixed customer base for her products, from the design through the finish, applying these processes as her own strategy aimed at personal marketing.

She buys fabric at specialized fabric and corsetry shops and her most popular line is her feminine-casual wear.  Her goal is to expand her workshop by adding new machines and hiring workers, as well as going into new markets.  She is requesting a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy an industrial sewing machine as well as raw materials and supplies.  This is so she can increase production and improve the quality of her apparel, while speeding up production time.  This is precisely the reason the loan will be a success.  She aims to increase sales and little by little reach her goal of being able to educate her children at good schools that will prepare them for a successful future.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Indira

texts.es: Indira desde que llegó de su pueblo natal a la ciudad de Barranquilla no ha cesado de trabajar, antes como empleada y una vez contrajo matrimonio emprendió su propio negocio comercial, mediante el cual vende alectrodomésticos menores, ropa interior y exterior, financiando etsos articulos a una clientela que ha estructurado desde hace 3 años y a quienes vende directamente, mediante pedidos los articulos que desan y necesitan. Su meta es ampliar su negocio, pero su mayor desafio es que su capital d etrabajo no es sufieinte para responder a su propósito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará ropa planchas, licuadoras, tostadoras, cosméticos, perfumería etc. Con su inversión aumentará el numero de sus clientes y así mismo sus ganancias, pues comprará en mayor volumen, obteniendo descuentos y tambien tendrá un fondo de efectivo para diversificar un poco mas su oferta de mercancias y esto es justamente lo que hace preceer el éxito de su invesión.
texts.en:
Since arriving from the place of her birth, the city of Barranquilla, Indira has not stopped working.  She used to work as an employee, but after marrying she set up her own business selling small domestic appliances, lingerie and clothing and has been financing her activity through the clientele she put together over three years.  She sells directly to her customers on an order basis.  

Her goal is to expand business, but her greatest challenge is that she does not have enough work capital to do so.  She is requesting a CrediKiva loan to buy clothing, irons, juicers, toasters, cosmetics, perfumes, etc.  With this investment she will increase the number of customers and also her earnings.  She will buy more volume, obtain larger discounts  and also have a cash fund to diversify the merchandise she has on offer.  This is exactly what she needs to make her investment successful.

loans.use: To buy clothing, irons, juicers, toasters, cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Solidario Mujeres De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Solidario Mujeres de Sumpango.
En este solidario lo integran María Luisa, madre de familia además es originaria de Sumpango, es dueña de una venta de comida, y siempre prepara distintos platillos para vender, tiene que hacer un total de 120 almuerzos diarios y que gracias a Dios siempre lo termina a pesar de la competencia su negocio siempre ha sido prospero, es el tercer crédito que solicitan con fape y siempre ha pagado puntualmente, además agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada en lo dos años anteriores. Además promete pagar puntualmente en cada pago asi como lo hiso en los anteriores creditos. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia en productos comestibles de consumo para elaborar almuerzos.
texts.en: One of the members of the "Mujeres de Sumpango" communal bank is María Luisa, a mother from Sumpango who sells food for a living.  She makes different dishes and serves 120 lunches per day.  She is thankful to be able to sell everything on a daily basis making her business profitable, despite the competition she has always had.  This is her third loan through FAPE and she has always been punctual making her payments.  She is grateful to KIVA for its help over the last two years.  She is committed to paying this loan back on time as on previous occasions.  She plans to use the loan to buy food products to make lunches.

loans.use: To buy food products to make lunches.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 29 años, está casada con Atilio de 44 años y tiene tres hijos, de 22, 18 y 04 años respectivamente, vive a lado de su familia en su casa propia .El trabajo de Lucy consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas, tiene un proveedor que se encarga de llevarle los pedidos a su casa, además tiene el arte de la cocina en sus manos y lo aprovecha vendiendo postres. Lleva realizando su trabajo por más de 4 años y lo hace sola.Le gusta mucho su trabajo y se siente a gusto repartiendo su tiempo entre las actividades de su casa, sus hijos y su negocio a su vez está muy contenta de tener tan buenos ingresos ya que le permite pensar en ampliar su negocio y poner una fuente de soda .Este es el crédito número 03 con Kiva, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.En está oportunidad solicitar S/.2000 soles, para comprar ingredientes que le serviran en la  preparación de sus postres, además comprará bebidas de todo tipo, marca y presentación ya que desea incrementar su stock de ventas.
texts.en:
Lucy, 29, is married to Atilio, 44, and they have three children, ages 22, 18 and 4, and live in their own home.  Lucy's work consists of selling sodas which are delivered to her home by a supplier.  She is also a good cook and sells desserts, and has been working alone for over four years.  She enjoys dividing her time between the household chores, her children and the business, and is glad to have a good income which is makingmakes her think about opening a soda fountain.  

This is her third Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support which is sure to help advance her work.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and will use the 2,000 PEN to buy ingredients to make desserts.  She also will buy all kinds and brands of sodas to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make desserts and sodas.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando con su anterior credikiva, compró al por mayor y de contado productos no perecederos para elaborar almuerzos y con ello pudo bajar los costos de producción; en sus compras obtuvo descuentos especiales y ganó mucho tiempo porque disminuyó la frecuencia en la compra.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, que invertirá en productos como enlatados, pescado, verduras pues no permitirá que su inventario decline, porque es necesario para su ahorro en tiempo y para ofrecer  diversidad de menús.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es de mucho agradecimiento y espera seguir contando con su ayuda. Con su nueva  inversión  de credikiva, se prepara para la semana mayor, temporada en la cual los menús estarán basados en los tradicionales pescados y productos del mar, así que estará listo para el recogimiento y la renuncia cristiana de la semana santa.
texts.en:
Hernando used his previous CrediKiva loan to buy wholesale non-perishable goods to make lunches in an effort to lower production costs.  He was able to get special discounts and gain time by shopping less frequently.  He is requesting a CrediKiva loan to buy products such as canned goods, fish and vegetables to maintain his inventory, save time and offer a wider variety on his menu.

He is very grateful to Kiva lenders and hopes to be able to continue receiving your support.  With this new loan he will prepare for the holidays when the menu is based on traditional fish and seafood.  This will make him ready for the Christian spiritual withdrawal of Holy Week.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
This is Jeannette, aged 51. She is married with six children between the ages of 10 and 34. Only three of them goes to school and the rest have completed. Jeannette sells sorghum and has spent 10 years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more tonnes of sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children. 

She still insists on making more investments in the business of selling sorghum, and she is delighted with the previous loan, which has helped a lot to increase the volume of sales.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 34 years old. She lives in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and her husband is a businessman. Both of them have three children between four and 16 years old who live at home and attends school. 

For the past four years Victoria has been selling rice, oil, etc. Victoria started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business makes her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, etc for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, etc for her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman and a mother of two children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than five years now. This is the source of their income. 

Catherine is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and floaters. With this, they will be able to improve their business and augment their income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 36 años, es casada y tiene 03 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia construida a base de material noble .Martha se dedica a la venta de comida en diferentes lugares, se levanta temprano para empezar la faena diaria, cocina y lleva sus deliciosos potajes a las diferentes construcciones de la ciudad, donde tiene clientes que ha podido ganar gracias a la calidad de los platillos que ofrece, tiene muy buena sazón y eso hace que sus clientes le sean fieles. Lleva trabajando por 05 años en esta actividad y se va sola ya que sus hijos tienen que estudiar.Le fascina hacer su trabajo por que siempre le gustó la cocina, desde muy niña le encantó el arte culinario y si esta labor viene acompañada de ganancias económicas mejor aún. Asegura que es muy gratificante observar el rostro de agrado que muestran sus clientes cuando consumen sus potajes y espera consolidar su trabajo y progresar haciendo lo que mas le gusta.Este es el préstamo número 05 con Kiva, y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan ya que es el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante ,tambien se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual . En está oportunidad solicitará S/.2000 soles para la compra de verduras, tubérculos y diversas carnes para continuar preparando sus deliciosos potajes, además comprará platos descartables y un armario de cocina para guardar todos los utensilios que usa a diario en su faena laboral.
texts.en: Martha is 36 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with them in her own house, which is built out of noble material. Martha makes a living selling food in different places. She wakes up early so as to do start her daily chores. She cooks and takes her delicious stews to different places in the city where she has customers. She has customers thanks to the quality of the dishes she offers - the flavours are excellent and so Martha's customers are loyal. Martha has been doing this work for five years and does it alone because her children have to study. She enjoys her work as she has always enjoyed cooking. Every since she was a little girl she has loved the art of cooking so being able to make a living through it is great for her. Martha says it is very gratifying to see the grateful looks on customers' faces when they are enjoying her stews. Martha hopes to consolidate her work and progress in doing what she enjoys most. This is her fifth loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for this loan opportunity as it is just the financial support that she needs to continue moving forward. Martha promises that she will be punctual with her repyaments. On this occasion she is applying for 2000 Nuevo Soles to buy vegetables, potatoes and various meats so as to continue preparing her delicious dishes. In addition she will buy disposable plates and a kitchen cupboard to store all the utensils she uses in her work every day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Flor De La Cruz

texts.es:
Flor tiene 37 años de edad, tiene tres hijos. Desde hace ocho años elabora y vende pupusas, actividad que aprendió de una hermana. Antes solo se dedicaba al quehacer del hogar ya que es la menor de sus cinco hermanos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cambiarle el techo a su vivienda y realizar otras mejoras a la casa ya que esta deteriorada y el invierno esta muy próximo. Así, ya no estará con la preocupación de que se mojaran o alga les pueda pasar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor is 37 years old and she has three children. For eight years she has been making and selling stuffed tortillas, a skill she learned from one of her sisters. Before Flor would only do the household chores, as she is the youngest of five siblings.
She is applying for a loan from Fundación Campo to change the roof on her house and make other improvements to the deteriorated house before winter arrives. With this work done Flor will not have to worry about water coming in or that something might happen to her children.

loans.use: to change the roof on her house and make other improvements to the deteriorated house before winter arrives.

loans.name: Solidario Mujeres Triunfantes Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO MUJERES TRIUNFANTES
Está integrado por Sandra Maribel quien nos cuenta que es propietaria de una tienda ubicada en su casa desde hace varios años, con la cual sostiene a su mama y ella misma, ella vende artículos, como golosinas, azúcar, frijol, arroz, aceite, aguas, y venta de agua salvavidas también hace helados choco frutas, además vende fruta por bolsita y verduras , vende pastelitos, además tiene una máquina para bordar y elaborar algunas prendas de vestir como blusas y delantales, o hacer costuras que las personas le llegan a pedir, ella está muy contenta con su trabajo y por eso solicita este crédito para seguir surtiendo su tienda en productos comestibles de consumo diario para salir adelante,  porque el sueño de ella es de seguir estudiando en la universidad dice que tal vez sea difícil pero no imposible, está trabajando para seguir manteniéndose.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Triunfantes" Communal Bank
One member of this group is Sandra Maribel who tells us that for some years she has been running a shop out of her home. With the shop she supports both herself and her mother. Sandra sells items such as sweets, sugar, beans, rice, oil and water. In addition she sells chocolate and fruit ice creams, as well as fruit, vegetables and cakes, She also has a sewing machine for embroidering and making some clothing items, such as blouses or aprons, or for dressmaking when customers order them. Sandra is very happy with her work and so she is applying for this loan to continue stocking up her store with staple food products so as to move ahead. Sandra's dream is to continue studying at university. She says it might be difficult, but not impossible. Sandra works so as to continue supporting herself.

loans.use: to buy staple food products.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla est un homme âgé de 36 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Komla travaille comme revendeur de friperie(chaussures) depuis 2000. Il vend de façon ambulante et achète au port Autonome de Lomé. Komla a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de friperies. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité en louant une boutique  et assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille.
texts.en: Komla is 36 years old.  He is married to a reseller and has no children in his care.  Komla has been reselling used clothing (shoes) since 2000.  He works as an itinerant seller and buys his goods at the Autonomous Port of Lomé.  Komla has requested a second loan from WAGES in order to buy used clothing.  He wants to reinvest in his activity and rent a shop.  His goal is to provide a bright future to his family.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes (shirts, pants..)

loans.name: Kouessan

texts.fr: Kouessan est déclarant en douane, son travail consiste à faciliter les entrées et marchandises de ses clients sur le territoire togolais. il veut pouvoir se déplacer facilement d'un client à l'autre, raison pour laquelle il s'est adressé à WAGES pour obtenir un second crédit pour acheter une moto. il a une ancienneté de 23 ans de cette activité. il est marié et père de 6 enfants dont 03 à l’école. L’ainé a 24ans et le dernier 05ans. Mr Kouessan à lui – même 54ans.
texts.en:
Kouessan is a customs broker. His work consists in facilitating the entry of his clients' merchandises into Togo. He has 23 years of experience in this business.

He wants to be able to easily travel from one client to the next, which is why he contacted Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to obtain a second loan to purchase a motorcycle.

Kouessan is 54 years old, married, and the father of six children, out of whom three attend school. The eldest is 24 years old, the youngest is five.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to visit his clients

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Afin de refinancer son activité et avoir une meilleure condition de vie, Abla sollicite son premier prêt à WAGES pour atteindre ses objectifs. Elle est revendeuse de produits congelés. Elle est mère de 03 enfants majeurs qui ne vont plus à l’école et a pour conjoint un revendeur.
texts.en:
With the aim of refinancing her business and improving her standard of living, Abia is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to reach her goals.

She resells frozen products. She's the mother of three adult children who don't attend school anymore. Her husband is a reseller.

loans.use: to buy frozen products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 34 años, es madre soltera de un niño de 09 años de edad, reside en su casa propia al lado de su menor hijo .Rosa se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir , razón por la cual tiene su taller instalado en su hogar ,a donde acuden sus clientes en busca de alguna solución para sus prendas en mal estado  y en donde tambien confecciona prendas a pedido del cliente según su preferencia y elección . Posee 02 máquinas de coser y una remalladora, la cual pudo comprar con sus ahorros. Lleva 11 años en este trabajo, cuando no hay mucha demanda trabaja sola y cuando necesita que le ayuden se ve obligada a contratar a dos personas más .Siempre le gustó la costura y ama su trabajo, le agrada elaborar sus propias creaciones y desarrollar su creatividad, cuando no tiene clientes que atender o prendas que refaccionar sale a vender las prendas que ha confeccionado, espera mas adelante poner un taller de confección bien implementado y empezar a magnificar su trabajo para convertirse en proveedora de una tienda grande de la ciudad.Este es el crédito número 05 con Kiva, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el apoyo financiero que necesita para  concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual .En está opotunidad solicitará S/.1500 soles para la compra de materiales de confección tales como botones, blondas, hilos de diferentes colores, elásticos y telas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 34, is a single mother. Her son is nine years old, and they live together in their own house. Rosa tailors garments and she has a workshop at home, where her customers come to fix their worn out clothes, or to make special orders. Rosa has two sewing machines and an overlock machine, bought with her savings. She has worked in this activity for eleven years. When the demand is low she works alone, but sometimes she needs to hire two assistants.

Rosa has always liked to sew and loves her job; she enjoys designing and creating. During low-demand seasons she goes out and sells her designs. She hopes to have a well-equipped workshop in the future and to expand her business to become a supplier of one of the large stores in town.

This is Rosa’s fifth loan with Kiva. She appreciates the financial support that people have given her, necessary to realize her plans. She promises to pay the installments on time. This time, she is requesting 1500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy different materials like buttons, silk laces, different color threads, elastics and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies like fabrics, buttons and elastics.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Sra. Mariana tiene 24 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la localidad de Santa Martha, este préstamo es su  tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Mariana va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como compas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Mariana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Mariana se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en: Mariana is 24 years old. She sells seasonal clothing at hers sales locale in the community of Santa Martha. this loan is her third cycle in the institution.  Mariana is going to use this loan to buy clothing wholesale such as sweaters and jackets, to stock her store. Her reason for asking for this loan is a lack of capital. Mariana faces challenges in her business, such as daily competition. She is going to use the profits to keep improving her sales locale. She wants for her business to have a variety of merchandise to offer a variety of products to her customers. Mariana is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has offered, since it will allow her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing such as sweaters and jackets.

loans.name: Mirian Alicex

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 30 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar arena, ladrillo, cemento para construir su vivienda. Con la inversión, podra construir una casa segura, cómoda para que su hijo pueda desarrollarse y ella estar más tranquila.
texts.en:
Mirian is 30 years old. She has a spouse and a son. She is a housewife.  

The loan she is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy sand, bricks and cement to build her house. With the investment, she can build a safe and comfortable house where her son can grow up and she can have peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks and cement to build her house. With the investment, she will be able to build a safe and comfortable house where her son can grow up and she can have peace of mind.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es:
