Gerson, de 31 años de edad, esta casadao con Rubí con quien tiene 4 hijos y junto a ellos vive en el terreno de sus padres en donde habilitaron un espacio para construir una pequeña vivienda para su familia.Gerson, tiene como trabajo la carpintería, es un hombre prodigioso con sus manos, pues puede convertir cualquier pedazo de madera en una obra de arte y también construye casas muy hermosas y elegantes. Trabaja en esta actividad por más de 04 años y lo realiza siempre con mucho esmero y dedicación porque sabe que con eso sustenta a su familia. Adicionalmente vende hielo y gaseosas, en algunas ocasiones también comparte la venta de abarrotes con su esposa quien lleva a otros pueblos todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad.  
Le gusta lo que hace pues expresa sus sentimientos en cada obra o edificación que realiza; desea seguir trabajando para más adelante poner un taller en su hogar.Este es el crédito número 05 con Kiva, está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.En está oportunidad solicitará S/.1800 soles para la compra de madera ya que desea seguir properando en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Gerson is 31 years old. He is married to Rubí, with whom he has 4 children. They live together on his parents' land where he fixed up a space to build a little house for his family. Gerson's work is being a carpenter. He is a prodigious man with his hands and can convert any piece of wood into a work of art.  He is also builds beautiful and elegant houses. He has done this work for more than 4 years and he does with with much hard work and dedication, because he knows it is the support for his family. In addition, he sells ice and sodas and at times sells groceries with his wife, who takes all types of basic necessity products to other towns.
  
He likes what he does because he expresses his feelings in each piece or building that he makes. He wants to keep working so in the future he can set up a workshop in his house. This is loan number 5 with Kiva. He is very happy with the financial support that is being offered because this way he feels secure going ahead with his work. He is also committed to making his payments on time. At this time, he will ask for S/.1800 soles to buy wood because he wants to keep prospering in his business.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Moy's Group

texts.en:
Moy, age 64, lives in a village in the province of Battambang and district of Thmor Koul in Cambodia. She has three children. To earn a living, she has worked very hard as a rice farmer for 20 years. Her family’s daily income is about 40,000 KHR per day but she manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Moy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for seven loan cycles. She has completely paid back the previous loans. The other group member has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles. 

Moy is now leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR per person. As the leader, Moy wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Ararati Group

texts.fr: Bwira est secrétaire du groupe Ararati, entrepreneur courageuse, mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un enseignant. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons (fumés et salés). Elle commença son affaire, avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il y a 18 ans, que cette cliente exerce cette activité. Le nouveau prêt va lui servir de payer les 4 paniers des poissons. Parfois, cette cliente connait des pertes énormes suite à la pourriture et émiettement de ses produits. L’insécurité au long de la route est un handicap pour leur commerce.  La cliente souhaite acheter une parcelle,  scolariser ses enfants accroitre son capital. Ainsi, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en: Bwira is the secretary for the Aranti lending group, a courageous entrepreneur, and a mother of 8 children, all of whom attend school. Her husban is a teacher. She has been selling fish (smoked and salted) for the past 18 years, a business that she began with financing from her husband. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase four baskets of fish. She sometimes faces difficulties with her business due to the decay of her products. The lack of quality control along the chain, from when the fish it caught to when she has it in hand to sell is a real challenge for the business. She hopes to someday purchase a plot of land, to ensure her children remain in school, and to increase her profits. She is thus very grateful to Hekima for the support provided to her business.

loans.use: purchase four baskets of fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 27ans, Kodjovi vit à Lomé et est moniteur d’auto école. Afin d’acheter des tableaux de panneaux ,il fait son premier prêt à WAGES pour satisfaire ses besoins. Il veut ouvrir d’autres points et fonder une famille plus tard.
texts.en:
A young man of 27 years, Kodjovi lives in Lomé and is a driving school instructor.

To buy road sign panels, he applied for his first WAGES credit loan so as to meet his needs. He wants to open other locations and later on start a family.

loans.use: Buy road sign panels

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsgee is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Sharavjamts, works with her on their family business. Her sons, Amarbayar, age 24, and Amarsaihan, age 20, are university students. 

Mrs. Tsetsgee started her organic noodle-producing business in 2011. She purchases organic flour from agrarians and produces organic noodles to sell. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic flour to produce noodle products to sell to local customers.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of organic flour to produce noodle products to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old and a single parent of four children. She trades in fish. She has been doing this business for the past seven years and is doing very well. 

She always tells people good things about ID Ghana and how it has helped her overcome all her challenges in life. 

Victoria is an innovative and hardworking individual who is also committed in all she does. She has been a client of ID for the past four years. 

This is her fourth loan and she requests GHS 700 to buy more goods to sell to her customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 49 years old and lives in one of the villages in the Sevan region with his wife and two sons. All of them are jobless. The main way they earn a living is through animal husbandry. They keep five cows, four calves, and 15 sheep. Davit is engaged in this occupation with his family members. 

For many years, Davit has worked as a mechanic in his village. However, after the Soviet Union collapsed, Davit became jobless. So Davit created his own agricultural business and worked days and nights in order to sustain his wife and two little sons. Eventually, Davit was able to provide a sufficient income for his family. 

Davit produces and sells meats and various kinds of dairy products. He sells products not only in his own village but also in the city of Sevan. Davit requests 500,000 AMD to buy one cow and one horse in order to increase his food productivity. The anticipated income will help him to organize his son's wedding ceremony, about which he has been dreaming for a long time.

loans.use: To buy one cow and one horse in order to increase his food productivity.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina, es soltera, vivía con su pareja pero el se encuentra en el Brasil trabajando como costurero y tiene un hijo varón que esta en etapa escolar; vive en la casa de sus suegros, donde cuenta con dos ambientes donde se encuentra el dormitorio y la sala, la habitación es de adobe con revoque de estuco y el piso de vaciado de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Villa Bolívar en la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada de limpieza en un local de expendio de comida percibiendo un salario mensual, ella se encarga de los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios de su hogar.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material escolar para su hijo  pues ya comenzaron las clases y el muchacho necesita útiles escolares.
 El sueño de Catalina es poder tener su propia tienda de barrio en el domicilio donde vive y así tener ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito en KIVA y la cuarta vez en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Catalina was living with a partner, but he is now working as a tailor in Brazil. She has a son in school and they live in her in-law’s house, where they have two rooms: the bedroom and the living room. The bedroom has plastered brick walls and a cement floor. The house is located in the Villa Bolívar area, city of El Alto. Catalina works cleaning a food establishment and receives a monthly salary. She pays for the food and utilities at home.

Catalina is requesting a loan to buy school supplies for her son, now that the season has started again and he needs them. Her dream is to have her own grocery store at home and receive an income that can help her improve her quality of life.

This is Catalina’s second loan with Kiva and her fourth with IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her son.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en: Charita is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman who has seven children. Her husband works as a fisherman. Charita is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and fishing nets for fishing. With this money, she will be able to improve her business ventures and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and fishing nets for fishing.

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
This is Kwaku from Friends & Unity group.  He is 42 years old and married to Victoria and has 3 children.  He trades in flower shop & pot making.  He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and still doing very well. 

He always tells people good things about ID Ghana and how it has helped him overcome all his challenges in life.  He is an innovative and hardworking individual who is also committed to all that he does.  He has been with ID for the past 4 years. 

This is his 8th loan and he needs GHS 2,500 to buy more goods to satisfy his customers at Exhibition in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell to his customer

loans.name: Alusine's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust, who is a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Makiteh village, near Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone.  They have requested for a loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to meet their immediate financial challenges.  At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Alusine is the featured leader of this team and he is a 45 year old native of Maboreh village.  He is married to a trader and they have 4 children – 3 in primary school and 1 in secondary school.  Alusine has been a school teacher for 37 years now.  He has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for himself and to use the rest to buy house building materials.

loans.use: to pay college fees for himself and to use the rest to buy house building materials

loans.name: Jacqulyn

texts.en: Jacqulyn is 35 years old.  She is married to a farmer and they have four children.  She wants the loan to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, cassava and seeds for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as beans, cassava and seeds for sale.

loans.name: Zimah S. B.

texts.en:
Zimah S. B. is 42 years old and she and her fiancee live in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  Her fiancee is an Office worker and they have four children between the ages of 13 and 27 years old.  Only two of them attend school and four of them live at home. 

From 2009 she has been selling used clothes in her community market.  Sometimes she has less customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of money.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  In the future she plans to send her children to school until they finish college.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business,

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 56 year old married woman and the mother of five children from Ubay, Bohol.  She has run a tailoring business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Elvira is asking for a loan to buy additional materials for tailoring, like cloth, thread, needles and to pay for the repair of the sewing machine.  With this, she will be able to serve more customers in her tailoring shop.  In the future, Elvira hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for tailoring like cloth, thread, needles and to pay for the repair of the sewing machine

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
Eufracia is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of 8 children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income.
Eufracia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters.

loans.name: Lee Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members residing in Dansoman. They are Lydia and Monica. They have been together since 2011 and are still doing very well. They sell provisions and salt respectively.
Lydia, the leader, is a 29-year-old provision (milo, milk, sugar, rice, can food) seller. She has been doing this for the past 6 years. On the 7th April, 2011, she took his first loan of GHS 300. Through her dedication and seriousness to her business, she has been able to build up trust with ID Ghana.
For this 4th loan, she is requesting an amount of GHS 500 to help her boost the business and to satisfy her customers in and around the community.
The two members together need GHS 900 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more provisions for her inventory.

loans.name: Akoffa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbons de bois à domicile, Akoffa est une jeune dame de 29ans. Elle a pour conjoint un électricien et ont en charge 02 enfants. L’ainé de 06ans va à l’école quant au dernier de 02ans, il est toujours avec sa maman à la maison. Avec une ancienneté de 03ans dans l’activité, akoffa s’approvisionne à Lomé et à l’intérieur du pays et distribue à ses clients de parts et d’autres de la ville de Lomé. Manquant de fonds pour acheter plus de marchandises, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour renforcer son stock de marchandises. Son souhait est de faire une autre activité complémentaire et assurer une bonne éducation à sa famille.
texts.en:
A home-based retailer of charcoal, Akoffa is a young 29-year-old woman. Her spouse is an electrician and they care for two children. The eldest is six years old and attends school. As for the youngest two-year-old, he stays at home with his mother.

In the business for three years, Akoffa buys in Lomé and the interior, and distributes to customers from other areas of the city of Lomé. 

Lacking funds to buy more goods, She is seeking a first credit loan from WAGES to bolster her stock of merchandise. Her wish is to initiate another complementary activity and provide a good education for her family.

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Orlando M.'s Group

texts.en:
This group of teachers has come to SMT’s, a partner of Kiva, base in Makeni to apply for a loan of 14,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, the can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayment to SMT/Kiva lenders on the teachers’ behalf.

Orlando is the featured leader of this group. The 60-year-old is a native of Makeni. He is married and has 12 children. Six of his children are attending primary schools, 2 are in secondary, 2 in college and 2 not of school going age. Orlando has been a professional teacher for 42 years now. He has requested this loan in order to meet two of his most pressing financial challenges; pay school fees for his children and to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: pay school fees for this children and to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house.

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en: Geralyn is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of a 2 year old son. Geralyn is asking for a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these. she will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. In the future, Geralyn hopes to make her business successful and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her son and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Juana Juliet

texts.en:
Juana Juliet is a 58-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has been rice farming for more than 20 years now. Juana Juliet works hard to help her husband meet the needs of the family.

Juana Juliet is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, they will be able to improve their business and augment their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Rose Group

texts.en:
Rosemary and Gifty are the members of this group. They sell underwear and provisions respectively. They reside in the Dansoman community. They have been together from 2012 to date.

Rosemary is a 44-year-old underwear seller who is married to Samuel, a 47-year-old businessman. They are blessed with four children, all in school. She has been doing her business for five years now. She hawks from Mondays through to Saturdays. She has been with ID Ghana for the past year and is doing very well with her business, thanks to ID Ghana’s training on savings – without it she would not have made it this far. This is her third loan and she needs 700 cedis (GHS) to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

Both members need a total amount of 1,200 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Jamalat

texts.en:
Jamalat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Jihad appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Jamalat is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother to one son who is 12 years old. For the past two years, Jamalat's husband has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project, but also it needs more support to cover the costs.

Jamalat is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar and milk. This will increase sales and increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of basic groceries.

loans.name: Shawgy

texts.en:
Shawgy is a 26-year-old young man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store for five years and is the person who pays for the household expenses in the home he shares with his parents. He has experience and thanks Kiva a lot for financing his first loan. 

He would like to expand his business and increase its sales so he can prosper financially. He applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery items such as rice, sugar, flour, beans and soft drinks to offer in his business and thus increase his sales. He thanks Kiva again for financing his second loan.

loans.use: to buy basic products such as rice, sugar, flour, beans and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 47 years old. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, with his wife, his retired mother and a daughter. Gocha requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Gocha and his wife and daughter are all sellers at the big local market and they get small monthly salaries. Gocha requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Gocha will purchase men's shoes at wholesale prices to resell them afterward with a price markup. He already has rented a space at the same market, where he plans to start selling the shoes himself. He is experienced in this field and knows how to satisfy the clients’ demands, so Gocha hopes his business will be profitable. 

With the profit he plans to purchase women's shoes and develop his business. With the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, Gocha and his family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase men's shoes at wholesale prices to resell them afterward with a price markup.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is in his late 40s and married with three school-aged children - ten, eight and six years old. They are members of the Egyptian community and live in central Albania, in a main city where the majority of their community lives.

For the past ten years, Albert has been selling handmade crafts to the locals, and through this he has been able to generate an income enough to secure the basics for his family. However, their living conditions have been under poverty level standards, and Albert wants to improve them by purchasing some appliances for their home. He is planning on renovating their home, too; yet, this is a plan for the future. The loan that Albert is requesting is to purchase electrical appliances.

loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 32 years old. He lives in Kvarkheti village, Gori district, with his mother, two brothers and two sisters. Gocha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. They own a plot of land where garlic and apples are grown. The harvested products are sold locally at the markets. They make a very small monthly income which is not enough to feed six family members.

Gocha requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With this loan, Gocha will purchase calves. He plans to buy them at a good price, raise them and then sell them with a price markup. With part of the profit, Gocha plans to develop his agriculture and will use the rest for the family's well-being. The new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves at a good price, raise them and then sell with a price markup

loans.name: Allah Kan Djidi Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Allah Kan Djidi sont mariées majoritairement  dans des familles polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales, de fruits et légumes etc. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djènèba (femme assise  en 2ème position sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de riz dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de riz paddy avec les exploitants à la foire de Konodimini. Il est ensuite  étuvé, décortiqué et débarrassé de ses sons avant d’être revendu au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et dans la foire de Konodimini  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Djènèba espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants du foyer. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Djènèba a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The six women in the Allah Kan Djidi group are married, mainly in polygamous families. They average 35 years of age with three children. They all live in the village of N'gara in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and kinship.

They are petty traders of grain cereals, fruits, vegetables, etc. In order to expand their business, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their seventh group loan cycle.

Mrs. Djeneba (sitting in second position  from left to right on the photo) is a major rice seller in the village of N'gara and its surroundings. She plans to use her loan to buy four bags of paddy rice (whole-grain) from farmers at the Konodimini fair.

She then steams, hulls and strips the rice of its bran before retailing it for cash and credit through home delivery and at the Konodimini fair to both men and women customers.

Mrs. Djeneba hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be reinvested in the business and used for the upkeeping of the household children.

Just like the other women in the group, Mrs Djeneba aims to increase the volume of her business in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Buy paddy rice (whole-grain)

loans.name: Radim

texts.en:
Radim is a 31-year-old man, married with two children. He is a blacksmith and has five years of experience in this field. He takes orders from customers, and makes roofs, doors, gates and windows. His father taught him skills and now he is helping Radim.

His monthly income is 100 AZN, but he wants to increase it because it is not enough to cover the needs of his family. Hence, he applied for 800 AZN to purchase working materials to complete orders and increase his turnover. He promises to pay back on time.

loans.use: to buy aluminum material for orders.

loans.name: Myrna Lisseth

texts.es:
Myrna tiene 38 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Ella cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en administrar su propio comedor (elaboración y venta de alimentos); su madre fue quien le enseño ese negocio. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y verduras; para ampliar la elaboración y venta de alimentos. Su demanda es grande, debido a que esta cerca de una escuela y llegan ahí los alumnos y docentes a comprar comida donde ella. Al aumentar su venta, podrá brindar estabilidad económica a su grupo familiar para enviar a sus hijos a la escuela y poder enviarlos a la universidad para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Myrna is 38 years old, married, and has three children.  She has 10 years experience running her own small eating establishment where she prepares and sells food. It was her mother who taught her this business.

Myrna is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil and vegetables so that she can expand her business.  Demand is high as she is located near a school and both pupils and teachers come to buy food from her.  By increasing her sales, Myrna will be able to provide her family with financial stability.  She will be able to send her children to school and then later to university so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil and vegetables to expand her food business

loans.name: Saftar

texts.en:
Saftar is a 23-year-old single man. He has been breeding cattle for the last 5 years. After several attempts to find a job he gave up and decided to start this business. With the help of his brother, they purchased the first cattle.

Saftar usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 180 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, as people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Saftar also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling milk to neighbors.
  
He wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase two cattle and two milk cows. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and two milk cows.

loans.name: Esther B.

texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with six children between 18 and 28, one of whom attends high school, and five live at home. She has been selling rice, oil, vita water, etc. for the past 10 years. 

She started this business by running a shop for her mother, and later opened her own table in her community and learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, vita water, etc. for her business. In future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, vita water, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en:
Sonnie is 34 years old and lives in Montserrado County, the largest free port and the number-one commercial county in Liberia. A single mother of two children, aged 1 and 13 years old, in school and living at home, Sonnie has been operating a shop selling used clothes for the past nine years. She learned this business from her mother, and started it with help from her boyfriend. Her favorite part is the profit she makes everyday as her customer base continues to grow.

Sonnie is requesting this loan to purchase more used clothes to sell. She appreciates the support of BRAC, and she promises to pay back her loan on time. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine's group is composed of five hardworking women. Justine is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Justine has been working hard to manage her bar business, which sells local brew. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet and sorghum for making the brew, and it will help Justine to generate greater profits and own more local bars around the center. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more millet and sorghum for making local brew.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the No. 1 commercial county in Liberia. She is married with two children, ages 15 and 20 years old; only one lives at home. The older one is out of high school, while the younger one attends school. 

For the past 10 years, she has been selling used clothes. She started this business from her savings. A challenge she faces is the transportation cost. She enjoy her business because it enables her to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sadam

texts.en: Sadam is a 21-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a respectful and hardworking man but he gets a low salary. He is a soldier who protects the security and stability of his homeland. He intends to buy furniture to use for his house, but the amount he has saved is not enough to buy what he needs. He is requesting a youth loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy furniture to improve his living standards.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 52-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 30 years. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She operates a farm stand where she sells beans, bananas, etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a productive business area and her primary customers are residents from the surrounding area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be that sometimes there is a lack of sufficient water for irrigation. She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family. Her business goal is to run a profitable business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 48 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest duty-free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and has three children between 4 and 15 who attend school and live at home. She has been selling charcoal for the past two years.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her profits. She is applying for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is from Paraqar village and lives with her husband and parents. Her father and husband work at a local combine and their salary is hardly enough for covering the family's basic costs. 

The family owns a barn which is too old and needs to be renovated. Now Marine needs some financial support to renovate the barn and start breeding cattle, so she has applied for this loan.

The renovation of the barn is very important for Marine to start breeding cattle and gathering a monthly income. The loan is very important for Marine to sustain her family and cover its basic costs.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the barn.

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Joan is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in Uganda. For the past six years, Joan has been working hard to manage her bar business, which sells local brew. 

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more millet and sorghum for making the local brew, and will help Joan to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for the family. Joan hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a residential house. 

Joan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more millet and sorghum for making the local brew.

loans.name: Suhail

texts.en: Suhail is a 27-year-old married man. He has one son to support. Suhail has a small business where he sells frozen meat and chicken, and he offers the service of chopping and mincing the meat to the customers. Now Suhail is applying for a youth loan to enhance his business and buy a new machine for chopping and increase the quantity of meat he has.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for chopping.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 33 years old. He lives in Skra village in Gori district with his wife Diana and two children. Both of his children attend school. Mamuka requested a loan for a family business start-up several times from local financial institutions, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Mamuka's family owns a small agricultural plot of land. Mamuka is harvesting it and planting vegetables. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets and the family earns a small monthly income.

Mamuka requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved under a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products. They are often considered “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the credit Mamuka will purchase a mini-bus to start trading fruits and vegetables. He will buy at wholesale prices from Gori markets, bring the products to his village, and resell them with the prices marked up at the local market. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family, and Mamuka will be able to provide a better education for his children.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus to start trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Samiha

texts.en: Samiha is a 40-year-old married woman. She works as a cleaner and sells used clothes from home. Her husband is a driver. Together they are supporting their three sons. Now Samiha is applying for a loan to start selling new clothes besides the used ones to have variety and satisfy everyone.

loans.use: to start selling new clothes.

loans.name: Cynthia J.

texts.en:
Cynthia is 28 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is the largest free port and is the No. 1 commercial county in Liberia. She is married with a 1-year-old child. She is a high school graduate.

For the past five years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.es:
Alma es una mujer de 31 años de edad joven, luchadora, emprendedora, casada que de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos los cuales tiene 2 del sexo femenino y dos del sexo masculino la mayor cursa el 1 de bachillerato en ciencias y letras el 2 cursa el primer año de ciclo común básico y la 3 en la escuela en 2 grado y un menor de edad de 2 años. Ella tiene un grado de educación cursado hasta el 3 ciclo común básico el cual pudo completar la secundaria completa pero no pudo continuar por falta de apoyo económico. Ella junto a su esposo se dedica al cultivo y siembra de pimienta hace mas de 3 años el cual lo aprendió de sus suegros los cuales le enseñaron con gran satisfacción producto que es comercializado y vendido por ella misma en las diferentes aldeas y zonas aledañas mismo que es comprado también por comerciantes que vienen de las afueras de su pueblo. Sus cultivos están ubicados a medio kilómetro de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para poder comprar productos especiales para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de pimienta ya que es delicado y su desafió es mantener sanos esta siembra.

Su meta es poder dar asistencia y el mantenimiento necesario a sus cultivos para poder sacar una excedente cosecha para los meses de agosto y septiembre ya que su sueño es poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y hacer crecer el patrimonio para poder heredarlo a sus hijos y que ellos continúen trabajando y administrándolo.
texts.en:
Alma is a young woman of 31.  She is a tenacious, entrepreneurial, married woman who has four children: 2 girls and 2 boys.  Her eldest [daughter] is in her first year of 'bachillerato' (senior high) studying science and letters.  Her second child is in his first year of 'ciclo común básico' (high school), her third child [daughter] is in elementary school and her youngest [son] is 2 years old.  Alma herself studied up to the third year of 'ciclo común básico' (approximately age 16) but was unable to continue her schooling due to a lack of financial support.  She and her husband have been growing peppers for more than three years.  She learned this business from her in-laws who were happy to teach her.  Alma sells her produce herself in different villages and neighboring areas.  It is bought by salespeople from the areas surrounding her village.  Her crops are located half a kilometer from her home and she walks there every day.

Alma is currently requesting help so that she can buy special products that she needs to maintain her pepper crops.  The plants are delicate and her challenge is keeping them healthy.

Alma's goal is to provide her crops with the attention and care they require so that she will obtain a large harvest in the months of August and September.  Her dream is to be able to continue supporting her children in their studies and to grow their inheritance so that she has something to leave them and they can continue working and running the business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies needed for her pepper crops

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a 31-year-old businesswoman with one child. She has been running her cybercafé for two years, making an income of KES 23,000 per month. This is her second loan from KADET LTD, and she wants to use it to buy better computers. She hopes to expand her business and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy better computers.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 28 years old, married, and has a daughter. She is a psychologist-pedagogue. Anna graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical University and now works in the same University as a lecturer. At the same time, she gives private lessons to pupils in her own house on the Armenian language and literature. Private teaching brings Anna not only additional profit for her family but also great pleasure, as she likes children very much, and she works with great devotion.  Anna's husband works as an engineer in Fanadzor’s chemical factory.

loans.use: to buy a computer and reading materials for the private lessons she gives on the Armenian language and literature.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman is 38 years old and married. He is a farmer who has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last six years. During these years, Elman has gained the necessary skills and experience to run the business. He chose these crops because they are profitable, and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on the table of every Azerbaijan family, and they are also used to make fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN. As these products are in high demand, Elman wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet the demand. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.  This will be his second loan, and Elman has a good history as a client.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 58 years old and has a grocery business in Kangundo town. She is widowed and has three children. She has been in the business for two years and it has been profitable.

This is her first loan and she plans to buy more stock of vegetables such as spinach and cabbages, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. She also plans to buy bananas and mangoes. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children as well as provide for the needs of her family.

In future, Margaret hopes to grow her business by selling more variety of grocery items and making more income. In this way she hopes to be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To add more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune is 54 years old and lives in Vanadzor city with her family. She works in one of the hospitals of Vanadzor city as a nurse in the department of surgery. Besides working in the hospital, she does treatments and massages for children and adults, for which she has a license. She is very skilled in her work and achieves a good result. She also does massages for 1- and 2-year-old children in order for them to have a good figure and treatments for men who have flat feet. She has a good reputation in Vanadzor city and many clients.

Nune needs a loan to buy new gadgets in order to perform massage works more effectively and in more comfortable conditions.

loans.use: To buy new gadgets in order to perform massage work more effectively.

loans.name: Tharwat

texts.en: Tharwat is a 19-year-old married lady. While she is at home, she decided to make use of her time and build some connections between neighbors and their friends. She used her connections to promote her business of selling ladies clothing items from home. Now Tharwat is applying for a youth loan to increase the quantity of clothes she has and bring in new styles of clothes.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes.

loans.name: Khaqani

texts.en:
Khaqani is a 29-year-old businessman. He is married with two daughters. He has his own café, where he provides lunches and dinners containing the national food. He is responsible for  purchasing goods for his café and serving clients. His café has a very good location in the bazaar, where a lot of people who work in the bazaar come to have a quick lunch. His monthly income is 80 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat).

He has big plans of expanding his business in the future and opening another café in the center of the town; however, now he just needs to improve the conditions of his café and make renovations. For this purpose, he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. He already repaid one loan and proved himself a trusted client.

loans.use: to renovate and improve the conditions of cafe.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 25-year-old single guy; he has one brother and one sister. Mohammad works in a computer repair shop while he also goes to the university to study Finance. Mohammad is now applying for a loan to pay his upcoming semester fees, so he can register for courses.

loans.use: to pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Warren David

texts.es:
Don Warren David es originario del municipio de tipitapa Managua donde tiene ocho años de vivir junto a su esposa y  sus tres hijos menores, en edad escolar, es una  persona  trabajadora que se desempeña como grabador de dato en una de las universidades del estado desde hace ocho años para darle a su familia estabilidad.
 
Se presento a CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito para compra de materiales de construcción tales cemento, hierro, cinc, bloque, con el fin de hacer unas habitaciones y así ir dándole poco a poco una mejor condición de vidaa su familia.

Confía en dios que su caso tocara los corazones de estos inversionistas, para que le otorguen este financiamiento y  poder cumplir su sueño en acondicionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Warren David is from the town of Tipitapa, Managua.  He has lived there, together with his wife and three school-age children, for eight years.  Warren David is a hard-working person who has a job as a data input clerk in one of the state universities.  He has been working in this post for eight years in order to provide his family with stability.  

Warren David came to Ceprodel to request a loan with which to buy building supplies such as cement, iron, metal sheets and blocks.  He will use these supplies to build some rooms so that he can gradually provide his family with better living conditions.

Warren David trusts in God that his case will touch the hearts of Kiva lenders who will give him this loan so that he can fulfill his dream of remodeling his house.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Getrude's Group

texts.en:
Getrude's group is composed of three hardworking women. Getrude is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in Uganda. For the past three years, Getrude has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, sugar and biscuits. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more commodities such as sugar and rice to sell, and it will help Getrude to generate greater profits and start a poultry farm. Getrude hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Getrude is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more commodities such as sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 35-year-old mother of five sons and daughters. Her husband is a chef working in a restaurant. Ghada, on the other hand, uses her personal expertise in making pastries to sell at home so she can help in increasing their family income. 

Now Ghada is applying for a loan to get more ingredients and increase the quantity she makes in hopes that later she can open her own pastry shop.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to increase the quantity of goods she makes.

loans.name: Zabit

texts.en:
Zabit, a very kind and friendly 33-year-old, recently got married and has one son. For the past six years Zabit has been raising livestock which he sells for meat, something very popular among local people. Many popular dishes like dolma and pilov are made of meat, and people consider it very healthy and digestible.

Zabit usually buys calves to raise and fatten, selling them at a profit. His monthly income of 150 AZN is the only source of income for his family. Earning enough money for them is challenging, as is the hard work required in looking after the animals, which entails spending a lot of time outside in harsh weather conditions. Yet Zabit is a very positive man who is supported and helped by his wife.

He has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy three baby calves. The national spring holiday of Novruz is approaching, a good time to fatten and sell cattle at profitable prices for the many wedding parties that take place around the holiday.

loans.use: to buy three baby calves.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 24 years old. He is a single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a home appliance store for a few years. He started his business provided by his dad, then he expanded his business to purchase more goods to meet the demands of his clients. He is a hardworking man and is looking to improve his living situation. He would like to ask for financial assistance because his household expenses are continually increasing. He is facing a financial shortage. Therefore, he was encouraged to borrow additional capital. He took a youth loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from Al-Amal Bank, which he will use to buy home appliances to sell to his customers. In the future, he hopes to be a high merchant in order to earn an increased income, which will enable him to pay his obligations for some of his household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah, who appears in the photo, is a 26-year-old single young man. Abdullah lives with his family in a village famous for its olive trees in addition to its different and rich crops. Abdullah and his family have been working in agriculture, but the income the family earns is not enough to cover all their needs.

For the past three years, Abdullah has been operating a blacksmith shop; he has a good reputation among his loyal customers, and it has been a profitable project, but also it needs more support to cover the cost.

Abdullah is requesting a 3,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing iron for his workshop. This will support Abdullah's work and improve his income, which will ensure his bright future.

loans.use: To purchase iron for his workshop

loans.name: Nejay

texts.en:
Nejay is 27 years old, and lives in Montserrado County which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and has two children, 9 months old and 10 years old, They live at home and the older one attends school. 

Since the year 2012, she has been running a small shop where she sells  charcoal, oil, potatoes, biscuits, candy, groundnuts, rice, and soap. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business allows her to save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, oil, potatoes, biscuits, candy, groundnuts, rice, and soap for her business. Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, oil, potatoes, biscuits, candy, groundnuts, rice, and soap for her business

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit has been engaged in a dishware and ceramic trading business more than 20 years. This activity she runs in a leased store in Vanadzor city. She buys merchandise from Yerevan Wholesale Market twice a month and transfers it with a rented car. Although this business brings her good earnings, it is very hard because she does all the work alone without support from anyone.
 
Anahit is 56 years old and lives in Vanadzor city. She is married and has one daughter who is married and lives separately. Her husband of many years works in the Russian Federation.
 
Anahit is requesting from Kiva lenders a loan to increase the number of her goods by buying dishware and ceramics from Yerevan. With the anticipated profits she will help her daughter.

loans.use: To increase the number of her goods by buying dishware and ceramics.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 54-year-old married woman. 

Dalal sells blankets and clothes from home. 

Now Dalal wants to increase the quantity of clothes she has and bring in new styles. For that she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes she sells.

loans.name: Rehemah

texts.en:
Rehemah  is married with four children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling timber and has been in this for nine years.  She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more timber for resale. She generates additional income through farming. 

Rehemah works in a shop that she rents and she sells wholesale only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked timber shop and also educating her children up to university.  She resides in a rented house and the family has   access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees  for her children.

loans.use: To buy more timber for resale

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group is composed of three hardworking women. Sarah is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in Uganda. For the past two years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clothes business, which sells kids’ clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increase her capital by getting another loan. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to start selling adult clothes. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo, es soltero pero convive con su pareja ya hace nueve años y tiene un hijo, que tiene dos años de edad y no esta en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones las cuales son dormitorio y una sala con paredes de adobe revocado con estuco y el piso es de ladrillo, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente trabaja como Ayudante de cocina (garzón) en una pensión ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz de donde percibe un salario mensual y también tiene ingresos de propinas, su pareja no trabaja.
El crédito requiere para la compra de una mesa y varias sillas para el armado de un puesto de venta de comida en la misma zona, para que su pareja se dedique a la venta de comida, y hasta el momento es el único ingreso la del esposo que tienen, el colabora con el pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El sueño de Hugo es poder adquirir un ambiente donde tenga una pensión y así mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Hugo is single but has been living with his partner for nine years.  The couple have a 2-year-old child who is not yet old enough for school.  Hugo lives in two rooms in his parents' house: a bedroom and a living room.  The walls are made from adobe and covered with stucco.  The floor is brick.  The house is located in the Villa Exaltación district of the city of El Alto.

Hugo currently works as a waiter in a small restaurant in the city of La Paz.  He makes a monthly wage and also makes money from tips.  His partner does not work.

Hugo needs this loan to buy a table and some chairs to equip a food sales business in his area from which his partner can sell food.  Up to now they have been relying solely on his wage.  Hugo contributes toward covering the cost of his family's basic services.  His dream is to acquire premises where he can set up a small restaurant so that he can improve his income and his quality of life.

This is the fourth time that Hugo has requested a loan from Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a table and some chairs so that he can set up a food sales business for his partner to work in

loans.name: Ilaria Ivania

texts.es: La Señora Ilaria Ivania es originaria del la Cuidad de Somotillo, casada, se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta, trabajadora, responsable en su trabajo y su familia, formada por sus dos hijos y su esposo, se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales; hierro, cemento, zinc, bloque y gastos de mano de obra, esto para la contribución de un cuarto y expandir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ilaria Ivania is from the city of Somotillo.  She is married and noted for being an honest, hard-working woman who is responsible in her work.  Her family consists of her husband and two children.  

Ilaria Ivania came to Ceprodel to request a loan for buying building supplies: iron, cement, metal sheets and blocks.  She will pay workers to build a room so that she can extend her house.

loans.use: to buy materials such as iron, cement, metal sheets and blocks, and to pay builders

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Enriqueta es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive con su familia en una humilde casa en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella y su esposo trabajan como profesores en dos distintos establecimientos cada uno por 10 horas al día y sus hijos se encuentran en la universidad.

Enriqueta necesita el crédito para terminar de pagar los estudios universitarios de su hija mayor, para que pueda salir profesional e independizarse con un trabajo estable.

El sueño de Enriqueta es dejar una profesión a sus dos hijos para que puedan afrontar la vida.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in a humble home in the Sopocachi district of the city of La Paz.  Enriqueta and her husband work as teachers in two different educational establishments.  They each work 10 hours a day.  Their children are attending university.

Enriqueta needs a loan to finish paying for her eldest daughter's university studies so that she can become a professional and start living independently with a stable job.

Enriqueta's dream is to ensure her two children each have a profession so that they can get by in life.

loans.use: to finish paying for her eldest daughter's university studies

loans.name: Hovsep

texts.en:
Hovsep is a 29-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. He runs a shop where he sells clothing. Hovsep has been running this business for three years. Now he wants to add more inventory to his shop to increase sales. 

With the loan's help, Hovsep plans to purchase clothing for children. This is important for him to meet the demand of his clients and stay competitive in the market. Hovsep lives with his parents and his brother who is 16 years old. Development of the business will allow Hovsep to earn more income and provide more prosperous living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for clothing for children

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el municipio de Santo Domingo, vive Martha, una mujer de 27 años, madre soltera de 3 pequeños que estudian en una escuela fiscal, su motivación de cada día es mantener y darles sus estudios para que un día se conviertan en profesionales y obtengan el título que ella nunca pudo tener debido a que los reducidos recursos económicos de sus  padres solo alcanzaron para que ella termine la primaria. 
Martha reside exactamente en la Parroquia de Río Verde un lugar histórico de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. 
Aprovechando que Santo Domingo es el puerto que une a las Regiones Costa y Sierra del Ecuador, varias personas han establecido negocios de todo tipo para conseguir los ingresos que sirven mantener los gastos del hogar. Éste es el caso de Martha que en busca de cubrir las necesidades de su hogar decidió emprender con la venta ambulante de ropa casual desde hace 2 años, actividad que la aprendió en anteriores trabajos; invierte al menos 4 horas al día, pues también debe estar pendiente de alimentar y ayudar en las tareas a sus 3 hijos. Ella debe recorrer las largas calles de su ciudad tomando y entregando pedidos, cobrando y ofreciendo la ropa que mantiene en stock, es por esto que Martha ha decidido mejorar sus herramientas de trabajo comprando una moto lo cual hará con el primer crédito que obtenga de Fundación Alternativa. Con su moto Martha podrá trasladarse en menor tiempo hacia sus clientes y podrá atender mayor número de clientes, lo cual aumentará sus ingresos y así podrá atender las necesidades de sus hijos. Martha agradece a cada persona que en cualquier parte del mundo, a través de Kiva, decida apostar junto con ella por su crecimiento laboral.
texts.en:
Martha, 27, lives in the municipality of Santo Domingo. She is a single mother of three children that go to a state-run school. Her main motivation is to give them a good education so that they can become professionals and receive a degree, something she could not do herself because her parents lacked the resources to support her studies after primary school.

Martha lives in Parroquia de Río Verde, a historical site in Santo Domingo, which is the capital city of the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province, in Ecuador. This province has grown steadily during the last few years. Its capital city is well-known for its fruits and cuisine. It also has important commercial activities and has become an important hub for commercial exchange between the mountain and coastal areas of the country. It also has numerous touristic sites that together with its warm climate attract local and foreign tourists.

Taking advantage of Santo Domingo’s location between the mountains and the coast, people has started all kinds of businesses in order to make a living and support their families. This is Martha’s case, who, with the intention to cover her home’s expenses, decided to start selling clothes as a street vendor two years ago. She learned this activity from her previous jobs and works at least four hours per day, since she also has to cook for her three children and help them with their homework.

Martha has to walk her city’s long streets, taking and delivering orders, collecting the money and offering the clothes she has in stock. This is why she decided to improve her working tools and buy a motorcycle with the first loan she receives from Fundación Alternativa. With a motorcycle, Martha will be able to shorten her travelling time and reach more customers. This will result in an increase in her income and a better support for her children. Martha wants to thank each and every person that, wherever in the world they might be, decided to join her through Kiva in this quest for growth.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to deliver her merchandise to her customers.

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es: La Sra. Yudith  tiene 42 años y cuatro hijos de las edades de 14, 10, 9 y 6 años, todos se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica a la venta y fabricación de artesanías ella realiza joyas y bisutería para mujeres de manera manual, ella tiene su  puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Alto Olivo,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Yudith  va a usar este préstamo para la compra materiales para la fabricación de sus artesanías,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra. Yudith  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda de artesanía grande y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela,  La Sra. Yudith  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
Yudith is 42 years old and has four children who are 14, 10, 9 and 6 years old.  They are all school age.  Yudith's business is making and selling handicrafts.  She hand crafts women's jewelry and has a sales location in Alto Olivo district.

This loan is Yudith's first with the institution.  She will use it to buy materials for making her handicrafts.  Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can continue improving her business.  Yudith will use the profits she makes to continue buying materials and thereby improve her income.  Her business goal is to have a large craft store so that she can provide a better service to her customers.  Yudith is a very hard-working person who feels happy for the opportunity which is being given both to herself and her fellow group members as, in some cases, they are supporting their families single handedly.

loans.use: to buy materials for making her handicrafts

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica al cuidado de su familia y elabora tamales, refrescos, entre otros antojitos para venderlos en su casa y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Los insumos para elaborar los antojitos los compra tres veces por semana en una tienda, ubicada en su comunidad.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más materia prima para prepara los antojitos y para construir una habitación a su casa. Con la inversión, dispondrá de mayor variedad de materia prima para elaborar diferentes platillos y Satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y obtener un mejor ingreso; al mismo tiempo que estaría mejorando su vivienda para estar más seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She takes care of her family and also makes tamales, soft drinks and other snacks which she sells from her home.  In this way, she helps her husband with their household expenses.  María buys the supplies she needs for making her snacks from a store in her community three times a week.

María is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo so that she can buy more supplies for preparing her snacks.  She will also build an extra room in her home.  As a result of this investment, she will have a larger range of raw materials available for making different dishes so that she can meet her customer demand and make better income.  She will also be able to improve her home so that her family can life in greater safety and comfort.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for preparing snacks, and to build an extra room in her home

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 33-year-old shopkeeper. He is married to Tabitha and they have two children. He has been running his retail shop for the past six years with a monthly income of KES. 10,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan with KADET  LTD after repaying his previous loan successfully. 

Denis will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, tissue paper, sweets, green grams (lentils), etc., for his retail shop. He intends to plough back the income earned from his business and start investing for his children’s future. 


His hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale shop and be able to provide his children with quality education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, tissue paper, sweets, green grams (lentils)

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 27-year-old married man, father of two children. He has been working selling fruit and vegetables for 10 years. Bilal is a Palestinian refugee, who puts much effort into providing his family with the best living.

Bilal is a hard worker. He is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy metal tents to expand his working zone, this will help him a lot in increasing business capital which will lead to an increase in income.

In 2005 he opened his own business to make sure that his family would have the necessary things they need for living. This is his eighth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good standing and good paying-back history.

He hopes to buy his own planting land in the future and sell his own produce.

loans.use: To buy metal tents to expand his working zone

loans.name: Sarah J. S.

texts.en:
Sarah J. S. is 42 years old and lives in Montserrado County. The county has the largest port in Liberia (The Freeport of Monrovia) and is the number one commercial county. Sarah J. S. is married, with five children between 7 to 24 years old. All of them are in school and live at home. 

Sarah J. S. has been selling used clothes for the past four years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her friend. Her favorite part about her business is the buying. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es:
Doña Gloria Marina es originaria de Managua, una señora de cincuenta y cinco años de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo que todavía está en la universidad, se desempeña como cocinera en una de las universidades del estado durante veinte años.

En este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para comprar bloque, cemento y pago de mano de obra para la elaboración de un anexo, ya que uno de sus sueños es llegar a tener una casa con todas las condiciones adecuadas. 

Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva financien su crédito a través de Ceprodel, ya que solo por medio de estos se pueden cumplir los sueños en la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Marina is a 55-year-old woman from Managua. She is a single mother with a child who is still in college. She has worked as a cook at one of the state universities for 20 years.

At this time, she needs a loan to buy block, cement, and labor to build an addition, since one of her dreams is to have a house with all the suitable living conditions. 

She trusts in God that Kiva investors will finance her loan through CEPRODEL, since this is the only way she will be able to achieve her dreams for her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sergio Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Sergio Enrique vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una empresa se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable en su trabajo y con la familia su núcleo familiar esta compuesto por 6 persona todos depende de los ingreso obtenidos por él.

Don Sergio está solicitando un crédito a kiva y ceprodel para invertirlo en la compra de zinc y perlines para la reparación del techo de su casa que está en mal estado.
 
Agradece a ceprodel ya que por medio de estos préstamos ha podido ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio Enrique lives in the city of Managua and works as a company security guard.  He is noted for being a person who is responsible in terms of his work and family commitments.  His nuclear family has six members and they are all dependent on his income.

Sergio is requesting a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to invest in buying metal sheets and beams so that he can fix the roof of his house which is in a bad state of repair.

Sergio is grateful to Ceprodel because, through these loans, he has been able to continually improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets

loans.name: Parmusenke

texts.en:
Parmusenke has since cleared his previous loan, owing to a good harvest for the previous season and good prices for the produce. He has applied for a third loan of KES. 30,000 which he plans to use to buy farm inputs for this planting season.

He plans to use the increased proceeds to venture into animal rearing, and continue educating his children. His hope and dream is to own a ranch.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is a pedagogue. For more than 10 years she has taught biology in one of the schools in Vanadzor city. She graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical University. She also gives private lessons in biology in her own home. Besides biology she also prepares applicants for University exams. Her role for future students of Vanadzor city is great. Karine with her pedagogical experience and knowledge has achieved good repute in Vanadzor.  

She is married and lives in Vanadzor city with her husband and two sons. Karine's elder son is serving in the military, and the younger is a pupil. Her husband is employed as a worker.  Now Karine is asking for a loan from Kiva to buy a personal computer in order to conduct her lessons in up-dated fashion and to teach her pupils more effectively.

loans.use: To buy a personal computer.

loans.name: Margarita De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Doña Margarita pertenece al municipio de  Catarina, municipio que fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua, es casada, con  27 años de edad,  trabajadora del estado con ingresos bajos como docente, la docencia la ejerce en una comarca conocida como pacayita a la cual doña Margarita viaja todos los días. Su núcleo familiar lo conforman su esposo y su niña  que es  menor de edad. 

Actualmente están aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento, a través de  un financiamiento para   instalar un  sistema sanitario económico que consiste en la instalación de un inodoro convencional con la construcción de sistema Bio-San 1 que consiste en la utilización de  un tanque Biodigestor de 600 lts, el cual le da un mayor tratamiento a las aguas residuales, acompañado de un pozo de absorción, donde cae el agua ya saneada, el cual contribuye grandemente con el medio ambiente.

Esto lo requiere  ya que por donde ella habita no es posible el acceso a aguas negras, por lo que para su uso la familia cuenta con una  letrina, siendo su familia una de la miles que no tienen acceso al  saneamiento mejorado, con este proyecto que esta beneficiando a varios municipios del país, le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida  y  también contribuir con el medio ambiente.
 
Sin la oportunidad de este crédito es imposible que Margarita tenga acceso a un inodoro ya que es muy costoso. Con su bajo salario es imposible que logre instalar, estos programas vienen ayudar a familias en condiciones mas pobres, las letrinas causan enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es por ello que nace la idea de crear estas soluciones dirigidas al sector más pobres.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in the Catarina municipality.  This municipality was selected to participate in a pilot program to improve local training with respect to sanitation issues in Nicaragua.

She is 27 years old, and she is a state worker earning low income as a teacher.  She teaches in an area known as Pacayita, which is where Margarita travels every day.  Her family is comprised of her husband and her minor daughter.

She is currently applying to participate in a water and sanitation project, which includes obtaining a loan for the installation of an affordable sanitation system.
