This includes the installation of a conventional toilet with the construction of the Bio-San 1 system.  This consists of the utilization of a 600 Its Biodigestor tank.  This will provide better treatment of the waste water, and it will have an absorption well where the sanitized water will go.  This will contribute greatly to the environment.

This setup is required because the place where she lives does not have access to sewer lines. For this reason, her family has been using a latrine. Her family is one of thousands who do not have access to improved sanitation. This project will benefit several municipalities across Nicaragua.  It will allow them to have a better quality of life and to also contribute to the environment. 

Without the opportunity of this loan, it would be impossible for Margarita to have access to a toilet because they are very expensive.  With her low salary it is impossible to manage to install one.  These programs come to help families living in the poorest conditions.  The latrines cause illnesses and contaminate the environment.  That is why the idea was born to create solutions intended for the poorest area.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and a toilet.

loans.name: Aracely De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Aracely  vive en la cuidad de Managua casada tiene dos pequeños hijos trabaja en el área de limpieza de una universidad se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honesta, responsable.

Está solicitando un crédito a ceprodel para hacer la construcción de una pila séptica  ya que vive en una zona rural donde no hay tuberías de aguas negras es por esta razón que decidió hacer dicha inversión. 

Doña Aracely agradece a ceprodel y kiva porque con los otros créditos que se le han otorgado ha mejorado su vivienda para  darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aracely lives in the city of Managua.  She is married and has two young children.  She works as a cleaner at a university and is noted for being a hard-working, honest, responsible lady.  

Aracely is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to build a septic tank as she lives in a rural area where there are no sewage pipes.  This is why she decided to make this investment.

Aracely is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva because, through her previous loans, she has improved her home and managed to provide her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Feda

texts.en:
Feda is a 43-year-old conservative lady, so she asked her daughter Haneen to appear in the photo instead. 

Feda is a farmer looking after her 7 sons and daughters. One of them is Haneen, a 19 year old who has recently graduated from high school and wants to enroll into the university to get a bachelor degree. For that, Feda is applying for an educational loan to pay registration fees for her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for registration fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Jackqueline B.

texts.en: Jackqueline B. is 25 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with a 9-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. She has been selling rice, oil, peanuts, butter and onions for the past three years. She started this business with money given to her by her fiancee and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her profits. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts and butter for her business. In future she wants to build a house for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts and butter for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Mwanaisha has operated a goat meat-selling business for the past three years. At the market, she sells to butcher operators. She also does farming as another source of income.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase more goats, so she can sell them for their meat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats, so she can sell them for their meat.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old, single, Palestinian refugee, who has been working in the printing business since he was 11 years old. Ahmad is a hard worker. 

In 2012, to improve his living, he opened his own printing company. He specializes in printing and preparing companies' and shops' plastic and vinyl signs. Ahmad is a well-known in his region and trusted by his clients because of his long experience in his domain.

He is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to buy necessary vinyl, flex, and ink for his business, exported directly from China.

This is Ahmad's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. He has a good standing and pay back history. He hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can, to make sure that he will open a wider printing and publishing factory in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary vinyl, flex, and ink for his printing business.

loans.name: Adila

texts.en:
Adila is a 59 year old woman who is receiving a pension. She is married and has six adult children. 

Her pension is not enough to cover her basic needs so she decided to start her own business. She is market vendor who sells different kind of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candy. She has 27 years of experience and deep knowledge of her market and client's demands. 

The food products that Adila sells are very popular and in high demand. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of the store's good location, as it is in the central bazaar of her home city. Her husband helps her purchase the products and bring them into the shop. The store provides the family's sole financial income. Her monthly profit from her business is 100 AZN. 

She is applying for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase more food products and a diverse range of goods to cover customer demand.  This will be her second loan. She has a good borrower history.

loans.use: to buy more food products and a diverse range of goods

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en: Walaa is 20 years old and a single lady; she is the oldest sister for five siblings. Walaa helps her family by selling clothes from home. She is now applying for a youth loan to increase the quantity she has of clothes, buying different styles.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes she sells

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  She has a business selling soft drinks like passion fruit juice, sodas, mineral water and pineapple juice.  She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings to buy more boxes of mineral water, crates of sodas, bags of passion fruit, sugar and pineapples.

Annet has been in this business for four years and works , seven days out of every week, in a shop that she rents.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She generates additional income through selling snacks. She is aspiring of using blenders to assist in squeezing juice.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses   include rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of passion fruit, sugar, crates of sodas,  and boxes of mineral water

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 52 years old. He lives in Vani District with his 50-year-old wife Nato, his retired mother and three grown up children. Avtandil requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have a milk cow and a pig. Also they own a plot of land where nut trees and greens are grown. With the milk they make cheese and sell it together with the harvested products locally at the markets. 

Avtandil requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Avtandil will purchase a mini-bus. He will work on private orders and transport cargoes throughout his district. With the profit he plans to renovate his house so his family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus to work on private orders and transport cargoes.

loans.name: Orwah

texts.en: Orwah is a 23-year-old single guy with three siblings. He is a university student majoring in electrical engineering in one of the governmental universities in Jordan. He is applying for this educational loan to pay his next semester fees, because he wants to get his bachelor degree as soon as possible and start working in the field.

loans.use: To pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is 74 years old and from Kisumu county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He supports six people in his family. He is married to Eunice and they were blessed with two children who are now adults.

Danson has been one of the longest serving clients in his group. He has a clinic center and has been doing this business for the last six years since he retired from his job. He makes a monthly income of about KES 10,000. He is taking his sixth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase equipment and drugs for his medical clinic. 

He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his grandchildren. He has a dream of leaving a good legacy to his family.

loans.use: Danson wants to purchase equipment and drugs for his medical clinic.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to James and is the mother of four children. She sells groceries in Limuru town and also sells charcoal. She has been in this business for seven years now and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will be Caroline's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to add to her stock of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, and charcoal. 

In future, she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, de 34 años de edad , esta casada con Tito y tiene 03 hijos de 14, 12 y 08 años de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia . Gloria se dedica a la venta de abarrotes , razón por la cual tiene una tienda en su hogar ,por este motivo se levanta muy temprano y abre las puertas de su establecimiento a la espera de sus clientes quienes buscan productos de primera necesidad y ella se encarga de proveerlos siempre con productos de calidad. Lleva en este negocio 04 años y lo hace con ayuda de su pareja. 
Le está yendo muy bien en su negocio, además gracias al apoyo de su pareja tiene el tiempo suficiente para descansar y brindar la atención necesaria a sus hijos, a su vez espera que su negocio continúe en progreso. Este es el cuarto préstamo con Kiva, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos .Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará mas mercadería para su negocio tales como arroz , leche , azucar , entre otros ya que desea tener todo tipo de artículos para mantener contentos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is 34 years old. She is married to Tito and has 3 children, ages 14, 12, and 8. The children live with Gloria and Tito in the house they own. Gloria sells groceries out of a store in her home. For this reason, she gets up very early and opens the doors of her business to wait for clients seeking basic commodities. Gloria takes charge of always providing them with quality products. She has had the business for 4 years and runs it with the help of her husband.

Gloria’s business is going very well, and thanks to the help of her spouse, she has sufficient time to rest and give her children the attention they need. She hopes that her business will continue to progress. This is her fourth loan with Kiva, for which she thanks the people who make her loan possible and give her the opportunity to continue working to achieve her goals. With the requested amount of 2000 soles, Gloria will buy more merchandise for her business, such as rice, milk, and sugar, among others since she want to have all types of groceries to keep her clients content.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: La Sra. Modesta tiene 47 años, casada tiene dos  hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para la mujeres de polleras, tiene su puesto de venta  en la zona de  Alto de la Alianza, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Modesta va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción ya que quiere refaccionar un ambiente en su domicilio para guardar su mercadería, ya que tiene  chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto,  la Sra. Modesta enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor chompas y mantas para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Modesta is 47 years old, married, and has two school-age children. Her business is selling sweaters and shawls made from alpaca wool to 'mujeres de polleras' (ladies who dress in traditional Bolivian style). Her sales location is in Alto de la Alianza district. This loan is Modesta's first from the institution. She will use it to buy building materials as she would like to remodel an area in her home in which to keep her merchandise. She has lots of sweaters and shawls right now as she makes a lot of sales at this time of year. She also has orders which she will deliver to different markets in the city of El Alto. Modesta's business challenges include stocking her business with enough merchandise. She will use the profits she makes in her business to continue making wholesale purchases of sweaters and shawls.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 44-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 22 years old. She describes herself to be a go-getter and a hard-working woman . She operates a grocery store where she sells fruit. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Veronica describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business and  getting water for household use. She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family. Her business goal is to improve her business  within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Firengiz

texts.en:
Firengiz is 55 years old and married with two daughters. She is a market vendor and has sold women's clothes and home products for the last 20 years. She started her business because her husband was unemployment for many years. Now she is a successful entrepreneur with a monthly income of 120 AZN. The products she sells are very popular and Firengiz has very good taste. Her husband helps her a lot to purchase and transport clothes from another city.

She would like to renew her stock and purchase a new collection of women's clothes for the spring season. For this purpose she applied for 1500 AZN. This will be her second loan and she has proved herself a trusted client.

loans.use: to buy a new spring collection of women's clothes

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in Uganda. For the past two years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her salon, which offers hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics for hair and hair extensions for the salon, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for the family. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a clothing business. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for hair and hair extensions for the salon

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a single mother of four children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and old parents). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been this business for 7 years, selling to all categories of people but on a retail basis. She moves door to door selling used clothes six days out of every week. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of getting a permanent business location and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna runs a bakery. She started this business three years ago. She and her husband, Artush, organize the production process with hired workers. Artush also delivers the bread to local shops. In the bakery they produce bread, including the Armenian national bread, lavash (flatbread) and different types of candies. 

She wants to purchase raw materials and a stove for the bakery. The development of the business is important for Anna to get additional income, which she plans to invest in the bakery's expansion. She would like to start production of pasta, too. This loan is important for Anna to implement these goals and provide a stable income for her family. Anna lives with her husband and son who is 22 years old.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and a stove for the bakery, and also to renovate the bakery.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 54-year-old shopkeeper. He is married to Lucy and they have five children. He has been running his retail shop for the past six years with a monthly income of about KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying his previous loan successfully.

Peter will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, tissue papers, sweets, green grams, etc. for his retail shop. He intends to plow back the income earned from his business and start investing for his children’s future. 

His hopes and dreams are to own his own wholesale shop and be able to provide his children with quality education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, tissue papers, sweets, green grams, etc.

loans.name: Hael

texts.en: Hael is a 25-year-old married man who has two children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who strives hard to provide for his family. His work was moved to another city, and he has been living through difficult situations with his family. He rented a house to continue working and intends to buy home appliances for the house. He has applied for a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB. He hopes to offer a good life to his children and enroll them in private school.

loans.use: to buy home appliances

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, es casado y tiene tres hijos, viven en casa propia junto con su esposa, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto.
El terminó los estudios secundarios, actualmente se dedica a la fabricación de puertas y ventanas de fierro en su mismo domicilio; Roberto  es Maestro Cerrajero.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material (fierro, armellas, chapas) y así fabricar más puertas y mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Roberto es tener una fábrica de puertas de metal.
Es la quinta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Roberto is married and has three children. He lives in his own house together with his wife and children. The house is located in the Villa Cooperativa zone of El Alto. 

Roberto finished his secondary studies and currently works out of his home making iron doors and windows. Roberto is a master locksmith. He needs the loan to buy materials (iron, eye bolts, sheet metal) so he can make more doors and improve his income. Roberto’s dream is to have a metal door factory. 

This is Roberto’s fifth time applying for a loan with IMPRO and his first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy iron, eye bolts, and sheet metal to continue making metal doors and windows.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
La señora Alba Luz vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como  responsable de cocina  en una universidad de la capital es una persona responsable, amable, honesta muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo ya que tiene de trabajar para dicha institución 31 años.

Doña Alba solicita a kiva por medio de ceprodel un crédito para la compra de perlines y zinc para hacer el cambio de techo de su casa de habitación que está en mal estado y necesita hacer dichas mejoras antes que  comienza el invierno.
texts.en:
Alba Luz lives in the city of Managua and works as a supervisor in the kitchens of a university in the capital city.  She is a responsible, kind, honest person who is very well liked by her work colleagues.  She has been working for the same institution for 31 years.

Alba is requesting a loan from Kiva, through Ceprodel, to buy metal sheets and roofing beams so that she can replace the roof on her house.  It is in a bad state of repair and she needs to make these necessary improvements before winter sets in.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and roofing beams

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 25 years old, single, and has no children. He supports his mother. He runs a grocery store in Limuru and has been in this business for 1.5 years. His monthly income is KES 5,000 (five thousand shillings).

This will be Solomon's first loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). He plans to use the entire loan to add to his stocks of tomatoes, oranges, cabbages, etc. 

In the future, Solomon wants to improve his standard of living and also become a better businessman.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, oranges, cabbages, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a 45-year-old woman from Migori County in the western part of Kenya; she is married and the mother of four children who are 17, 15, 13 and 9.

Rhoda has been selling second hand clothes in Migori town, a business she has been doing for the last 12 years; she makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000.  She is taking her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase bales of second hand clothes to sell. 

She will use the anticipated profits to purchase new clothes in addition to second hand clothing. 

She has a dream of expanding her business and living a life according to her desires and dreams.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 25 years old and lives in Montserrado County; it has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with two children, ages 10 and 11; they both attend school and live at home. 

Mamie has been selling palm oil and rice for the past three years. She says her main challenge is transportation costs. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money and that makes her proud; it enables to take care of herself and her children. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil and rice for her business.  She plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman, a 46-year-old married father of two school-children, works as a postman at the local post office and earns 150 AZN in salary there. A hardworking and purposeful man, Elman, in order to earn extra income, started a greenhouse farming business 12 years ago, growing early and late vegetables, especially tomatoes.

Elman is preparing his greenhouses for the season so he earn maximum profit from the sale of early tomatoes. He is requesting this loan to buy wood, peat, fertilizer and seed. He wants to grow his business further.

loans.use: To buy wood, peat, fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka lives in Tiribe, Kenya and raises goats to sell meat.  She is married and has four children, all of whom attend school.  She is a very hardworking and responsible person with more than 5 years of experience in this area.  Thanks to her job, her family is getting ahead and has everything they need.

She is requesting the loan to buy more goats so she can continue to grow.  She's grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy goats for selling meat.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 23-year-old married woman with 2 children, ranging in age from 1 month to 3 years old.  She describes herself as a risk taker and a hardworking woman.  She operates a retail shop where she sells household items.  Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are the local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business and water for household use. 

She will use the 8,700 KES loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family members.  Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years.  This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La licenciada Ines es Originaria del Municipio de Cinco Pinos-Chinandega, madre soltera, honrada, responsable con buenas costumbres, social, dedicada a su trabajo y a su hijo. 

A pesar de los inconvenientes que ha tenido ha podido salir adelante brindándole buena educación a su hijo,  por el que trabaja a plenitud para que el pueda ser una persona de bien y que tenga mejores condiciones de vida.

 Se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizara para mejoras en su vivienda, compra de materiales, cemento, cerámica, azulejos y gastos de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Ines is from the town of Cinco Pinos, Chinandega.  She is an honest, responsible, respectable single mother who is committed to her work and her child.

In spite of the difficulties she has faced, Ines has been able to get ahead in life and provide her child with a good education.  She works hard so that he can become an upstanding citizen and enjoy better living conditions.

Ines came to Ceprodel to request a loan to make some improvements to her home.  She will buy building materials (cement and tiles) and pay workers.

loans.use: to buy building materials (tiles and cement), and pay workers

loans.name: Milton Epidauro

texts.es:
El Señor Milton es originario del Municipio de Villanueva, casado, responsable, honesto, trabajador, social, dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia,  es taxista del Municipio de villanueva donde se ha llevado bien con  sus clientes.

Actualmente decidió cambiarle la pintura a su taxi y comprar dos llantas, para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros, por lo que se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para suplir estos gastos.
texts.en:
Milton is from the town of Villanueva.  He is a married, responsible, honest, hard-working, sociable man who is committed to his work and family.  He works as a taxi driver in the town of Villanueva and gets on well with his customers.

Milton has decided to repaint his taxi and buy two tires so that he can provide his passengers with a better service.  He came to Ceprodel to request a loan so that he could cover the cost of these improvements.

loans.use: to paint his taxi and buy two tires

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah is a 46-year-old single woman in Migori county, in the western part of Kenya.  She is the mother of four children who are 18, 16, 14 and 8. 

Lonah sells charcoal, a business she has been doing for seven years.  She makes a monthly income of KES. 13,500. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.  She will use the anticipated profit to invest in her business to achieve business growth.

Lonah has a dream of opening a big store, starting another business, and also continuing to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush runs a farm where she cultivates land and keeps livestock.  The farm currently includes 2 cows and a pig.  Anush also cultivates wheat, barley, and tomato.  She lives with her father, sister, and brother who are also involved in agriculture.  

Anush has applied for this loan to purchase a bull, fertilizer, and forage for feeding the livestock.  Anush and her family live in an old house which needs to be repaired.  The stable growth of her agriculture business is important for the family in order to increase savings, to renovate the house, and to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy a bull, fertilizer, and livestock feed.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 34-year-old man from Kakamega, which is located in the western part of Kenya.  He is married to Emily, a business lady, and is blessed with 4 children between the ages of 1 and 8 years old.

Samson has been selling general goods within Kakamega town for the past 13 years.  He makes a monthly income of 40,000 KES.  This, his second loan with KADET, will be used to purchase tea leaves, sugar, rice and bar soap for sale.  He will use the anticipated profit to add more stock to the business.  He has a dream to grow the business and to purchase a plot of land for his family to stay.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves, sugar, rice and bar soap for sale.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 52 years old. She lives in Samtredia District with her son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren who are going to kindergarten. Several times, Lia requested loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is Lia’s small monthly salary. She works as a baker at the local bakery. 

Lia requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Lia wants to purchase house goods at wholesale prices from the big market in the capital city, bring them to her village, and sell them to her villagers with the price marked up. Lia already has experience in this trading business, so she hopes it will be profitable. Part of the profit will be used for reinvesting in the same business and part will be used to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase house goods at the wholesale price and sell them with the price marked up.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel, es soltero y no tiene hijos , viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona San Felipe de Seke de la ciudad de El Alto.
El ya termino el nivel secundario y ahora trabaja como empleado de seguridad física en una de las empresas lecheras  en la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo requiere para continuar con la obra fina (estucado, pintado) de la vivienda de sus padres donde él tiene su dormitorio y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Angel es tener su casa propia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Angel is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in a house located in San Felipe de Seke, city of El Alto.

Angel finished high school and now works as a security guard for one of the dairy companies of El Alto. He is requesting a loan to plaster and paint his parents’ house, where he lives, which will improve his quality of life.

Angel’s dream is to have his own house. This is the first time he requests a loan to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy plaster and paints to continue with the finishes of his parents' house.

loans.name: Leydi Carolina

texts.es:
Leydi tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera. Ella es una joven emprendedora, lleva cinco años en el negocio de elaboración y venta de pupusas; actividad que aprendió de su abuela. Las pupusas las elabora y vende los días miércoles y sábado y el resto de la semana vende tortillas. Esta joven es muy visionaria y le gusta trabajar para poder sufragar los gastos familiares.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una plancha para elaborar las pupusas y las tortillas; debido a que la que posee no es de ella y lo que desea es comprar su propio equipo de cocina para diversificar su negocio agregándole venta de gaseosas, refrescos y golosinas. Su deseo es instalar una tienda bien surtida y su negocio actual hacerlo mas estable; para prepararse cuando tenga su propia familia.
texts.en:
Leydi is 19 years old and single.  She is a young entrepreneur who has been in business making and selling pupusas for five years.  She learned this work from her grandmother.  Leydi makes and sells her pupusas on Wednesdays and Saturdays.  The rest of the week she sells tortillas.  This young lady is very ambitious and she enjoys working to cover her family's expenses.

Leydi is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy a grill for making her pupusas and tortillas as the one she currently uses does not belong to her and she would like to buy her own equipment.  She would like to diversify her business and start selling soda, soft drinks and candies as well.  Her business goals are to establish a well-stocked store and to make her current business more stable.  In this way, she will prepare herself for when she has a family of her own.

loans.use: to buy a grill for making pupusas and tortillas

loans.name: Kotankègnè Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement  dans des familles polygames, les sept  femmes du groupe Kotankègnè ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales, de fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 11ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sanata (femme assise  en 1ème position sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de fruits et légumes dans le village de N’gara. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 24 paniers de papayes  avec les exploitants du village et environnants du village. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et dans la foire de Konodimini  en ambulant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Sanata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer la scolarisation  des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and living mostly in polygamous families, the seven women of the Kotankègnè group are, on average, 42 years old and have four children.  They all live in the village of N’gara in the Ségou region (in the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other as neighbors and through family and marriage ties.  They are in the business of selling cereals and fruits.  In hopes of increasing their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 11th joint loan.
Mrs. Sanata (the woman seated to the far left), is a successful fruit and vegetable vendor in the village of N’gara.  She plans to use her loan to buy 24 baskets of papayas from sellers in the village and in surrounding areas.  She makes her sales for cash and on credit from her home and at the market in Konodimini, as well as traveling around, to a clientele made up of men and women.  
Mrs. Sanata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to cover her children’s educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy papaya fruits.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 42-year-old Ugandan citizen. He is married with four children and lives in Kisharara, Rukungiri District. He is a very hardworking person who juggles tending to his farm with working as a school teacher to earn his salary.
He is acquiring an agricultural loan to help him boost and improve his agricultural production. He will buy manure to grow bananas and buy feed for his pigs. He started all these projects way back in a quest to improve and increase his family's income.
Previously, Sam had a problem because of his low family income. He earned little or no pay from his duty as a teacher. Meanwhile, the family was growing and the cost of living was increasing. He then sought financial assistance from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) – Rukungiri Branch. This has helped him to tremendously improve his development as an individual and as a role model to his pupils and the community as a whole.

loans.use: To buy organic manure and pig feed.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 20-year-old single woman.  Two years ago, she started making souvenirs and decorating chocolate to sell.  This helped her to make a living and helped her parents to increase their income.  Zahraa is a hard worker.  She is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary tools and accessories to expand her business.

This is her first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower.  She hopes that through the future loans, she will be able to open her own chocolate factory and souvenir-making shop.

loans.use: to buy tools and accessories for souvenir-making and chocolate decorating.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is one of the customers of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) – Rukungiri Branch. He is 32 and married with three children, all of whom attend primary school. They live in Bugangari – Rukungiri.

Together with the wife, they have been able to look after their children with the few resources available.  Godfrey’s salary from his day job as a medical officer under Rukungiri District is not enough.  So he started his private practice with the aim of increasing and improving his family income and livelihood.

Godfrey's loan will be used to buy building materials for his incomplete residential house, so he can get decent accommodations for his wife and children.

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish his house.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 49-year-old lady who did not attend school. She lives in Montserrado County with her three children who are between the ages of 24 and 35. Montserrado County has the large area of Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She used her location in Montserrado County as an opportunity to start a business. A friend helped her to open a small market table, which is how she earns a living. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, beans, etc. to expand her business. Her children are out of high school. In the near future she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a woman of 46, married to Alexander and the mother of five children. They live in Kabocha, in the outskirts of Kangemi. 

Tabitha plants and sells vegetables, and also does dairy farming in the same area.  She has been in this business for ten years and gets a monthly income of 46,000 shillings.

This will be Tabitha's first loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire amount to buy one dairy cow, and also to pay her planting costs. In the future, she wants to own over 20 cows and continue with dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a cow and help with planting costs.

loans.name: Dolores Isabel

texts.es:
La joven Dolores Isabel es una persona con espíritu de superación trabajadora, es madre de dos hijos que tiene a su cargo, labora desde la edad  de los veinte años, actualmente  se desempeña como cajera en una institución del estado desde hace siete años. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.

Dolores Isabel necesita  préstamo para poder terminar su carrera universitaria, lo cual lo invertirá en pago de matrícula, aranceles para ponerse al día con los pagos, este crédito lo ocupara con lo antes mencionado y la otra parte para invertirlo en tubería de agua negra. 

“agradezco a dios  como primera instancias por la oportunidad que le de ceprodel y kiva, para poder terminar mi carrera ya que es mi sueño para tener mejor ingreso y mejorar el nivel de vida de mi familia”.
texts.en:
Dolores Isabel is a hard-working young lady who has a great desire to improve herself.  She is the mother of two children and has been working since she was 20 years old.  She has been working as a cashier in a state institution for seven years.  She lives in her parents' home.

Dolores Isabel needs this loan so that she can complete her university degree.  She will invest her money in paying her tuition fees so that she is up to date with her payments.  Some of the money will be used for the aforementioned purpose and the rest will be invested in buying sewage pipes.

"I thank God for the opportunity I am receiving from Ceprodel and Kiva as it will enable me to complete my degree.  It is my dream to improve my income and my family's standard of living".

loans.use: to cover her university expenses

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en: Chrispine is 48 years old, married and the father of six children. For the last 21 years, he has earned a living as a tailor. His wife helps with the family expenses by working as a hairdresser. Chrispine earns about 41,000 Kenyan shillings a month. This will be Chrispine's fifth loan with KADET LTD. He will use the entire loan to buy the materials he needs to make new clothing. In the future, his goal is to be a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is involved in agriculture. Together with her family, she runs a farm where they cultivate watermelons and tomatoes. The family's main source of income is from selling their harvest in the local markets. She has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer and to renovate the greenhouse. She also plans to purchase seeds for land cultivation. Ruzanna lives with her husband and two sons. She wants to continue the expansion of her farm, which will mean increased income and better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds, and to renovate the greenhouse

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 43 years old and lives in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which is Liberia's largest commercial center. She is married and the mother of four children who range in age from 12 to 26 year old. They live at home and attend school. She has earned a living by selling fish for the last two years. She started this business with money supplied by her husband, and learned how to do it from her friends. She works for nine hours a day, and is committed to her job because it allows her to care for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she wants to own a house.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 42 years old, married, and a father of four children between the ages of 13 and 3. His main source of income is from slaughtering livestock and selling the meat to the residents of Kapsabet town.

He is now servicing his second loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase livestock for slaughtering so he can sell the meat. The profits he earns will be used to buy more livestock. His dream is to prosper in his current business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for slaughter

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en: Nyamvula has had a food stall business. She is asking for this loan to buy noodles, flour, cooking oil, cookies, cassava, drinks, and candy, among other things, to stock her store, so she can offer a greater variety to her customers and be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, cooking oil, cookies, cassava, drinks, and candy, among other things, to stock her store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 39 years old, married to Winnie and a father of two. He does dairy farming and also sells timber in Limuru. He has been in this business for seven years now, and he gets a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will be Peter's fourth loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy a power saw. In the future he wants to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To purchase a power saw

loans.name: Weedor

texts.en: Weedor is 26 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is the largest commercial center in Liberia. She is single and the mother of a four-year-old child who attends school. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling rice, pepper, palm oil and other items in a local market. She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend and learned this trade from her mother. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell. In the future, she wants to build a house to live in with her child.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, palm oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Sylivia's Group

texts.en:
Sylivia's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Sylivia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the region of Uganda. For the past year, Sylivia has been working hard to manage her bar business, which sells local brew. 

To help expand her business, Sylivia has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more millet and sorghum for making the local brew and will help Sylivia to generate greater profits and pay for school fees for herself. Sylivia hopes that in the future, she will be able to start up a fish-selling business. 

Sylivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more millet and sorghum for making the local brew

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is still engaged in his lovely profession. He continues provide photography and video services in weddings, birthdays, and other ceremonies. Due to his professionalism and devotion, he always has many orders. Gevorg is seeking loan for a second time from Kiva lenders. He has used the previous loans to buy a new professional video camera. This enabled him to make high-quality videos.
 
Now he needs money again to buy a new professional photography camera and some electronics tools for his activity, as time passes quickly and technologies are rapidly changing and he must provide services suited to new nowadays demands.

This loan will help Gevorg not only to increase the number of his clients, but to specialize more in his profession. His big dream is to create his own studio where he can hire other professionals and do photo- and video- shooting services and also create his own photo school. But for this dream he needs more effort and lots of work, time, and finances to develop his activity sphere.

loans.use: To buy a new professional photography camera and some electronic tools for his activity

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos en su fábrica de cortinas le está yendo bien y esto es gracias a la inversión de su anterior credikiva, con el cual compró un mayor volumen de telas cordones y pellón. Que le permitieron producir más y aumentar sus utilidades. Ahora está trabajando sin afanes para conseguir el capital de trabajo  y esto se refleja en el estado de ánimo de su cónyuge e hijos. El envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva : “ Dios los colme de bendiciones a ustedes y a sus familias por apoyar tan noble labor. En la actualidad se encuentra aplicando aun crédkiva para una vez más invertir en materias primas e insumos y continuar aumentando su producción de cortinas.
texts.en:
Carlos is doing very well in his curtain factory thanks to his previous Kiva loan that he used to buy larger amounts of fabric, tie-backs and sheepskin that made it possible for him to produce more and increase his profits.  Now, he’s working without the worry of having to find working capital and this is reflected in his, his wife’s and his children’s frame of mind.

He sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “May God bless you and your family for supporting such noble works.”  

He’s currently applying for a Kiva loan to once again invest in raw materials and supplies to continue increasing production of curtains.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 54 years old and lives in the Ozurgeti District with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. His son is a security guard at private company and gets a monthly salary. Shalva has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is farming. They have a milking cow, whose milk they use to make dairy products. They also have a plot of land where they grow crops. They sell their products locally, but they earn barely enough to feed the family. According to Credo's estimations, they are in the subsistence poor category. 

Shalva has requested loan from Credo and Kiva to start-up a family business. He is applying through a program that targets the rural poor, who do not have access to credit, because their low income makes them “high risk borrowers.” Shalva will use the loan to buy a minibus which he will use to transport people from his village to the town of Ozurgeti. This will increase the income his family earns and significantly improve its living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a minibus and transport people.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is 44 years old, married and the father of four children. He earns a living by dairy farming in the town of Limuru, and has been doing this for the last three years. He earns 22,000 shillings a month. Samwel is requesting his fourth loan from KADET LTD, and plans to use it to buy another dairy cow. In the future, his goal is to be a very successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children; all her children go to school. She has three additional family members (old parents and sister). 

Peninah is a tailor. She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years.  She gets additional income from selling charcoal. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy rolls of materials for making clothes, and bags of charcoal. 

Peninah’s major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a bridal designer and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, rent, and food.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materails and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Juana  tiene 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos. Toda su familia se ha desempeñado en el área del comercio y ella también lo ha hecho, pues administra su propia tienda. Los productos los compra cada ocho días, y compra más el que tiene mas demanda. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mas mercadería para su tienda, como arroz, aceite, frijoles, jabón, etc. para diversificar sus productos disponibles a los clientes. Su propósito, es mejorar cada día su negocio para que sus hijos aprendan y puedan ser ellos los que se encarguen del negocio después.
texts.en: Juana, 42, has three children.  Her entire family has worked in commerce and she does so too.  She manages her own store.  She stocks up on goods weekly and buys what's in highest demand.  The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy more merchandise for her store like rice, oil, beans, soap, etc. to diversify the products available for her customers.  Her goal is to improve the business every day so that her children can learn and someday manage it themselves.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 38 years old. She sells different items in her boutique. She is married to a house builder. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more rice, sugar, maize flour, and cassava flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a man of twenty-nine years, married to Catherine and a father of two children. He is a dairy farmer and also operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been in these businesses for three years and gets a monthly income of 24,000 shillings.

This will be Nicholas' second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy two cows. 

In the future, he wants to be a successful farmer and also open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has three children and has been doing her work for eight years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business. 

Selly has requested a loan of KES 62,400 from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to help her buy and insure a dairy cow.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Keeping dairy cows for milk production!' Her biggest challenge is: 'Low income due to less production.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of: 'Nyeusi and Browny.'

Selly was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Knew about Juhudi after Juhudi's marketing campaign.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to acquire agricultural asset like dairy cow from an MFI to boost production.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Selly replied: 'Acquire a high-yielding animal to boost production.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Selly owns the following: 'cow, poultry,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower does not have in the household: 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Salustiana

texts.es: La Sra. Salustiana tiene 41 años, casada con un hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella  se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años ella confecciona mochilas y bolsones,  su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona de la Bautista,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Salustiana va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de sus mochilas por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión ya que ella entrega el producto terminado a distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y de la Paz,  La Sra. Salustiana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes , La Sra. Salustiana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Salustiana, 41, is married and has school-age children.  She has been working making clothes for several years and also makes backpacks and tote bags.  Her workshop is located at home which is in the La Bautista zone.  

This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Salustiana will use it to buy fabric to manufacture backpacks at wholesale.  The reason for requesting this loan is to increase investment capital because she delivers the finished products to various street fairs in the cities of El Alto and La Paz.

The business challenge Salustiana faces is increasing income; she will use profits to buy sewing supplies to make good quality clothes in order to get more customer orders.  Salustiana is a very hardworking woman who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Chebet

texts.en:
Hellen is now 40 years old and happily living with her family of four children. Apart from her cereals business, she practices horticulture on her farm. She has been in operation for a period of three years and her income is KES 80,000.

She is now servicing her third loan of KES 73,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to pay school fees for her children, who are in various secondary schools. The profits she earns from her farm produce will be used to purchase varieties of cereals for resale.

Her dream is to prosper in her businesses and educate her children for a bright future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and also buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is a farmer from the Shirak region. He is a 46-year-old father of four children. Manvel lives with his wife, son and three daughters. He keeps livestock, which currently includes 2 cows, 2 bulls, 15 chickens and 15 colonies of bees. Manvel also owns agricultural land where he cultivates wheat and potatoes.

As the family is big, it is very difficult for Manvel to cover basic costs. Agriculture helps him to gather income which is hardly enough for covering the family's daily costs. As Manvel has no sufficient financial means to expand his farm, he has applied for this loan. 

With the loan's help, Manvel will purchase forage for feeding the livestock and potato seeds for cultivation. This will enable him to gather more income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and potato seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 35 years old. She is married with two children, and only one child goes to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been running the business for one year. 

The loan that Francoise is requesting will be used to buy more beans and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more beans and bananas for sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 43-year-old man from Usenge, Kisumu. He is married to Roselyne and has 14 children aged between 24 and three years old.
George is a fisherman from Lake Victoria. He has been doing this for the last 17 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase fishing nets. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.
He dreams of making sure his children complete their education and have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Magaret's Group

texts.en:
Magaret's Group is comprised of three hard-working women. Magaret is 18 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in Uganda. For the past two years, Magaret has been working hard to manage her bar business, which sells local brew. 

To help expand her business, Magaret is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 300,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to purchase more millet and sorghum for making the local brew.  This loan will help Magaret generate greater profits and have an independent life. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy goats of her own. 

Magaret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Yaseen

texts.en: Yaseen is a 36-year-old man from Taiz, Yemen. He is married and has two children. He is someone who dreams for his children to have a comfortable life. He has been operating a small grocery store. He spends all his time working in his business. It is his main source of income. As he described, he still suffers a little bit because of the challenges he faced due to bad situations in Yemen. He would like to expand his business so he applied for a second loan of 400,000 YER from AMB to be able to buy more grocery items etc. This will allow him to improve the way in which he displays the products in his store. He thanks Kiva for financing his first loan and he hopes to be financed for this second loan so he can increase his sales and open a call center in his area.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is a 67-year-old from Azatan village. He is involved in land cultivation and cultivates potatoes and wheat. 

Samvel works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local markets. The main income of the family comes from agriculture, so it is very important for Samvel to expand his agricultural activity.

He has applied for this loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer and to cover fuel costs. The loan is very important for Samvel to be able to cultivate more potatoes and gather more harvest, which will significantly increase his income. It is very important to cover fuel costs, which will enable Samvel to take the gathered harvest to the market.

Samvel lives with his wife, and it is very important for him to earn more income and ensure a better life for her.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer and to cover fuel costs.

loans.name: Alan Eulecterio

texts.es: Alan es originario de Somotillo, es trabajador, responsable, Honesto, dedicado a su  trabajo y su familia, se  presenta a las oficinas de Ceprodel,  solicitando un  préstamo para modificar y mejorar  su vivienda, comprando material de cerámica, cemento y completar  el pago de mano de obra, siendo uno de sus objetivos principales  el  desarrollo   de su familia creándole condiciones sociales, como es una vivienda digna como un derecho fundamental en la comunidad.
texts.en: Alan is from Somotillo; he’s hardworking, responsible, honest and devoted to his work and his family.  He came by the Ceprodel office to request a loan to do some home improvements.  He will buy tile, cement and pay labor costs.  One of his main goals is his family’s development creating social conditions for them like a proper home as a fundamental community right.

loans.use: to buy tile, cement and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Leonardo es originario del municipio de Somotillo , es una persona muy responsable, honesto, trabajador, dedicado a su familia, padre de dos hijos, con anhelos de  superación para su desarrollo de su familia y comunidades  del municipio.

solicita un crédito en las  Oficinas  de Ceprodel, para inscribir a sus hijos en la universidad, utilizar el efectivo en compra de útiles escolares, pagos de matricula, aranceles del primer semestre, su mayor deseo es obtener  la preparación de sus hijos y sean su futuro.
texts.en:
Leonardo’s from Somotilo.  He’s a responsible, honest, hardworking man who is devoted to his family.  He’s the father of two children; he hopes for their improvement so his family and the communities in his municipality can develop.

He’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to enroll his children in university.  He will use the cash to pay for school supplies and to pay first semester tuition and fees.  His greatest wish is to prepare his children for their future.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and to pay semester  tuition and fees.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.ru:
Василь торгует спортивной мужской одеждой. Имеет собственную торговую точку, торгует сам. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 7 лет. 
На сумму в размере 16 000 гривен, полученную от КИВА, Василь хотел бы закупить весеннюю спортивную одежду. Со временем Василь планирует свадьбу со своей девушкой – пока просто копит средства для этого.
texts.en: Vasil sells sportswear for men. He has his own sales outlet and does the selling himself. He has been doing this for 7 years now. Vasil would like to use a loan from Kiva in the amount of 16,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to buy spring sportswear. In the future, he plans to marry his girlfriend, but at present, he is just saving up for their wedding.

loans.use: to purchase spring sportswear

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children; one of the children goes to school. She has one additional family member (grandmother) that she supports. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 3 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, rice, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables and crates of soda. Her major business challenges are transportation and fluctuating prices. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, crates of soda, rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 36 years old. She is married with five children, between the ages of 4 and 12. All of them go to school. 

Violette has been selling different types of beers and bananas for a period of seven years. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more beers and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 40 years old. She sells various items such as sugar, salt and soaps. She is married with four children. She has sold these different items for more than 15 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar, soaps and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soaps and rice to sell.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en: Violette is 51 years old. She owns a boutique that she has been running for 10 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar, rice, and salt. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. She has worked hard after receiving the past loan where she managed to add more items to sell, which in turn increased business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and salt.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Emelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell peanut business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Emelinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sacks of peanuts for her buy-and-sell peanut business.

Emelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 33 years old and lives Montserrado County, which has the largest port (Freeport) and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Janet is single with two children, 12 and 19 years old. They are in school and live at home. 

For the past seven years, Janet has been operating a table where she sells fish. She started this business with the help of her friends, and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that every day she makes a profit. 

Janet is requesting this loan to purchase more fish for her business. She appreciates the support of BRAC, and she promises to pay back her loan on time. 

In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Sofo Maame

texts.en: Sofo Maame is married and has 4 children. She received schooling through junior high school. Sofo Maame sells diapers and toiletry products in Nkontrodo near Elmina, which she has done for 2 years. Her husband is a minister in their community. Sofo Maame uses her income to help support her husband in paying their family's general expenses. Sofo Maame will use the loan to purchase additional inventory for her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sofo Maame plans to grow her toiletries shop further and further meet the needs of her community members.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Felicima

texts.en:
Felicima is 54 years old and married, with six children.

Felicima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase stocks like canned goods, soft-drinks, and snack foods to sell in her general store.

Felicima has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Felicima aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks like canned goods, soft-drinks, and snack foods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame sells diapers and toiletry products in Nkontrodo near Elmina. She has received education through senior high school. She is single and has one child. 

Maame has been selling diapers and toiletry products for two years. She is responsible for supporting herself and her child and saving for their future. Her loan will be used to buy more diapers to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her trade further.

loans.use: to buy more diapers to sell in the market.

loans.name: Ama Atta

texts.en: Ama Atta owns and operates a chop bar in Nkontrodo near Elmina. Ama Atta has received no formal education. She is divorced and has 3 children. Ama Atta has been running her chop bar for 2 years now. She is responsible for supporting herself and her children and paying all the families expenses alone. Her loan will be used to buy more supplies and ingredients necessary to run her chop bar restaurant. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her chop bar operations and meet the needs of more customers.

loans.use: to buy more supplies and ingredients necessary to run her chop bar restaurant.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is a widow and has one child. She has received schooling through junior high school. 

Kate sells corn dough and local drinks in Nkontrodo, near Elmina. She has been selling these goods for about three years now. Kate uses her income to support herself and her child and to save for their future. 

Kate will use the loan to purchase more corn, to prepare her corn dough recipe, and other ingredients needed to make her local juice drinks. With the new profits from her expanded business, Kate plans to increase her working capital and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more corn, to prepare her corn dough recipe, and other ingredients needed to make her local juice drinks.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells doughnuts as well as various fruits including watermelon and oranges in Nkontrodo near Elmina. Ama has received no formal education. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a driver. Ama has been selling doughnuts, watermelon, and oranges for 2 years. She is responsible for helping support her husband in paying their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients necessary to prepare her doughnut recipe as well as an increased quantity of the fruits she sells in the market. She hopes to use the new profits to grow her food selling business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients necessary to prepare her doughnut recipe as well as an increased quantity of the fruits she sells in the market.

loans.name: Nana Yaa

texts.en: Nana Yaa is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Nana Yaa sells provisions in Nkontrodo near Elmina, which she has done for 8 years. Her husband is a driver. Nana Yaa uses her income to help pay her children's school fees and support her husband in paying other family expenses. Nana Yaa will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell in her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana Yaa plans to further expand her provisions shops.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells fish and cassava in Nkontrodo, near Elmina. Efua has received no formal education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a mason. 

Efua has been selling fish and cassava for five years now . She is responsible for helping her husband pay their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of fish and cassava to sell in the market. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to grow her food-selling business.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of fish and cassava to sell in the market.

loans.name: Gaviotas De Chuisuc Group

texts.en:
One year ago, a new Trust Bank, “Gavitas de Chuisuc”, was formed in Chuisuc, a rural community in the State of Quetzaltenango, Guatemala. This town is located in the Western Highlands, about 45 minutes from Guatemala’s second largest city, Quetzaltenango. Most of the population is involved in some form of commercial venture.

The Trust Bank has 18 members and is in their third loan cycle. Their average age is 38 years with three of the members being single and the rest being married. The married women have an average of four children each. The income that these ladies earn enables them to provide a better standard of living, health and education for their children.

Ana, 35 years of age, is the treasurer of the trust bank. She is married and has three children who range in age from five to fourteen and each of them attends school. Ana is in her 2nd loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and her business consists of weaving textiles, either colorful “huipiles”, the rectangular shirts that the indigenous women wear, or “cortes”, which are their skirts. Ana needs to secure a loan to buy two looms so that she can increase production. She has sixteen employees (8 women and 8 men) who are excellent workers, especially at this time of the year. In Guatemala, Easter is a big and very popular holiday and as such, families like to purchase new clothes. Ana is well aware of this increased demand and has increased production. The increased earnings will be well used. In addition, Ana owns a stall at the lively market in Totonicapan, a large community that is near her village, where people sell textiles.

The 18 women of the trust bank, “Gavitas de Chuisuc”, are amazed, pleased and grateful, that they have received financial support in the form of loans from people that they don’t know.
These ladies have a desire to overcome obstacles and move forward. With their loans, they can transform their own lives, as well as elevate the standard of living for their families and communities.

loans.use: to buy two looms for her weaving business.

loans.name: Menana

texts.en:
Menana is single and has two children.  She sells pomade lotion for hair, powders to freshen the skin, and pots, which she has been doing for one year..   Menana sells her products in Nkontrodo near Elmina.   

Menana is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more pots to sell.  She is responsible for supporting herself and her children and saving for their future. She hopes to use the profits to develop her business further.

loans.use: to purchase pots to sell..

loans.name: Bella Flor Group

texts.en:
Women throughout the world like to feel beautiful, just because they are women. The ten women of the trust bank “Bella Flor” or beautiful flower feel just this way. Their village is called Santiago Zamora in Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. This group was formed 5 years ago, but over time some people left the group and new members have joined.

Rosa is a very enthusiastic and active 43-year-old married woman with five children. She is pleased and proud that each of them attends school. Her first child is in the 10th grade and she happily anticipates his graduation from high school. Rosa, herself, was a teacher for three years and then her contract expired. She searched for another teaching position, but unable to secure one, she decided to enter the textile business. Currently, she is in her 4th loan cycle and employs five workers. She plans to invest her loan in the purchase of raw materials as she has increased demand with new customers.
As the president of the “Bella Flor” trust bank, Rosa encourages her fellow members to confidently move forward. She places a great deal of emphasis on the responsibility that each member has with Friendship Bridge. Rosa is most appreciative of her own loan and the impact it has made in her life. Her feelings are shared by her fellow trust bank members.
