This will enable him to offer a greater amount of charcoal and increase his sales. He hopes to attract more customers to his business and provide them with better service. By earning more income, his family will enjoy a better quality of life. He will also be able to continue to save for the better future of his five children.

loans.use: to buy hardwoods to produce charcoal

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Milagro de Dios está conformado por 10 integrantes, 9 mujeres y 1 hombre, madres  y padre con 25 hijos bajo su responsabilidad, ellos son originarios de  Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Lamentablemente estas personas no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, se vieron obligados a trabajar desde  temprana edad,  por lo tanto desean brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos, y luchan día a día.

La coordinadora del banco comunal es Priscila,  es una mujer con ganas de superación personal, y tiene por actividad económica la venta de repostería como pasteles, maletas, pan de especies, cachos, actividad que desempeña de forma ambulante, con una pana en su cabeza con unos 20 kg cargando diariamente  bajo el intenso sol.  Ella dedica a su actividad unas 10 horas diarias; actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto porque ha sido la forma de vida de sus hijos.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de repostería para la venta, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Milagro de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Milagro de Dios Communal Bank is made up of ten members, nine women and one man, parents with 25 children in their care.  They're from Sauce, located in the northern part of the country.  Unfortunately these people weren't able to study because they lacked the financial resources and needed to work from a young age.  They want to give their children a better future, though, and they strive every day.

The coordinator of the communal bank is Priscila, a woman with a great desire for personal improvement.  Her job is selling baked goods such as pastry, cake, spice bread, and cannoli, which she does on foot every day under the intense sun with a 20-kilogram basket on her head.  She devotes about ten hours a day to her job, which she carries out with great pleasure because it has been her children's lifestyle.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with pastries for sale so she can have a better income in the near future.

Milagro de Dios Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy pastry

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente, vive en Guayaquil. Ella tiene 56 años de edad, nos cuenta que su hermano empezó con el restaurante,  pero por el motivo del deterioro de su salud ya no pudo seguir al mando del negocio. fue entonces que ella comenzo con el negocio de venta de comida, encargándose de  lo administrativo, y su hermano de la supervisión del negocio les ha ido bien, y han logrado conseguir mucha clientela y ser reconocidos por el sabor esquisito de su comida. 
 
Ella trabaja en un restaurante junto con su hermano. La clienta nos cuenta que su hermano tiene Pvvs (paciente viviendo con vhi sida),  Y que cuando el decae no pueden atender en el restaurante, y no pueden cocinar y pierden clientela y dinero. La clienta no está casada, no tiene hijos. 
  	  
Con el préstamo ella va a comprar materia prima para así poder incrementar los platos granos, verduras, frutas, etc. Sus sueños son: primero seguir con su vida, estar junto a su familia, incrementar el negocio y tener más clientela y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil. She is 56 years old and says that her brother started a restaurant, but he was not able to continue the business when his health started to deteriorate. The borrower got into the food business when she took over the restaurant. With her brother’s supervision, the business has done well. They have been able to acquire many customers and now have become well-known for the exquisite flavor of their food.

The borrower manages the restaurant with her brother. She says that her brother is an HIV patient. When his health is in decline, she says that they are not able to manage the restaurant. No one is available to cook, so therefore they lose customers and money. The borrower is not married and has no children.

With this loan, she will buy supplies such as basic grains, vegetables, fruits, and other items so that she can increase the number of dishes offered. Her dreams include continuing with her life, being with her family, expanding the business, acquiring more customers, and having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, fruits, and other supplies.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy raw materials needed in coin bank production and other supplies for her business.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy raw materials like bongbong (a type of wood), plastic covering, glue and other materials needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit.

Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Linda hopes for the continuous success of her business. She meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and materials like bongbong (a type of wood), plastic covering, glue and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Blanca Arminda

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos (dos mujeres y dos hombres). Tiene aproximadamente 15 años de trabajar en un comedor ubicado a 15 kilómetros de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera, lamina, teja y adobe para construir su casa. Así, ella mejorara las condiciones en que vive toda la familia ya que la casa esta bastante deteriorada.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 42, is a single mother with four children (two daughters and two sons). For approximately 15 years, she has worked at a diner that is located 15 kilometers from her house.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy wood, laminate, tiles, and adobe for building her house. As a result, she will be able to improve the living conditions for her entire family since her house has greatly deterioriated.

loans.use: to buy wood, laminate, tiles, and adobe for building her house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old and is a simple fisherman from the village of Sta. Ana. He has been fishing for six years and has been able to support his family's daily needs. 

Juan is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy a new fish net and improve his income. He hopes that, through his hard work, his loan will help him catch more fish.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net

loans.name: Oern

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Oern is 56-years-old and widowed. She has three children. To support the family, she has been in the farming business for 33 years. The current business earns her family about 18,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.
 
Oern has just joined VisionFund in this cycle. She is now applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. Oern is going to use this loan to assist her son’s wedding. She hopes this loan will enable her son to have a happy family.

loans.use: to assist her son’s wedding

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es: Dalia, de 28 años,  es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos pequeños, con quienes vive en su casa propia el cual es fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación.Dalia se dedica a la venta de comida. Al llegar la noche instala sus mesas y su cocina en la vereda de su casa para poner a la venta todos los platillos que ha preparado durante el día, hasta su puesto llegan muchas personas con ganas de comprar sus delicios platos de comida, al mismo tiempo aprovecha para vender sus bebidas refrescantes . Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 07 años,y aqui aprendió que siempre se debe estas de buen ánimo y mostrar una agradable sonrisa a sus clientes para que se sientan gustosos de haber acudido y puedan regresar más adelante.Espera continuar en su trabajo y más adelante establecer su propio restaurante para continuar brindándo a sus clientes una excelente atención.Este es el crédito número 03 con Kiva y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado de S/. 1000 soles comprará  ingredientes tales como arroz, papas, verduras en general los cuales necesita para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Dalia, 28, is a single mother of two small children with whom she lives in her own house, the fruit of her effort and dedication.

Dalia makes a living selling food.  At night she sets up her tables and her stove on the sidewalk of her house to sell all the dishes she has made during the day.  A lot of people come to her stall wanting to buy her delicious food.  She also makes the most of it to sell her refreshing beverages.

She has been doing this job for more than seven years, and here she learned that one always should be in good spirits and wear a friendly smile for the customers so they feel pleased at having come and they'll return later.  She hopes to continue in her job and set up her own restaurant in the future to continue giving her customers excellent service.

This is her third loan with Kiva and she's very happy about the financial support she's getting because this way she'll always feel sure of getting ahead with her job.  She pledges to continue making her payments punctually.

With the 1000 soles [PEN] requested she'll buy ingredients she needs to make her dishes, including rice, potatoes, and a variety of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, vegetables, and other ingredients

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
This is Alejandra, 43, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto and a mother to their children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Alejandra maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear and and supplements through Marikina Shoe Exchange and Ever Green. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Alejandra also sells different processed and frozen foods for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, and Ever Green supplements. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Alejandra hopes to have a stall for her business so customers can easily see her products. She dreams that all her children will have a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, and Ever Green supplements needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, since it will result in better profit. Her business profits will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams of continuous success in her business, and hopes to get out of poverty. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members each week to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ludim Sarai

texts.es:
Ludim es una mujer joven de 21 años de edad casada, con muchas fuerzas, con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante aprovechando su juventud que de su matrimonio tiene 2 hijos los cuales ambos son menores de edad y dependen de ella en todo los aspectos uno esta en el kinder y el menor esta recién nacido. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el 4 grado y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ya que ellos son de bajos recursos económicos. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron la actividad de la agricultura a muy temprana edad enseñándole el cultivo y plantación de café siendo este el único medio de ingreso para su familia pudiendo cubrir las necesidades como la vestimenta, alimentación, medicinas entre otros. La tierra que ella junto a su esposo trabaja fue heredada por sus padres mismos que junto a su esposo da la asistencia, el mantenimiento y esta ubicada a una distancia de su casa de habitación de 4 kilómetros a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.   

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abono para su cultivo de café ya que hoy en día hay mucha plaga y enfermedades que deterioran los cultivos en su totalidad perdiendo todo de no tratar a tiempo. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos logren educarse para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida, un mejor futuro y puedan aprovechar las oportunidades que en un futuro se les presenten como también seguir aumentando su cultivo para obtener mejores ingresos ya que nuestra familia solo depende de este rubro para salir adelante.
texts.en: Ludim is a young woman. She is 21 years old and married. She is young and strong, and wants to get ahead and have a better life. Her 2 children are both minors and rely entirely on her. One of them is in kindergarten, the other is a newborn. Ludim had to stop going to school after 4th grade as her parents could not afford to continue sending her to school. They showed her how to farm when she was very young; planting and cultivating coffee was her family's only source of income, and allowed them to pay for basic needs - such as food, clothing, medicine. Her parents inherited the land that she works with her husband; the land provides for them. It is located 4 kilometers from her house but she and her husband walk there and back every day. At this time, she is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and compost to protect the coffee from blight and diseases that spoil the crops; if the coffee is not treated on time, the whole crop is lost. Her dream is that her children will be able to get an education so that they can have a better life and future, and so they can take advantage of opportunities in the future that may arise. She also hopes to keep increasing her output so she can have a better income since her family relies on this work alone to survive and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and compost to cultivate coffee

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
A married woman living in a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Chantha is 28 years old and has three children; two are in school, while the remaining one is still too young for school. Chantha is a teacher in the local area, and she is also a rice farmer. She has been in this business for several years, earning about 12,300 KHR (Cambodian riels) and saving about 4,000 KHR each day.

Chantha has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and fully repaid the past loans, which enabled her to relieve her family’s financial burden. Now requesting a loan of 1,500,000KHR, Chantha will use her loan to buy more plots of farmland. She hopes to expand her paddy business so as to better her living’s conditions.

loans.use: To buy more plots of farmland.

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut plans to use her new loan to purchase one more sow, having had success raising pigs. Her plan is to sell piglets to other breeders in other villages. In her village, Ni Ketut’s piglets are known to be good quality so they are easy to sell. Other members will use their loans to purchase piglets and pig feed or renovate the cages. With this business, the women in the group can support their husbands' incomes and fulfill their needs.

loans.use: To purchase a sow

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more grocery items and other products for her variety store. She has been in this business for five years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Regina dreams to have a bigger store and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene raises hogs for future sale, earning PHP 2,000 per hog sold. She is 27 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She would like to increase her income to sustain her family's daily needs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs' sustainability. 

Someday, she hopes to become a successful hog raiser which will help her educate all her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs' sustainability

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El Señor Mauro vive en Guayaquil (isla trinitaria), el tiene 38 años de edad, al comienzo empezó vendiendo llaveros, luego su esposa empezó a vender YAMBAL y accesorios para celular, lo cual ayuda a tener más ingreso  para el hogar, y así tubo mas productividad le gusta el comercio al que se dedica.

El trabaja junto con su esposa, trabajan de 5:00 de la mañana a 20:00 de la noche y lo realiza todos los días. El tiene dos dificultades en su negocio que es, la delincuencia, ya que en ocasiones abusan de su discapacidad. La otra es que en temporales invernales es casi imposible vender con normalidad.

El  está casado y su esposa vende YAMBAL y accesorios de celular, tiene 4 hijos estudian en escuela fiscales. Con el préstamo el comprara llaveros, productos YAMBAL, accesorios para teléfonos para así incrementar su negocio.

Sus sueños para el futuro son, disfrutar junto a su familia y poder darles una vida digna, desea comprarse un automóvil, según vendiendo sus productos, y accesorios.
texts.en:
Mauro lives in Guayaquil (Isla Trinitaria), He is 38 years old and married. They have four children who go to public school. He began by selling keychains, and his wife has begun to sell Yanbal beauty products and cell phone accessories. This helps them have more income for the household and be more productive. He likes the business that he works in.  

He works with his wife from 5:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening, and they do so every day. He has challenges in his business, such as crime, as occasionally people take advantage of him because of his disability. The other is that in the winter storms, it is is almost impossible to sell normally.

With the loan, he will buy keychains, Yanbal beauty products and cell phone accessories, so that they can increase their business.

His dream for the future is to enjoy spending time with his family, and to be able to give them a decent life. He wishes to buy a car, depending on sales of his goods and accessories.

loans.use: To buy keychains, perfumes and telephone items.

loans.name: Libia Rocio

texts.es:
Libia es una mujer de 52 años de edad, casada y con cinco hijos. Toda  su vida se dedicó a velar por el bienestar de su familia, pero debido a una difícil situación económica por la que atravesaron, Libia decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa para colaborar con los gastos del hogar y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia.
“la educación de mis hijos siempre ha sido mi prioridad, sacarlos adelante y ofrecerles mejores oportunidades de vida se constituyó en mi mayor reto, por lo cual decidí trabajar y garantizarles el acceso a la educación superior”. Con estas palabras Libia cuenta la razón que la motivó a convertirse en una microempresaria.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de mercancía con el propósito cumplir con varios encargos solicitados y aumentar sus ventas, generando mejores ingresos para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Libia is a 52-year-old woman who is married and has five children. She has dedicated her entire life to providing for the welfare of her family. Due to a difficult financial situation that they had to endure, Libia decided to sell clothes in order to contribute toward the household expenses and improve her family’s economic condition.

“The education of my children has always been my priority. Helping them move forward and offering them better opportunities in life have been my greatest challenges, so I decided to work to ensure that they had access to higher education.” The words expressed by Libia indicate her reason for becoming a micro-entrepreneur.

The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy merchandise so that she can fulfill several orders that have been submitted to her. This will increase her sales and generate more income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
This is Dolores. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit used in a transportation business. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dolores hopes to have more tricycles and dreams to have a good life for her whole family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Tsetsegsuren

texts.en: Tsetsegsuren is a 46-year-old female head of family who lives with her four children in a ger in Amgalan area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her older children Byambazaya, Byambazul and Myagmarnaran work at local companies and younger son Lhagva-Ochir, age 15, goes to a local school. The borrower has been working as a saleswoman in a grocery store's organic vegetable section for more than 10 years. She has started her own business of organic vegetable retail in the local market's rental counter. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase large quantities of organic vegetables to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, well-experienced and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of organic vegetables to sell to local customers

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
This loan will help Martha purchase materials to supply her large contracts with the United Nations Development Program.

While living in Colombia, Martha managed her own trade company that shipped Columbian products to international markets.  After moving to the U.S. in 2001, Martha wanted to continue her career working in international trade. In 2006, Martha began G & V Distribution Corp, a company that markets and exports technology products—including electronics, office equipment, and communications devices, as well as health and beauty products. Additionally, Martha is now working closely with the United Nations Development Program to supply electronic goods to Latin America.

Martha’s company supports her two daughters and husband – both living with her in Winter Springs, FL, as well as her mother who lives in Venezuela.

This loan will help Martha to complete her large orders from the United Nations program and will help her grow her company across Latin America.

You can view Martha’s website here: http://gv-distribution.com

loans.use: To purchase materials to meet the demand of her company's large contracts.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.en:
Nidia, originally from the Dominican Republic, founded Honey’s Lounge & Restaurant in 2004, a restaurant and convenience store located in Baltimore, Maryland. 

Nidia has been involved in the business sector since she was a child, when she worked in her father’s grocery store in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic.  Currently Nidia and her daughter work in Honey’s Lounge, continuing the family tradition.  Nidia has been a business owner and entrepreneur for the last 20 years. She feels proud that her business has helped her to pay for the education of four of her kids who already graduated from college. 

Nidia is asking for a loan of $10,000 to complete the renovation of her business. The restaurant is currently closed due to renovation and is expected to reopen in late spring 2013.

loans.use: to complete the renovation of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tomato seeds

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita has run a tailoring business for forty years. She is an expert tailor within her locality. At age 64, she still aims for a progressive business. 

With her determination to have an improved financial stability, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to allow her to buy stocks of garments and thread for her tailoring business. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her way of living and obtain a better income for her family needs. 

Pepita is looking forward to the success of her tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy garments and thread for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for merchandise items like men's and women's clothing, slippers and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Robelin

texts.en: Robelin is engaged in a retail business where she sells soap and shampoo to her village. She has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 1,000 a week. Robelin is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more soap (both bar and powder) and shampoo to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy more soap (bar and powder) and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
This is Ofelia, 50, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is the mother of one child and she manages their household with his help.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ofelia operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home textiles. There is seasonal demand for clothing like uniforms all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php14, 000 loan. She will use this loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.

Ofelia dreams of having more customers and hopes to give her child a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 59 years old, married, and has five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Monina has been farming rice for 20 years and earns additional income from buying and selling of piglets.

Monina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
Marlith, tiene 40 años, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos pequeños con quienes  vive en su casa propia junto a su madre .Nuestra amiga Marlith se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas y otros productos como gelatina, hielo y dulces elaborados con frutas tropicales. Lleva en esta actividad más de 10 años y afortunadamente le va bien ya que diariamente recibe buenas ganancias. Trabaja sola ya que para cumplir esta función no necesita ayuda , sin embargo, también vende comida y ahí si recibe el apoyo de su madre y de sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la atención, lavado de utensilios, cobranzas, entre otros. Vende en la vereda de su casa desde hace 08 años y siempre termina todo lo que diariamente pone a la venta .Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, porque de ésta forma hace más amena sus largas horas de trabajo. Más adelante espera poder construir un local en donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.Este es el crédito número 03 con Kiva y está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1200 soles comprará ingredientes para continuar con su negocio de venta de comida, además comprará bebidas gasificadas y gelatina para seguir vendiendo sus productos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Marlith is 40 years old, and is a single mother who lives with her two small children and her mother. Marlith makes a living selling soft drinks and food dishes, including gelatin desserts, popsicles and sweets that she makes from tropical fruit. She has ten years experience in this trade, and business is going well. Marlith mostly works on her own, though for some of her catering needs, her mother and children will assist her with washing dishes, prepping food and receiving payments from customers. Marlith has been selling her food dishes and products at a stand on the sidewalk outside her home for the past eight years, and she always works hard to provide high quality food for her customers.

The aspects that Marlith likes best about her job are the conversations she gets to have each day with her clients, as those interactions help make long work days seem much shorter. In the future, she hopes to build her own store for selling food dishes and offering improved services to her clients. This is her third Kiva loan, and she is very grateful for the financial support she has received to help make her business and dreams a reality. She promises to continue her history of prompt repayments, and plans to use the support from this loan to purchase soft drinks and ingredients for making her food dishes.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients and soft drinks for her catering business.

loans.name: Haana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Haana está compuesto por siete integrantes todas son personas del mismo municipio, se conocen muy bien, llevan una muy buena amistad es un grupo que lleva varios ciclos solicitando crédito a la institución. El nombre del grupo lo eligió Adriana una de las integrantes del grupo y lo puso porque una de sus hijas se llama precisamente “Haana”, además Adriana fue una de las personas que inicio el grupo. 

Vero quien quedo como representante del grupo platica que tiene 33 años de edad está casada con el señor Victor Manuel desde hace 12 años juntos han formado una familia con dos niños de los cuales solo uno estudia. Vero tiene una taquería la cual tiene ya 2 años. Vero argumentó “Iniciamos la taquería porque mi suegro siempre se dedicó a vender tacos de cabeza, mi esposo siempre lo estuvo apoyando y fue como aprendió a preparar los tacos” Vero cuenta que anteriormente tenían una tienda de abarrotes pero tuvieron que cerrarla ya que no obtenían ganancias, pero también comenta "Todos los fines de semana vendian tacos afuera de la tienda de abarrotes y vendiamos muy bien" Fue como tambien se vieron motivados a iniciar con su taqueria Vero platica "Afortunadamente tenemos mucho trabajo en las mañanas que son los desayunos, almuerzos y en la tarde que son las comidas" Su unica dificultad es en este tiempo de cuaresma donde no se come carne roja y las ventas han bajado mucho. Pero sabe que esta temporada solo es pasajera y podra sacar adelante su negocio en otras epocas. Vero sueña que algun dia ella tenga empleados que atiendan el negocio porque es mucho trabajo ahora que estan iniciando todos los comensales llegan a la misma hora.
Asi como Vero tiene sueños tambien los otros integrantes del grupo como Don Martin invertira en la venta de ropa, Bertha invertira en sus borregos, Adriana comprara una res, Pablo invertira en servicio dental, Maria de la Luz invertira en Colchas y Maria Alin invertira en Ropa y zapatos. Todos ellos estan muy contentos y agradecidos con la institucion por el credito otorgado ya que para ellos ha sido de gran ayuda para sacar adelante a su negocio y familia.
texts.en:
The Haana Group is made up of 7 members who are all from the same municipality and know each other very well and share a very strong friendship. This group has participated in various loan cycles at the institution. The group's name was chosen by one of the group's members, Adriana, who called it "Haana" because that is the name of one of her daughters. Adriana was one of the founding members of the group.  

Group member Vero is 33 years old and has been married to Victor Manuel for 12 years. Together they have formed a family in which they have two children, one of which is studying. Vero has had a taco restaurant called "Fernanda" for the last two years. She says, "we started the taco restaurant because my father-in-law made a living selling head tacos, and my husband was always helping and that's how he learned to make tacos." 

Vero says that they used to have a grocery store, but they had to close it because they did not earn as much income as before and it was difficult to recoup their losses.  But she also says, "Every weekend we sold tacos outside of the grocery store and we sold a lot."  That was the motivation for starting the taco stand, Vero notes, "Fortunately, we have a lot of work; in the mornings we serve breakfast, lunch, and the evening we serve dinner." The only difficulty is that this time of year is Lent, when red meat isn't eaten and sales drop.  But she knows that the season is temporary and that sales will be better soon.  Vero dreams that one day she will have employees that tend the business because it's a lot of work when all her customers arrive at the same time. 
The other members of the group have dreams as well, Martin will invest in the sale of clothes, Bertha will invest in her sheep, Adriana will buy cattle, Pablo will invest in dental services, Maria de la Luz will buy bedding, and Maria Alin will invest in clothes and shoes.  They are all very happy and thank the institution for the credit given them, which has been a great help in improving their businesses and families.

loans.use: to equip a taco restaurant

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old and a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosalie has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more fish to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 3 years. Rosalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 20 years old and newly married. To earn a living, she engages in the cooking and selling of fish balls, barbecue and halo-halo(refreshment) snacks in their community. She and her husband help each other in generating income for the sake of their family. Their aim is to earn and save more income to build their own house someday. Jennifer plans to improve and strengthen the business in order to generate sufficient income. Due to financial difficulties, she is asking for Php5,000.00 to buy raw ingredients like fish, pork & chicken for barbecue and halo-halo (refreshment ) snacks. She hopes that her loan will enable her to make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like fish, pork & chicken for barbecue and halo-halo (refreshment ) snacks

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 37, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, a mason/carpenter, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Virginia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece, with a retail mark-up. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages, to expand her product inventory.

Virginia hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having their own house and lot.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the group and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, for her business inventory

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five year.s

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy ingredients for her food preparation business.

Lanie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
This is Marcelina, 61, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Paulino and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Marcelina is a egg retailer. What she basically does is buy eggs from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Marcelina is requesting a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional stocks of salted and unsalted eggs.

Marcelina dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that she will have more customers that will patronize her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of salted and unsalted eggs for her business.

loans.name: Guljan

texts.ru: Гулжан 50 лет,вдова, воспитала 5 детей. Младший сын живет вместе с Гулжан, ему 23 года. После развала СССР, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Гулжан начала свой бизнес в Животноводстве и растениеводстве со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Гулжан сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве у Гулжан имеется 3 голов КРС, 1 лошадь и  30 овец ,  Гулжан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения коров. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса и часть – откладывать на свадьбу дома и благосостояние семьи
texts.en:
Guljan is 50 years old. She is a widow who has raised five children. Her youngest son lives together with her. He is 23 years old. 

Guljan started her business of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation after the collapse of the Soviet Union, in search of a source of income for her family, with a starting sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to perseverance and hard work, Guljan was able to develop her business to a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS). Currently Guljan has three heads of cattle, one horse and 30 sheep at her farm. 

Guljan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows. Guljan plans to invest the income from the loan in developing her business and party to save for a wedding at home and the family welfare.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru: Марине 37 лет, замужем, воспитывает трех дочерей и двоих сыновей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2004 года Марина занимается животноводством. Стартовав с суммы в 8,000 сом (KGS), Марина смогла развить хозяйство численностью в 2 дойной коровы и 1,44 га земли в обработке. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марина обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков. Доходы Марина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Marina is 37 years old, married and raising three daughters and two sons. As a main source of income for her family, Marina has worked with livestock breeding since 2004. After having started with an amount of 8,000 som (KGS), Marina was able to develop her business to count two dairy cows and 1.44 hectares of land to process. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Marina turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of three bulls. Marina plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: To purchase three bulls

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia. She previously obtained a 12,000 PHP loan that she used buy larger quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, of 15,000 PHP, for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucia dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, for her food vending business

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business, trading in piglets, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She also earns income from buying and selling of rice.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is a 41-year-old, married woman, and a mother of four children, from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her place. Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, rice, sugar, soda, soap and toiletries. With this larger inventory, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Zenaida hopes to continue making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, rice, sugar, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Perizat

texts.ru: Перизат 27 лет, замужем, имеет 1 сына ему 2 годика. Перизат занимается полеводством и животноводством, став опорой для мужа, который ранее вел этот бизнес. Благодаря упорному труду Перизат в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2,45 га земли, где она выращивает фасоль и картофель и 1 корова и 1 бычок. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Перизат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 8 голов овец. Доходы от кредита Перизат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Perizat is 27 years old, married and has one son. He is two years old. Perizat works with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding, after having taken over for her husband who ran the business earlier. Thanks to persistent work, Perizat currently has one cow, one steer and 2.45 hectares of land on her farm, where she grows beans and potatoes. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Perizat turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of eight sheep. Perizat plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: To purchase eight sheep

loans.name: Azina

texts.ru: Азина 36 лет, замужем. Мать 3-х детей. Муж и сыновья помогают Азина в ведении бизнеса. Сейчас Азина занимается животноводством и полеводством. Свой бизнес она начала с 10,000 сом в 1998 году. Ежемесячный доход Азина составляет около 10,000 KGS. По характеру человек очень честный и целеустремленный. Все что она добилась, она добилась благодаря её трудолюбию. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на приобретение семян, удобрений и ГСМ. На вырученные средства Азина собирается улучшить свои жилищные условия, оплатить за обучение детей.
texts.en:
Azina is 36 years old and married. She is the mother of three children. Her husband and sons help Azina to manage the business. Currently Azina works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. She started her business with 10,000 som (KGS) in 1998. Azina's monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS). She is a very honest and purposeful person by character. All that she achieves is achieved thanks to her diligence. 

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuels and lubricants. Azina has decided to use the return to increase her living conditions and pay tuition for her children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Doña Nicolasa es una mujer feliz, luchadora, emprendedora y que a pesar de sus 57 años de edad ella no deja de soñar en grande ella tiene un grado de educación primario no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado casada y de su matrimonio tiene 5 hijos de los cuales ayudan con actividades como ser corte, lavado y secado específicamente el maíz y frijoles que también cultivan café. Ella aprendió esta actividad hace más de 6 años inculcada por hoy en día su esposo. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en los alrededores de su hogar con algunos vecinos y personas que lo comercializa en pequeña escala en el mercado local y otros. Esta actividad les ha dado fruto por mucho tiempo y es el único medio de ingreso que ellos tienen para el sustento de su familia y su hogar cubriendo las necesidades básicas como ser alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas, etc. Que a diario se presentan.

Ella solicita ayuda para poder comprar insumos ya que ellos necesitan mejorar y fortalecer sus cultivos de manera que se pueda obtener más ingresos con la compra de semillas certificadas y limpias.

Sus sueños a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café, maíz y frijol la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación por sus hijos, sus nietos, y las próximas generaciones que puedan aprovechar el esfuerzo y la dedicación de ella y de su esposo.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a happy, determined and enterprising woman who, despite her 57 years of age, doesn't stop dreaming big. She has a primary level education of grade 3, is married and has 5 children whom help her with activities such as cutting, washing and drying specifically corn and beans, as well they grow coffee. She learned this activity over 6 years ago instilled nowadays by her husband.

Her products are marketed and sold in the neighbourhoods around her home with some neighbours and people who sell in small scale in local and other markets. This activity has given them results for a long time and is the only means of income that they have to sustain their family and their home, covering the basic necessities such as food, clothing, medicines, etc... which occurs daily.

She is requesting help to be able to buy supplies since they need to improve and fortify their crops so that it is possible to obtain more income with the purchase of certified and clean seeds.

Their dream for the future is to have a large coffee plantation and corn and bean crop which can continue to give them blessings, family support and that can be worked on for generation to generation by their children, grandchildren, and the next generations, so they can take advantage of her and her husband's efforts and dedication.

loans.use: to buy corn, bean and coffee seeds for her crops.

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut lives in the village of Sumberkima in north Bali. Ni Ketut helps her husband - who works as a fisherman - with the income by running a pig business in her home.

In order to expand the business, Ni Ketut raises capital by way of joining the group Sumber Tanjung, where she was chosen by other members as the head of the group. They work together with MUK to get business loans for pig farmers.

With the loan of 1.5 million IDR, Ni Ketut is planning to buy three piglets at the price of 500,000 IDR each. Although the price of feed is currently very expensive, Ni Ketut expects the sale of the three pigs later will gain a satisfactory profit and can increase the income of her husband.

loans.use: to buy 3 piglets.

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Batdorj is 29 years old, and he lives with his wife and two children, in a small house in Tosontsengel soum, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife Dolgormaa, age 26, works at home, providing tailoring services. His daughter Oyunjargal, age 4, and son Sanjsuren, age 2, go to local kindergarten. 

Borrower has been working with his wife since 2008. Since then, they have had two babies and their family expenses have doubled. Soon they will be increasing even more. Therefore, Batdorj is now planning to start a transportation service business. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a truck with which to start providing transportation services. He is a hard-working, well-experienced and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase a truck, with which to start up his new transportation services business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Direct selling is Ofelia's business. She has been in this business for three years and usually earns about PHP 2,500 a month. Ofelia is 48 years old now and is married to Roger. They have been blessed with three children. Ofelia dreams of lifting her family from poor living, and that's why she works hard at her simple business. Right now, Ofelia is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy lotion, perfume,  powder and lipstick to offer and sell in their village. Ofelia hopes to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy lotion, perfume, powder and lipstick to offer and sell

loans.name: Akylai

texts.ru: Акылай 55 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Акылай на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Акылай в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коров и земельный надел 7 га где она выращивает фасоль,картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Акылай составляет 11,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Акылай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 8 овец для увеличения доходов от перепродажи скота. Доходы от кредита Акылай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Akylai is 55 years old, married, and has four children. For a period of 20 years, Akylai has worked with livestock breeding, after having started this business with an amount of 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Akylai currently has two cows and a plot of land of 7 hectares where she grows beans, potatoes, crops and sainfoin (a herb). The monthly income from Akylai's business is 11,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Akylai turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of eight sheep to increase the income from reselling livestock. Akylai plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: To purchase eight sheep

loans.name: Esfuerzo De Las Flores Group

texts.es: En Villarrica se encuentra el Banco Comunal El Esfuerzo de Las Flores, en donde la mayoría de sus socios se dedican a la artesanía, y unos pocos a la lencería, librería, ropa y leña;  una de las socias que acá encontramos es  la señora Carmen, en la foto de encuentra al extremo superior derecho bajo un papel azul y una estrella, es comerciante de ropa y artesanía en lana y madera. Ella comenzó hace muchos años su negocio, pero al no poder ser constante por diversos factores tuvo que dejar de  trabajar, lo cual ayudo a impulsar la idea de tener su propio negocio y así independizarse. Uno de los problemas que tuvo fue el no tener la libertad para  independizarse, ya que sus ganas siempre han sido el poder trabajar en artesanía, y así el préstamo le podrá ayudar para comprar ropa en general, y lana, para crear dichas artesanías como lo son bufandas, guantes, gorros,  sweters. Ella espera tener una muy buena acogida con todo lo que comprará para poder empezar a concretar su sueño, ya que además con su Banco Comunal han podido hacer muchos contactos con pueblos cercanos, lo que los ayudará para ir a vender también su mercadería en esos lugares, o ir instalándose en distintas ferias artesanales. Destaca que lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar en Fondo Esperanza, es que se ha sentido muy bien en cuenta a la comunicación que existe con su asesora y la oficina de Villarrica, esta agradecida por toda la ayuda prestada por Fondo Esperanza, además por el gran grupo en el que se ha transformado su Banco Comunal.
texts.en: The El Esfuerzo de Las Flores communal bank is located in Villarrica, where most of the members are artists and a few sell lingerie, books, clothing, and firewood.  Carmen is one of the members.  She is located in the top right hand side of the picture, below the blue paper and a star.  She sells clothing, arts in wool, and lumber.  She began her business many years ago, but she was not able to continue due to many factors, but this helped motivate here idea of having her own business.  One of the problems she had was not having the freedom to venture off on her own.  She has always wanted to work in art and she will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, yarn to make her crafts such as scarves, gloves, hats, and sweaters.  She hopes to have good response to what she buys so that she can begin to solidify her dream.  She has also been able to make good contacts in nearby towns through the communal bank.  This will help her make sales in these areas, or in various artesian fairs.  She stresses that what she has enjoyed about working with Fondo Esperanza is that she has felt very good about the communication with her advisor from the Villarrica office.  She is grateful for all the help that she gets from Fondo Esperanza and for the great group that her communal bank has become.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es una mujer de 34 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Felicita no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia con mucho empeño y dedicación, Felicita se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene una pequeña parcela en donde siembra tuna y cultiva cochinilla, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana, ella puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas y se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia.
Felicita se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de infestación de su cultivo con cochinilla,ya que desea aumentar la cantidad de cochinilla para una futura venta en los mercados de su ciudad,así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda para poder brindarles mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Felicita is a 34-year-old woman who lives in the city of Nazca with her two children, whom she loves and who are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all her efforts to moving her family forward, since she is the mother and father to her children. 

Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the necessity she had to work since she was very young, Felicita couldn't study for a professional career. In her free time she likes to watch television and on some occasions she cooks a delicious Red Noodle dish to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Felicita has made her living in agriculture. She has a small plot of land where she sows cactus to cultivate cochineal.  She works every day beginning early in the morning. She can do work for approximately six hours a day and she feels happy doing her work. She thinks it is going well for her based on her experience.

Felicita is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they offer she can cover the expenses of infesting her cactus crop with cochineal. In this way, she hopes to increase the quantity of cochineal for future sales in the market of her city. Thus she will continue working and making an effort to get ahead and achieve her great dream of finishing the construction of her home to be able to offer better security and well-being to her family.

loans.use: to cultivate cochineal

loans.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Because of the high price of feed, the Sumber Rahayu group is requesting another loan for the same amount. All members attended the meeting at the time the funds were disbursed. Each member gets 1.5 million IDR. The loan will be used to buy piglets and quality feed.

Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy two superior piglets and quality feed. To reduce costs, she gives the pigs a feed mixture. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not be attacked by disease. If she has enough savings, she will raise the pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and quality feed.

loans.name: Genecita

texts.en:
Genecita is 40 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling of used clothing.

Genecita requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to resell in her store, like shampoo, vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, and canned goods.
She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF, before this loan. 

She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to resell in her store, like shampoo, vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, and canned goods

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy's business is her general store, which she has had for almost four years. She is 47 years old and is married with two children. Remy dreams of lifting up her children from poor living; that's why she is always busy managing their sari-sari store (general store) business. 

Remy wants to re-stock her business, but she lacks the necessary capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP to buy cooking oil, assorted bread, condiments, beverages, and curls to sell. 

She hopes for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, assorted bread, condiments, beverages, and curls to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos, 1 ainda continua com os seus estudos, vive na casa do pai e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante e dona do negócio de venda de frangos de corte. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação. 
No futuro pensa em construir um estabelecimento comercial em sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir juntar todo o material para a construção do estabelecimento.
texts.en:
Cecilia is single and has two children, one of whom is still studying. She lives in her father's house and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant and runs her own business selling broiler chickens. With the current loan she intends to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins in order to increase the number of chickens she raises.
She thinks of someday building a store in her house. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is gathering all the supplies to build the store.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins in order to increase the number of chickens she raises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise (rice, cooking oil, beans, soap, noodles, etc.).

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 33 years old. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 300 PHP daily. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase spare parts and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Ubay, Bohol. Zenaida has been engaged in the rice farming business, together with her husband, for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy new fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. 

In the future, Zenaida hopes to make their farming business sustainable and a success.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old, has three children, and has been widowed for two years now. All her children have now finished their education. She provides sustenance to her children through her income from selling grocery items to the people in her village.

Lorna is still hoping for financial stability. That is why she is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, soft drinks, soap, and shampoo to sell.

Lorna doesn't want to rely on her children's remittances. That is why she hopes to keep improving her income to achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, soft drinks, soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 37 years old, single, and operates a retail store for a living. She sells grocery items from 6am-6pm and acquires 10,000 PHP each month. The income is used for meals, bills at home, and revolving capital in the business. 

She hopes to increase her sales and income, but has insufficient capital to buy more merchandise to sell. Because of this, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, soft drinks, soap, and shampoo to sell.

Noemi wants to keep selling good products and services in order to achieve income stability someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, soft drinks, soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Castigo

texts.pt:
Solteiro e pai de 1 filho que ainda não frequenta Escola, vive na casa dos pais e não sustenta mais ninguém para além do seu filho.
É comerciante e dono do negócio de criação e venda de frangos de corte. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, ração, vitaminas e vacinas para aumentar a quantidade de seus frangos. 
No futuro deseja continuar a ampliar a sua capoeira para garantir o crescimento do seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar o seu rendimento.
texts.en:
Castigo is single and has a son who doesn't go to school yet. He lives in his parents' house and doesn't support anyone else other than his son.
He's a merchant and runs his own business raising and selling broiler chickens. With the current loan he intends to purchase chicks, feed, vitamins and vaccines in order to increase the number of chickens he raises.
His wish for the future is to enlarge his hutch so that he'll ensure the expansion of his business. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is improving his profits.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, vitamins and vaccines in order to raise and sell broiler chickens.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filho, que frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria com o seu filho e sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele.
É negociante e dona do seu próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (óleo, farinha, arroz, peixe, sabão e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja investir ainda mais no seu negócio e apostar também na agricultura, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir mais uma fonte de aumentar o rendimento para a família.
texts.en:
Maria is single and has a son who attends school. She lives with her son in a house she owns and also supports a nephew who lives with her.
She's a merchant and runs her own business selling various products. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (cooking oil, flour, rice, fish, soap, etc.) in order to stock up with merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to invest in her business even more and also try her hand at agriculture. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is getting another source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods (cooking oil, flour, rice, fish, soap, etc.) in order to stock up with merchandise.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 34 years-old and married with four children. She is operating a store that sells grocery items to the people who visit her store. She is now asking for a loan of P15,000 in order to buy soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs and bread to sell. This will help increase the sales capacity.

Someday she hopes to keep selling more goods and develop her income for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs and bread to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden lives in Sampaguita with her spouse (a laborer) and they have three children. She is 33 years-old and provides manicure and pedicure services to the people in her village. She hopes to improve her small business and that is why she is asking for a loan of P6,000 in order to buy nail polish and acetone to use for her manicure services. Though she only gains a minimal income from the business, she hopes to keep improving it and gain customer loyalty so that she will supplement her spouses income and achieve income stability someday.

loans.use: to buy nail polish and acetone to use for manicure services.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has been engaged in the direct selling business for four years. She is now generating a monthly net income of PHP 4,000. She is glad that through patience she was able to improve her small enterprise. She would like to borrow at least PHP 15,000 in order to purchase perfume, lotion and deodorant. With this amount, she can sell more products.  This will allow her to hopefully save some of her income for the education of their children and to have their dream house someday. 

Marites is 39 years-old. She is married to Arnold and they had been blessed with three children. Her family is happily residing in Barangay Sto. Tomas, Alicia.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, lotion and deodorant.

loans.name: Al-Wad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Wad and it consists of three ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 180,000 YER.

Reham is a 29 year-old married woman. She is the leader of the group. She completed secondary school and her husband is the only breadwinner. As time passes, their house has grown old and needs renovation quickly. The house is vulnerable to fall down at any time. It is known that such thing needs a lot of money. She has started renovating her house but now she is in short of money. She needs to complete the renovation task, so she asked for a loan of 60,000 YER in order to buy construction supplies to use for their house. She hopes that after completion of the house renovation, she will feel safe in her house with her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for house.

loans.name: Dahlia

texts.en:
Dahlia operates a retail store to generate income. She sells grocery items from 6am-7pm and acquires about P10,000 each month. 

Dahlia is 47 years-old and married to a tricycle driver.  They have two children. She is now asking for a loan of P25,000 in order to invest in buying more merchandise to sell in her store. She will buy soft drinks, breads, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help her improve her income and meet the demands of customers who come to buy merchandise from her store. 

In the future, Dahlia hopes to keep improving sales and to earn money to save and use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales, de fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 8ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou (femme assise  en haut sur la photo à l’extrême droite) est une grande vendeuse de riz dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz avec les exploitants à la foire de Konodimini. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et dans la foire de Konodimini  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Korotoumou   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The six women of the "Tièssiri" group are married and live mostly in polygamous households. They are on average 46 years old with five children. They all live in the town of N'gara in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighbourhood and family connections as well as through the businesses they run in the town. They sell cereals, fruits, and vegetables. With the goal of increasing their capital, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their eighth solidarity (group) loan cycle.
Ms. Korotoumou (the woman sitting in the second row all the way on the right in the photo) is a major rice seller in the town of N'gara and its surroundings. She intends to use her loan to buy two sacks of rice from the farmers at the market fair in Konodimini. She resells the rice in cash and on credit at her home and at the market in Konodimini to a clientele composed mainly of women. Ms. Korotoumou hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for the children in her household.

loans.use: To buy rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy five rolls of poplin, two packets of clasps, jewerlry, and three boxes of soap.

loans.name: Assétou

texts.fr:
Âgée de 32 ans, Madame Assétou est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie avec son époux et ses enfants à Kaboïla II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso     ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Assétou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des spaghettis depuis plus de deux ans. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
